X7kYIcjIcz0P4inuvhNamA.text: I have been to this place several times and keep giving it another chance. Due largely to my friends who like this place. The food is okay, nothing special. Today, I was with a party of six, one of them happen to be on crutches. When we made the reservations we told the host of this, and asked for a table on the upper level, but when we got there we were led to the stairs and sat on the lower level. When asked about this the reply was there is a person in a wheelchair, so only one handicapped person is allowed on the upper level at a time??  Our waiter did not introduce himself and was cold and not personable, we ordered coffees and I was given a cup that had a large crack running thru it, when I asked for another cup the waiter acted surprised that I did not want to drink from a cracked cup. My omelette was over cooked and lacked favor (there was no salt or pepper on the table) the mushroom, tomato goat cheese filling was like a second thought and was not integrated into the omelette, the breakfast potatoes (which I actually ordered french fries) were over fried and oily.   Our group which almost always orders desserts look at the dessert menu and felt underwhelmed by the most uninspiring dessert menu.  On a positive note the setting is very beautiful and on a nice day is quite enjoyable with a nice glass of wine.

zwiwjaP5M1q7xpXal0yMhA.text: My family and I enjoyed the Prix Fixe Thanksgiving Turkey Dinner.  The setting made everything beautiful next to the water with ducks, swans and even a cat!  The atmosphere upscale but yet relaxed.  We felt as if we were at someone's home outside under the tent with heat lamps in the 40/50 degree evening weather.  The food was very good, starting with the chestnut soup, so superb with nutmeg and spices, then the turkey dinner with brussel sprouts, piles of great turkey, dressing which I thought needed some more veggies and spice.  The dessert nice (we all got to go) pumpkin pie with a divine caramel sauce and cream fraiche possibly topping.  I give a five for the cost as the food could have been even more distinct for what we paid for.  Thank you overall, though, for a very nice evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0ROMTtmy05lOte70Cfgvfg.text: We were looking for a high end dinner without the high end price tag and hustle and bustle of the Las Vegas Strip, and Marche Bacchus delivered in all regards. Situated along Lake Jacqueline 10 minutes from the strip, the outdoor covered patio set a beautiful, relaxing setting for a delicious meal. We opted to select a bottle of wine from the wine shop to drink with our dinner, and the man running the wine shop was a knowledgable and helpful aid in our decision. My husband and I started the evening by sharing a pot full of Prince Edward Island mussels, before ordering entrees of the red wine braised beef and beef tenderloin with wild mushrooms. Everything was outstanding, from the food to the atmosphere to the highly attentive staff. I would definitely recommend this restaurant if you're looking for a romantic, low key meal away from the flashiness of the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NWMNQkvw2HzxSWemG_TQSA.text: Yikes! This place is a mess! Only giving 2 stars because the view and outdoor patio area are lovely. Otherwise the entrance is a disaster. Boxes everywhere. They really need a makeover in this area. Our food came out wrong and instead of replacing It right away the server attempted to argue with me saying I ordered the wrong thing? I know what I ordered. Long story short we were there for 2 hours and when we FINALLY got our salmon Benedict it was nothing special. $60 later (for two Benedicts and two soups), we left so very disappointed. If you are looking for a nice and not too fancy French brunch I would recommend Bardot at Aria or even Mon Ami Gabi over this place.

ckhbJ_jOmPXtMykKXxdP7A.text: Only went to sit and have a glass of wine with a friend. What a beautiful getaway! "4" because the service was so slow I felt forgotten about.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet serenity:)

sO3TF0uLSVBl29uLLD6faQ.text: It's a Beautiful place to unwind and relax and that's probably why I picked this place to celebrate my birthday with my friends. The food was great I love the concept of just picking the bottle of wine and consume it while your pairing it with your meal. That being said I wished we had a better service to complete the throughout experience. Our server was not attentive and she was a little bit rude. For instance, as she was pouring the wine into my Chablis glass she didn't use the serviette as she should have to wipe off the water that was dripping from the bottle of wine, therefore the water end up inside my goblet glass that I was drinking. My point is she should have a serviette as it's a wine place in the first place. And if someone asked to switch to a different wine glass, should get a different glass as every wine has a different flavor into it. Will definitely come back but hopefully I'll have a better experience next time.

co5EPE16NkT9pYoOT_EfPQ.text: I've visited a handful of times for special occasions. The food is excellent; the atmosphere is even better!  Our most recent visit was March 2015 for our anniversary and the maitre de sat us in a perfect, private spot right on the water front. Our waiter was excellent and made excellent recommendations.  There wasn't any good left on any of the plates. I'm glad Vegas has this hidden gem!!

wXACcWjnDivNkyff_saYpg.text: Staff is friendly and awesome and goes above any beyond!   But the female owner or manager is such a heinous catty women!  I hated how she talked down to EVERYONE...including ME!  I feel bad for her staff!

tilQy5JtHrWFo6gRkD8wKw.text: Romantic and French on a lake in Las Vegas? It actually exists.Vive la France! Honestly this is the creme de la creme of restaurants as far as ambiance is concerned in the desert. Marche Bacchus sports a lovely wine shop upon entrance. While you are waiting to be sat at a table you browse through the selections and choose your wine. It's quite an enjoyable experience as you prepare yourself for a selection to take home as well. The wines are labeled with tasting notes, a dine-in price (corkage cost), as well as a take away price.   The dining is a mix of wine bar, indoor table seating and outside patio. There are fans and misters so that helps with the Vegas heat (or cool down with a freezing cold white). The floor to ceiling window enclosure on the patio open wide to the lake, with the passing families of ducks and lovely foliage that surrounds the space. The staff is friendly. The food is french bistro style. Time to time there is a lovely singer and her husband on the keyboard singing classic European songs (think - That's amore...)   It's on a lake in Las Vegas you can't get much better then that. It's romantic but pricey so make sure the date is a sure thing!  Oh the reason the one star is missing is because the service is hit or miss. We've been a couple of times now and the last time, we were practically ignored. We had our bottle which was getting very warm. We even asked the server for a wine opener since they were to busy to notice we had not been served and finally we poured our beautiful, delicious reisling (ourselves) into our water glasses, our waiter had dissappeared claiming to be getting our wine glasses - the horror - was the only way (for the wine snobs). Once noticed though, it was all good. After all its a restaurant in Vegas on a Lake. I forgave them!! Just hope it was an extremely busy day and this is not a habit.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MyNtAezDYAo5eQ6Yyt0Udw.text: Definitely deserves more than 3.5 stars. Marche Bacchus is a great wine shop and bistro nestled on the lake. Highly recommended for a great wine selection and French appetizers.

_0f5_egba4KtpBmfkbCj9w.text: Fantastic. We ate at the Eiffel the night before, which is great French food, and then happened on Marche Bacchus before a hike at Red Rock Canyon. Marche Bacchus is brilliant, delicious- both traditional French and also somewhat experimental. The wine store and wine list are perfect. I would go back every day if I was near! Can you open one in our next of the woods!?!?!

h_DrsXP-cru1qXNHerpawg.text: Wow!  What a delicious meal in a tranquil, beautiful setting.  The food is really superb.  I ordered the beef cheek (hard to find unless you are in exclusive places) and it was perfect.  Just the right foods   Also, the in house wine store is quaint and has great prices (I know these wines well and they are half of what other stores charge for them).  Also, the prices are just enough to keep out the cheapskate and riff raff.  After all, those people can go to the junk dining places like Outback, Olive Garden, and Claim jumper and keep eating that slop!

xs36UHvlBhIdfHnGOq9-zQ.text: What a lovely retreat from the hustle and heat of downtown Vegas.  Past the cozy wine store is a restaurant with a stellar view of the lake (apparently, we have those in Vegas!).  The instant you sit down on your patio table you are transported to a European vacation with blue waters and a warm breeze.  There are even ducks and black swans that swim right up to you.  I don't know what they put in my fancy water but I felt extremely happy in this place.  The food was presented beautifully.  Some were savory, while others bordered on bland.  Still delicious, and I would definitely go back.  The portions are quite conservative however, so if you are a hefty man, make sure you order the steak.. twice.  The awesome waitress and chef brought out a complimentary fruit bowl for my little man.  This is a picture perfect place for any occasion, and a must try for wine connoisseurs.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio of Chocolate Mousse
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake with Raspberries
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Scallops with a freakishly pretty breed of broccoli meets cauliflower

eIQWrVyb1l2iqNcmXXen0Q.text: Shame on me for not reviewing MB yet!  This gem is on the water (yes, a an actual, albiet man-made, water-way in Las Vegas) in Summerlin. Be sure to sit on the patio and be ready to feel as if you aren't in our beautiful desert climate. On your way out you can peruse their wine shop and pick out a bottle to accompany dinner. I like my bubbles, so insisted on champagne and a bottle of white.  I wasn't as impressed with the live music/entertainment as some other Yelpers. I think live music is very important to ambiance but my preference would have been a talent like Daniel Park or perhaps a straight acoustics musician. The man there this was a bit off his game (maybe he was sick?)  Anyway, on to the food! We ordered:  French Onion Soup Duck Confit Salad (Favorite!) Parpadalle White fish (special du jour)  There is no question that I will be back soon. MB is a nice alternative to the glitz of dinner out on the Strip.

NQOMUpT55K5zWITH73IEyg.text: 6-3-17. Took my friend for a birthday lunch. I tried to make a reservation, but was left on hold for 4 minutes. Finally, I hung up and decided to take my chances for a table. It was getting close to 1 pm, so I hoped we could miss the 12:00 lunch crush. It's 109 degrees today. There were many open tables, but we were seated on the patio. There were only fans to cool down the area. No one asked us if we had a preference. Once seated, we immediately were served water. My friend asked for a Diet Coke.  30 min later, the waiter came over and said, "oh, you haven't gotten your Diet Coke yet. So sorry" He leaves and comes back with the soda. We don't let him leave without our order because my friend has plans later. 30 minutes later, the waiter brings bread and apologizes for the wait again. There were no bread plates, but we had a basket of bread and placemats. About 2 minutes after the bread delivery, our food showed up.  The food was delicious. After we dined, the waiter came back and asked if I needed a box. I did and he left to get it. I asked for the dessert menu for a birthday treat. The waiter complied and left. 15 min later, the waiter returned for our order. By this time, we've been at this restaurant for 90 minutes. 15 min. Later, the cake showed up at the table, where the waiter apologized yet again for the wait. We pay the bill and after 2 hours, we leave. My friend lives near the airport and the restaurant is located in desert shores. She calls me at 4:15 from a grocery store near her home. This waiter forgot to return her card. I live closer to the place, so I have to go retrieve her card, and drive to the other side of town to return it. If I could give them less than 1 star- I would.

djf_r8mhBHmaUTs2ZuxiSw.text: Very interesting place, when you enter you are in the wine store. We were greeted with a smile. Our server was Kaylee, she did an excellent job and more.    Give me a little time and I will break down of the meal and check

kR1wkErBVip2oPtOa8hIXA.text: Terrible service and hostess should be fired, have reservations, empty tables and tells me 15 minutes for a table with this lazy ass I do not give a shit attitude!

pfeJCGYtBE1uxxhmSvZ-RA.text: Quit searching and go have a meal. Lake view. Incredible wine selections can be purchased in their wine store at normal retail plus a $10 corkage fee. Foodies will howl great things.  I can't understand how I've never known about this place before.  Patio seating rocks.

O3z1wz-P9zhO8V1XA8LI9w.text: We absolutely loved this restaurant. We actually spent most of our special occasions with this venue. We came often enough we had the pleasure of meeting the owners. The last two visits were absolutely awful. Last visit, we waited to be seated for over 20 minutes and we're completely ignored by the hostess after selecting 2 bottles of wine for our dinner. We left without being seated. This last experience we felt mocked by our waiter. It was an awful experience. I had chose the venue for my birthday dinner.  I regret my choice and will question any thought to visit in the future. The venue, surroundings, and patio are to die for., we LOVE the venue. ..it is such a shame that the service received is not only below par but offensive.

lhpAxrZovFCDiJR9e7_OrQ.text: Decent wine selection, but professional ettiquette was a bit off.  It was a bit odd for one of the staff assisting me in my wine selection to keep low-balling the wine. I have money, dude. So why not upsell?  He seemed a bit afraid to show me anything expensive, and kept referring me back to the $20-30 section.    For the most part, staff felt friendly on the surface, but I kept feeling hovered over, which took away from the cozy ambience and nice selection of wine.  If you can deal with awkward treatment in search of good wine, then this place isn't terrible.  Points for selection, not on customer service.

XiOW0kfXQZc6aZVGIkImoQ.text: If you like wine, good food and a great atmosphere, this is it. Where else can you dine off the strip by a lake in a romantic atmosphere? Since the new owners (jeff & rhonda) took it over, this place has been completely transformed and the wine selection is now incredible. And what really rocks is the wine prices. Retail wine prices in a restaurant? Really? Yes! Oh and they have a new executive chef (Alex), added the missing touch.

XD9JhTAdopF0yX0T0oC0Vg.text: Fantastic view of the beautiful water. The place to be, if you need to escape the desert. The food was nicely done, good presentation and taste. The waiter was a bit slow, but overall good. This is a great place for a date, or a place to bring your parents when they come to visit. The wine selection is right from the wine shop you walk through to get to the tables out back by the lake.  They have misters so even on a 100 degree day it feels comfortable.

LlvumABUQbQXKypdMZ0bfA.text: The food is very good, and service is as well... it's the space that's a bit awkward. In nice weather, it has to be great, but when it's cool outside, they have to put up the plastic panels, and turn on lots of outdoor propane heaters. We moved inside and it was then much more comfortable.. (it's not a large indoor area, so be sure and request an inside table if you are in doubt).  The 'retail wine shop' selection will find something for everyone, and prices are in line for what you are getting. It's nice to be able to upgrade to more expensive bottles, and not pay the normal 200-300% markup.  Will definitely return sometime... just wish they were on the opposite side of town.  Note:  The steak tartar was top notch, as was the spicy jambalaya.  Oh yea... and don't think of bringing your own bottle(s) to the restaurant... their BYOB policy is punitive ($25.00 btl).... they should just state they do not permit it..

f0xbcIIdIIRMWwhsPZbWdg.text: The view and atmosphere are always nice, although the food is just average.  I've been several times since the new owners have taken over, and it has been disappointing every time.  The typical brasserie food is completely overprice, and the portions seem to keep getting smaller.  The entree of muscles is less then half of what it used to be, and the french fries are not as good.  I was hoping this local establishment was getting better, but clearly that is not the case.  Sadly, we won't be back!   BTW, there was a wedding party on the terrace there as well.  The constant passing of guests was quite irritating.  In addition, there was live music and the regular restaurant music playing simultaneously.  This ruined the tranquil setting!  Even our waiter was embarrassed!

9R60wjoLWsONH-FaSYnY4g.text: great food and wine.  i like that i can pick my own bottle.  nice view of the water.  i have been several times where service was not friendly.  it was not bad but stoic.

RGaoSXv7uLXHZuEXIiHFWQ.text: I give this a four because while I think that the wine and the view are a 5, the food could be better. I am a simple girl when it comes to food and I love variety. The food is french inspired and really I wish they had a plate of pasta or a good chicken dish. It's fancy and fabulous and I simply go for the wonderful wine and view.

ZgKcXhgHshNupjWTsObEgg.text: This place is OK the wait staff are a bit pretentious (please this is not the best place) Hubby and I had lunch here and it was good, liked the snails, so we booked for Valentines and it was a disaster.  We were squashed in inside, the food took ages and the final straw was when the waiter tried to push past behind my husbands chair.  Tried it again and were disappointed again, my meal was almost cold:( won't be going back to inconsistant.

O9lP_sfU-4mtrnu12v2cVA.text: We had a wonderful experience at this restaurant which is about 8 miles off the strip. We sat out on the large patio( I think everyone that night sat outside) that overlooks a small lake. There was a gentle breeze, adequate shade and soft music provided a very relaxing evening. It appeared everyone was taking 2-3 hour dinners and just enjoying the atmosphere and food.  When you get there, you walk into a wine store. We had reservations, so the hostess showed us to our table and told us to feel free to go back into the store, peruse the selection and buy our wine for the dinner. I thought the prices and variety were more than acceptable. Maybe they could have had more burgundy. There is also a list by the glass is buying a bottle is too much.  I enjoyed the special of crab meat dumplings that also included fresh corn, tomatoes and avocados, nice fresh and light. My Duroc Pork Chops were heavier with a more Southern spin to them with accompanied bitter cooked greens and very fine shoestring potatoes. We also had a duck dish that was well executed and cooked correctly to medium rare. The dressing with the duck was very savory and had a homey feel to it. The service was great.

uZ2DWkkIYfGVSVGWSEY0xg.text: My wife and I love this place.  We go there every Valenties day for the Dinner.  We eat there occassionally throughout the year for lunch.  They have outside seating that has a beautiful view of the Lake.  Our favorite thing about the restaurant is that you can pick from a huge selection of wines.  We like to try new wines, and they are always helpful suggesting something based on the wines we know that we like.  The food has always been great, and we have never had bad service.  They are a little bit on the pricey side, but with good food and a great view it is definitely worth it.

jJEqy-6lMnEb6frt-l1Vxw.text: Had crab and asparagus benedict and mimosa with my friend Linda.  Great brunch and great company!

MXuWRmT4AEFbQB8y2gz5kA.text: It is definitely not worth the drive.  The server was pleasant , but the wait for the food to be served was way too long.  The food was not worth the wait either.  The foie gras was a disappointment.  The best part of the dining was the view of the lake beside the restaurant.

vxuTl5S2W3B7omJdlrErSA.text: This is a hidden gem.  Need a nice romantic evening without killing the wallet this is the place.  We are not wine drinkers, but the food was some of the best I have had in years.

V0Cu3gg79iOtadu0FSX2jw.text: Went here to enjoy some appetizers and a glass of wine for Valentines day. I was planning on a short stay and I was told with no reservation I would have to sit at the bar. This was impossible considering I had a six year old child with me. I used to work at this establishment and am discouraged to ever return. Sure wish Greg and Agathe never sold the place. What a shame when new owners purchase an establishment and forget about the people that made it once successful.

--zUDYJzK5ea6V5cKlD5sQ.text: Yesterday was my first visit to Marche. I got friends visiting in town from Cali. We all loved french bistro, so we went to Comme Ca, Mon Ami Gobi for the first two nights and decided to try something different off the strip. I read lots good review about this place on yelp and decided to give it a try. It took us almost 40 mins from Henderson to Summerlin. First impression of this place to me was really nice. We all loved the outdoor patio seating area with some kind of view of lake. Our waitress was friendly and menu price was quiet good compared to strip price. We ordered saffron seafood bisque and escargots persillad for appetizers, Poulet Frites, kobe beef hot-dog for entrees, CREME BRULEE A LA VANILLE, and GRAND MARNIER CHOCOLATE CAKE for deserts. The only dish I liked was saffron seafood bisque. Kobe beef hot-dog tasted nothing special to me. The sauce of my pan seared chicken breast was tasty but chicken skin was way too salty. All the french fries came with entrees were really salty. you could see sea salt all over the fries and plate!! And dish disappointed me the most was escargot. Escargot is always on my must order list whenever I dine in french restaurants. This is WORST ESCARGOT I ever tasted in my life!!!! I tasted one bite and asked waitress to bring back to kitchen. I asked waitress to ask chef to try the dish and see how chef thinks. Our waitress replied chef said this is exactly how we serve this dish everyday. Really!!!!!!? well, if this is True, then I have to repeat what I just said earlier " This is WORST ESCARGOT I ever tasted in my life!!!!" I wonder if there was any kitchen staff spilled salt bottle located next to our escargots and fries!! I am not a complainer if you read all my other reviews on yelp. I am actually very generously with giving stars. But the reply from chef was really making me upset. In the end, manager took off one saffron soup and escargot from our check without lots apologies. Our waitress was a nice lady. She did feel bad that we didn't enjoy our meal. At least she showed she cared on her face not like the manager. I will keep my business in Comme Ca, Mon Ami Gobi and Bouchon and never come back again.

IIjnKnC1OGeF5d6mo6b5aw.text: Although the ambiance, wine store and service is superb, I find this to be one of the most overrated restaurants in Las Vegas. To describe the food as lack luster is actually kind. The onion soup I had was bland and the lobster croissant sandwich was an affront to good seafood. I specifically asked about the quality of the lobster meat and was assured that is was "wonderful". When the sandwich arrived it had the shredded consistency of canned lobster and the bread was a cheap croissant that was way too buttery (not even close to the pastry pictured in the photos from the restaurant). It was the first time I can remember actually being angry at my lunch. The wine shop , however, is excellent and they only charge $10 for a corkage fee. Although,  I can't understand why they don't have a wine list. You are forced walk around the shop to find what you want, which is usually a wonderful, but occasionally I find that it would be nice to have a list to guide you.

D7q_WNRQotWXUHlvkSXCdA.text: Another for the Hidden Gem File!  This is possibly one of the most obscure dining destinations in Las Vegas , but well worth the trek off the strip and into suburbia.  Located on the banks of a man made lake in the West side of the Valley, and well hidden.  If you don't know where this is, you will never find it.  Best part is my mother, age 79, had this in her bag of tricks.  You enter into a wine store replete with rows of wine bins and, I must say, a fairly nice selection of wines and affordable prices.    Now, the great part.  You exit the back of the store onto a large dining patio that is terraced to the water, fireplace, lakeside etc etc.   Very nice , beautiful and comfortable.    Our server, Kelly, a Los Angeles transplant, was knowledgeable and very informative.  We started with a Napa Silver Oak for $95 then on to Prisoner cab for $65.00, nice glasses and presentation with a serene view of the lake and sky.  The bad part :(.  Food is not worthy of the ambiance and wine selection.  We had the upgraded wine and cheese platter, which included two pate (one pork and one pork and chicken), a lobster salad (not good) Quince jam, apple slices, very fishy Salmon and some very fatty and warm salami.  We gave it another chance and ordered the escargot (flavorless) and the mussels.  Mussels were tender but not much flavor.  Ambiance         5 Wine Selection  4 Service               4 Food                    1   Overall               3 and I will be back!

jhwmTzUPNzHKkIch1gJNpQ.text: Made reservations for a Friday dinner for my folks and I to celebrate my lil' brother's HS graduation. What a great night. Walked through the wine shop amongst some great bottles and we were seated by the water. I tried the duck breast and it was pretty good. Would have likes a little salad too or something else to balance out the sweetness of the sauce, but all in all, good times. Had a glass of Tempranillo which went perfectly with the meal. We shared the bread pudding and a a creme brule to finish things off. Everyone had a great meal and a great time. Will come for more.

2nQZvQGeDDK4cscfuuIAyA.text: I come to Vegas to visit, to enjoy the scene and to explore different restaurants.  My gf lives in Vegas and took me to MB for dinner a few months back.  What a great experience - from the wine selection to the music to the ambiance on the water to the great service to the delicious food.  LOVED IT! so i signed up for the newsletter and found out about the brunch.  Last weekend came for a Brunch on a Sunday.  It was a beautiful day so we requested a table on the patio in advance. I got a completely different experience - i'm not sure if brunches are a new thing to this place, but it was BAD.  The heating lamps werent working because it was chilly in the shade.  The server was pissed off at the world and didn't want to be there. The food was mediocre (and i'm being generous).  Advertized potatos were fried to a crips and were out of the bag frozen variety.  Poached eggs wasn't poached - it was fried!  The overall brunch experience was pretty disappoiting...  i think i'll stick to going there for dinner and not brunch...   unless they catch up as a brunch place.

kclwMLf9egI_qDLbXeeE6A.text: I agree with Michelle C.'s review. I went there with some friends just a few nights ago. First of all, we specifically asked for a particular table right by the water when we made our initial reservations and we even called the day of to confirm this table again. When we got there, we were told that our table was not available. The owner said she would see if the patrons at our table would be willing to move, but there were no guarantees. We graciously agreed to take another table.   Aside from a relieved smile and a simple "thank you" there were no other acknowledgments over this mishap that could have been prevented with better planning on the part of the restaurant's management team.   Then we were charged $25 as a corkage fee for EACH bottle we brought in to drink. Corkage fees north of the strip are now illegal, but I guess it's an easy thing to ignore if you think your customers are not too savvy about new culinary laws.   Again, we were gracious and paid our bill. However, when we spoke to the owners about our dissatisfaction all they did was give us blank stares to our faces but made sure to roll their eyes when they thought our backs were turned. That, was just too much. How unprofessional!

jlt6HfY2k4eAETOgsnvH0g.text: Well, I had a singing engagement there and the atmosphere, owners, employees and guest were sooooo wonderful.  I enjoyed singing in this particular atmosphere because I am not a gambler and I don't care to be around it.  At Marche Bacchus, it is soo different, warm, inviting, close and yet spacious with beautiful scenery and a totally relaxed, charming place to be, made me feel I wasn't in Las Vegas but on an island.  This place will be on my  Las Vegas FAVORED list for atmosphere, warmth, excellent food, service and a great relaxing get away.  Service is prompt and all those patrons leaving the establishment had smiles on their faces, full & satisfied tummy's.  I spoke with the patrons as they were leaving and so graciously filled my tip jar and thanked me and as I asked " how was your dinner ?"  all replies were " very satisfied and they would be returning."  I've been singing in restaurants over several years and truly " I KNOW SATISFIED CUSTOMERS" these customers left blissful..   And so shall I recommend Marche Bachus to all my friends and those I meet,    Truly, the proprietors, staff, service, food, atmosphere is awesome!!!  Do go and treat yourselves !!  PAMELA LEWIS Restaurant Officienato over 20 yrs. !   :)  Thank you  Marche' Bacchus

7Zu1rJNTeqvtczB07rdxDQ.text: This is our favorite family go to place to celebrate special occasions. The ambience is the best I have found in the valley sitting right on the lake and the food is impeccable. Have had so many good memories at this restaurant with family and friends.

GK2fMe4X9RIkjOQBQu0MtQ.text: Love the patio.  Had dinner with a small group and everything was on point.  Octopus salad was my favorite starter.   Grilled asparagus and organic chicken was entree and DELISH.  Ended the evening with 3 desserts for table to share and we all devoured.  Angelo the sommelier was attentive from beginning to end.  We enjoyed aperitifs and both white and red wines.  All of us loved his recommendations and it definitely was perfect pairing with the food.  Looking forward to going back for brunch next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FI6uRDuqN7KYB17wRkF_zQ.text: No wonder how this restaurant only gets 3 and half stars at Yelp. The lake view is nice but the service was bad. Don't bother to call for reservation, it's useless, they should have just tell customers it's first come first serve.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RQnGAIp9OFy0uhK2GaUCXw.text: Here is a rare instance where I dock a restaurant two stars strictly on value. Great wine selection and that is a good deal I got the last bottle of 2010 Rolly Glassman 2010 Riesling. 30 dollar scallop dish only three scallops fois gras app minuscule taste was on point and service was great but give me a break would be a bad deal on the strip no less a neighborhood restaurant. My two cents.

Vu_kHyT10u-z9sy5ChgyvA.text: This is one of my most favorite spots. This restaurant (I believe) once started primarily as a wine shop with a small dining area but has morphed into one of the most romantic/yummy dining spots in the city. On the inside they have a wine shop with some great hard-to-find wine selections and a nice dining area. The outside dining area hosts a covered patio overlooking the Desert Shores lake. What's great about this outside space is that it is surprisingly cool in the 110 degree weather and warm (with heaters) on winter nights.  THE FOOD IS AMAZING, TOO. I have yet to try a dish I don't like. The lunch menu runs about $15 to $20, and the evening menu gets a little bit pricier. But it is 100% worth the price. And be sure to order the creme brulee every time you come.  The service is great as well. I would suggest putting yourself on the "European dining schedule" and just relax. (Us Americans tend to expect strangely quick service everywhere we go, but you will want to sit back and relax here).    *As of July 2018, the inside has gone under renovations.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crème brûlée
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So much wine!
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half chicken sandwiches (lunch menu)

-rgN2vNMaHzZaGyoSTtQLg.text: What a beautiful location. To have a tables by the water looking out at the ducks . wonderful appetizers  at lunch. Our waiter was extremely helpful. The place is a little pricey but if you're in a mood to go to a restaurant that does not look like it belongs in Las Vegas this is the place . I think it's a hidden gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The crème brûlée awesome I must try
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

agfyAVavC6_VQv5y4wnB7g.text: I took my husband here for his 30th birthday. It has everything he loves. French Steakhouse, wine shop, patio, fireplaces, and on the water. All in all, I did good guys.  We had so much fun eating here. Not only was the food great, the experience was fun as well. You walk in and are in a wine shop. They have a HUGE variety of wines, some of them hard to find at your typical store. I love this aspect. You can pick a bottle to eat with dinner, or come back in the middle of dinner and grab another. Really unique.   We loved everything we tried, but here's what I recommend. Salmon Steak & Frites French Onion Soup Goat Cheese Truffle Appetizer (this was so good we tried to recreate it at home)  I highly recommend you sit on the patio when you eat here or else it will be a loss. The views and the ambience outside completely blow the inside seating out of the water (pun intended).  My only complaint was that service was VERY slow. Which is not terrible if you are patient, not in a rush or just enjoying yourself. But once dinner is creeping well over 2 hours, I usually start to get a little antsy. Other than that, it was a wonderful experience. We will definitely be back.

PsOmd_O1C6Fc1PALafIusw.text: I brought my wife here for a "wine dinner" hosted by Quilceda Creek.   The ambiance is great, a boutique wine store with lake front views, oh my. Am I in Vegas?  The service was good, the food was great and the wine experience was next level. Great value!  If you like/love wine, this place is top top top.   On the way out stopped at the bar... wtf... the selection of rums, tequila and whiskey was unlike anything I've ever seen. Maybe 100k in dark booze right in front of me.  I tried the Ron Zacapa XO Centanario Rum. Whoa.  I experienced something special tonight, thanks.  I left a review because it was that good.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zB5R2XOAWMqZH18DBAzi3g.text: It took longer almost 15 mns for our desserts to be served, by the time they brought it, sorbets/gelato and smores mousse was melting. Smores portion was small and tasted plain, not worth $10. Add a little of Graham crackers and bits of Hershey's to it, it will surely impress our taste buds. But the passion fruit and berry sorbets tasted great. The Lobsters Salad crossiant was ok, bread was soggy not a fan of sweet after taste probably taste better in a French bread or French Baguette. Ordered steak medium well and it came out medium, bloody red but was juicy and it tasted good. Chicken and Waffle tasted great. My husband liked the Pulled Pork Benedict. The Grits and medallions was cooked beautifully would be perfect if add more pieces of of the beef. Ambience and noise level was great, Family Friendly and love the outdoor seating. As for the Service, she deserved the 17% tip, but would have been better if they didnt slacked at the end. We felt like they forgot us and our desserts since we were the last customers seating for the Brunch. The Hostess was ok, she just need improvement instead of saying " yes may I help you" would have sounded better with a "welcome to Marche Bacchus, how may I help you" plus add a smile to it. But she did good in checking our table and walking us to our table. When we left the restaurant,  she was too busy in the phone, and didn't bother saying anything like "thank you or come again next time". The only staff who noticed us leave the restaurant was the Bartender who smiled at us and thanked us. This restaurant is a neighborhood gem, just need a little improvement on the service, quality and value of food. It's a change for us who are used to eating at the strip. We were supposed to dine at Giada but chose this restaurant and we did not regret it. Overall, our Family had a wonderful brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled Pork Benedict $17
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Salad Croissant $14

orvVcA-b6saTQuQDKOnKmw.text: Beautiful atmosphere. One of my favorite places to brunch. My husband and I come here for date days frequently. The food is fantastic. Sometimes the service can be slow, but we're not in a rush. There's nothing like delicious food right on the lake.

gt1YThBP22p69N68EDPqqQ.text: Me and my girlfriend always enjoy this place.  Please keep up your good wine shop and restaurant.  The bread pudding was great as usual

Pf0cNSx32k2PlJ8iG42LkQ.text: Excellent experience!! Food excellent! I highly recommend the charred octopus appy and mussels with chorizo entree! The wine our waiter chose went perfectly with our meal. I must add that our waiter Ian made our dining experience even better with his flawless service. It was my  moms 88th Birthday and she has an anxiety/impatience disorder and she was in Heaven with his attentive service which made our meal so much more enjoyable! The prices are very fair for the excellence of the food and who could beat the gorgeous view of the lake! Perfect execution! We will of course be back!

DsGtZrL_q_YwqfLIuUshtw.text: Second time here, again for my birthday.  I ordered fois gras appetizer which was excellent.  Also ordered yellowtail crudo which was a sizable portion and had a great fennel flavor (maybe a little too much fennel).  My wife had filet mignon as her entree which was cooked to perfection and delicious.  I ordered the seared scallops and was disappointed with small portion of only 3 scallops and a hand full of small pieces of diced potatoes.  The flavor was good but not worth the price for the small plate.  This would be better served as an appetizer.  We also ordered desserts, creme brulee which was very creamy and had a good vanilla flavor.  My wife had the cheesecake which was a little on the dry side.   Our server had forgotten to serve us bread which takes away from the attention to detail for the price we were paying for our meals on a special occasion.  We were very pleased with our first visit but will look for another French restaurant when we visit Las Vegas and want to celebrate.

qNF5ePBmRweYHyndQJlLtQ.text: Tonight was the second time  I have eaten at Marche Bacchus. And the last! Both times the service sucked! I don't mean slow I mean poor! The food was good but at those prices I expect more! We had to ask for water, bread and more water. Our server never and I mean never checked on us. We had to ask another server for water. I do not know if they were understaffed but it made for a very poor experience! I do not recommend!

4gC-wsSWk2iofxNhaDxH6g.text: This was the worst meal I have ever had ..I made a reservation for the 14th of July France Independence Day for 7:30pm . The restaurant called me 2 days before the event to ask me if I could change my reservation to 6:30pm  and I said yes no problem. Well I arrived at 6:30 pm and finally got to order a drink by 7pm.I realized it was 8:15pm and still no food coming our way. When we asked we had someone from the restaurant who came over and said "all of you guys reserved at the same time and the kitchen is fired up " !!! Really ??? Which manager would say that to customers when they are the ones changing everyone's-reservation. Then he said I'll bring some champagne over to you guys and in the end charged us for it . By 9pm the main course arrived and that was not what I ordered so I sent it back. . I mean if you guys are planning an event at your restaurant at least be prepared and do not blame the customers for booking  at the same time, do not have people wait 2 hours literally between courses and have some class and bring complimentary drinks when you say you will and do not charge the customers for it !!!

R_Z-kTHDOo5wbCCB6IXfbw.text: Oh my I wish there was one good thing to say about this dust hole  My husband RSVP for our 7th year wedding anniversary at first they walk you through this bright Wine Market with a side bar and then walk you to the back where your seated looking at the lake  At first they were seating us in front of a industrial fan with 5 inches thick of dust , I immediately asked to move so it's so cramped back there now theres breeze all over thick dust above our table blowing  It was so hot still in September, we ordered escargot,a bottle of sparkling water her I ordered lamb chops he ordered the halibut his fish was so seared like a leather sole of a shoe middle cold my chops were cold the whole meal was discus ting a real bummer , we sent it back it took to long we said we were leaving and would pay for the appetizer and sparkling water. At that point the server said no worries he'll take care of it no need to and we left. The smell of the lake water was yucky and the windows dirty , bats flying close to the open glass doors open. Never EVER GO HERE the Health department should really take a look at the back of this dinning place. The MOST ABSOLUTELY WORST EXPERIENCE EVER with hubbby I wish I could post 1/4 of a star

VV0rhrknKmquJSUjHmIiow.text: The staff and food here are out of this world. Beautiful view of the water. Specialty cocktails amazing. Beet salad and beef tartar a must! Chef Paul and server Anthony are top tier when it comes to hospitality. Wine selection like no other. We'll be Bacchus soon!!

j7MTivemdvVnMwwLMvZRqg.text: A drawback to visiting this restaurant for me, was they were basically a wine bar and now, they have built an incredible, warm, friendly full service bar my husband and I frequent for happy hour. Bartender, Patrick knows his drinks and was friendly and encouraging to new libations. The food was fabulous and I would encourage you to go to eat, drink and enjoy the new facelift!

E6eBg3uW-3WHK_dDW5O1ow.text: Made online reservations, and backed up with phone call couple days before . 11:30 am Saturday for mother's day. 6 of us. Arrived on time. Waited 20 minutes for table to be set. ???? Next waited a while for server and water. Then waited another 20 minutes to order. A full hour after we entered building we asked what's going on. So we asked;"Do we need to cook our own food?". So then excuses came, "short of staff, we are busy, manager started your order'??? A female waitress we flagged down, not our waiter, saved the day. Jennifer. To be commended. Ask for her if you dare eat here and things should go better with her!. Now for the food review. Good. Not off the charts. Might have been better if somewhat on time.  Wow. I hate to write reviews like this, hate experience this. Unfortunate.

iFv_LcF-NRmxYu8zVkm6ig.text: Unfortunately, this restaurant is not very good. My husband ordered scallops. These scallops were very dead... and they did smell bad.  I will not come back

Z_HKxvhgZoSAv6IbtP6nYg.text: We started off being shown a table next to the fireplace, instead of lake side as requested when I made the reservation. As we were moved to the other side near the lake, we were told we couldn't have the table that I originally requested; come to find out it was promised at the same time to the managers friends. We never were given an apology or saw the manager again after we disclosed our disappointment. The food is outrageously expensive for sub par- this local has eaten much much better elsewhere. Take your business near the Strip for much better French cuisine and at half the cost! My wife couldn't even finish the pork loin, which was decent to say it best. Super disappointed with picking this place for our anniversary dinner. Best part was our friendly waitress, so thank you for giving us Rochelle!

lBTEsNrMxqwKWh4lsBkc5A.text: I went today with a group of 10 ladies and we requested/reserved Lakeside dining and were promptly seated. Our waiter was excellent. He immediately brought bread and butter and gave us separate checks which was extra work for him but convenient for us. Everyone was pleased with their food. I had a Reuben sandwich and a Caesar salad and both were good. Several ladies had the lobster salad croissant and enjoyed but said the croissant was soggy because of how moist the lobster salad is. We brought a cake as we were celebrating a birthday. Our waiter offered to cut the cake for us but then said he was told it would be a $1.50 per person cake cutting charge. We figured we could do it ourselves and save the $15! He brought us a knife and extra plates and to-go boxes. Overall very pleasant ambiance and excellent service and the food was okay. They have a huge wine selection and a few of us ordered glasses.

SFwANlp5rjjLPsERyhrxkw.text: Ruben and I met here for lunch to take advantage of Fall Restaurant Week 2014. The three-course menu was $30.14. The place is half restaurant, half wine shop. The whole space has a great ambiance, especially with the lakeside patio. There's also a bar and lounge area next to the shop. Although it wasn't particularly hot that day, it wasn't cool enough to want to sit outside (everyone else did).  FIRST COURSE  Soup du Jour: Potato Leek Soup with bacon and croutons. The soup was thick, but not heavy and very flavorful. I loved the addition of bacon.  Fresh Burrata Cheese with Heirloom Tomatoes: Balsamic vinegar, ciabatta croutons, and basil oil. This was just okay. The burrata was nice, but I've had much better salads of its kind. I would have enjoyed more tomato as well.  SECOND COURSE  Poulet Frites: Roasted chicken breast, fries, and natural chicken jus. We both ordered this dish and loved it. My chicken was slightly dry, but the jus was so, so good! The fries were really fantastic as well (Top 10) and tasted amazing when soaked in the jus. More jus please!  THIRD COURSE  Tiramisu: Mascarpone, vanilla lady fingers, espresso, and Kahlua. This is one of my favorite desserts and of course, I'm very particular about it. That said, I did not like this tiramisu. I don't know what it was, but I did not like the flavor and didn't finish it.  Creme Brulee: Vanilla bean custard and caramelized sugar. This was really nice! The custard was oh, so creamy. Delicious.  Service was very pleasant and we enjoyed our time. Great spot for a date and certainly a fantastic place to purchase wine. We would love to return when it cools down and enjoy dining lakeside.

DzpVyOieR7vX3Jr4XDqhMQ.text: We were a party of 8 for yesterday's lunch. Everyone enjoyed their food which consisted of the lobster crepe, mussels, roasted chicken, fish & chips, steak w eggs & short ribs w eggs benedict. We added 2 orders of french fries w truffle oil upon recommendation of our waiter. That was best part of the meal. Fries were done to perfection!!

WuL8du_2HFx-JTBubNaeRg.text: It was Christmas Eve and my husband and I had just eloped, and were looking for a  really nice restaurant to celebrate with one additional guest. I found Marche Bacchus on OpenTable and it had great reviews and an open reservation. Booking was super smooth. When we arrived the hostess obviously didnt' want to be working Christmas Eve, and didn't even ask how we were doing and couldn't drudge up a smile. I had put in the notes that this was our wedding dinner, but I doubt that was ever conveyed to the waiter. Our waiter was nice, pretty talkative, but also clueless and never asked what brought us in that night (we were obviously dressed up formally). So, that was pretty disappointing. He also rarely checked up on us and was too busy talking with other tables to ensure we had proper refills. In all honesty, when I spent $230 on a dinner for three people to celebrate getting married, it would have just been nice to receive a heartfelt congratulations. Even chain restaurants have that level of customer service down. The food was delicious, and the ambiance was wonderful. Just not sure if I would be back based on service alone.  Update: I filled out a long review via OpenTable with a direct message to the restaurant, and even left my contact information. The restaurant never attempted to contact me about our experience. Disappointing.

nf_5rx3sV0uXhBgQgT_lGQ.text: The service here is terrible. When I read the reviews on here, I thought some of these people just got unlucky, however, after actually receiving bad service from them, I will most likely not be going back. First there was a bug in my water and I asked the waiter so kindly if he was able to get me a new water. That took about 5 minutes. We ordered our drinks and decided what we were going to have for brunch. They all sounded amazing. But then our server started taking awhile to come. My sister had to call out for someone to get him and that took another 10 minutes or so. We asked for the mussels to come out as an appetizer and he also recommended it. He took our orders down without writing it (weird I thought, but at the same time I thought maybe he had a good memory).  I was wrong. He came back 10-15 minutes later and repeated the orders and got one of them wrong. He said and the mussels will be out shortly. He brought out the dishes and fork for the mussels. It was about 20 minutes later and our food came. But no mussels.  We told our waiter and his response was, "okay". That was all. No apology. At that point, I was ready to leave. I didn't even enjoy the food. They don't come and check on you while you're eating nor do they fill up your water or ask if you would like more wine. The view is nice but you might want to stay away from the bad service.

5a1ZxfSmQor7N1cAGBqlBQ.text: Awesome place!! We came here along time ago before the remodel. I am very happy we came back!! The filet I had was wonderful!! Perfectly cooked and a great flavor.  The veal my husband had he said was very good as well!! Nice wine selection.    I felt like I was somewhere near the ocean nice ambiance !! I will definitely be back!!

GJRZ_P6YHW0TDJdOA80VrQ.text: We went to Marche Bacchus to celebrate two birthdays. My husband and I even went over there to check it out beforehand since we are new to the area. We made reservations about 10 days ahead of time and requested to be on the patio by the water. First of all, we were seated in probably the worst spot in the restaurant; on the patio but the last table, not near the water. Within a few minutes a wedding venue that was nextdoor,with windows overlooking the dining area, started up with loud music. I had been looking forward to treating myself with their "Roasted Hudson Valley Foie Gras". This was not Fois Gras. It was something like a very fluffy mousse with no Fois Gras taste. When asked for a small butter knife to spread this concoction, I was told to use my large butter knife! I told the waitress that this was not Faux Gras and she told me the Chef had just changed the recipe.  Next, I had ordered the flat iron steak. The steak was so salty it was practically inedible. The Pomme Frits came out of a frozen bag not homemade. On the plus side, my husband said his escargots were good and so were the scallops. I just think you should get something a little better for $200.

GuW8Tl83rAhxkKCZuTxTdw.text: Heard about this place from a friend and seeing others reviews on yelp made us want to try it out. I want to go straight to talking about the entree. I had the 28 day dry prime rib-eye and it was amazing. Every bite was tastier than the previous one and this is definitely one of the best rib-eyes I have ever had. The sides on the plate were okay and the cheese was a bit too overpowering on the potato. The service was good, we were attended to whenever we needed something and the waitress even helped us with our table that kept wobbling. I also had the creme brulee which was also one of the best I've ever had. The texture was just right on the bottom and the top.

Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sancerre is amazing, tasted like a good cider and the after-taste was really refreshing. I had to get a second glass with my steak

r6l-PNSFfy00LdKi3nx1qA.text: I have never been impressed with their food, they do have some great cocktails tho. And I sitting on their patio pretending I'm not in Vegas.

9_R740IsOtkwjPjIvxhgAg.text: Lovely brunch menu.  However, the best feature of this place is the patio with a serene view of the lake.

Q-1POwe9WCnB1LP6ROulPQ.text: It was not a good experience at brunch The waiter was spoken to about his horrendous service by the manager. Being Asian and not white the waiters as well as the manager was not attentive and nobody opened the door for me even though they were in close proximity and the while experience sucked....food was better at my house the previous day. the crab Benedict and lack Of asparagus was tasteless. It was not a good experience and I was disappointed as I have had better service there  in the past.  So disappointing all round ..,.....

mjPGZm88V1EZirnBNZmdwg.text: My favorite restaurant in Las Vegas outside of the Strip. Love their Octopus, and the selections of wine. Great atmosphere and occasion live music. I've hosted many dinner parties at this location.

ngIUa0C65zCs1SB2N1ofOA.text: This place is a Negative Star rating!  I thought the show "Restaurant Stakeout" fixed this place and corrected their horrible service.    This place is bad! Worst service I have ever experienced and the food was nothing special.  The Chicken Waldorf salad says it has "roasted chicken", it's more like a fried chicken that's dry.  The manager was not very apologetic and it didn't seem like they cared one bit.  15 minutes to put our order in, followed by another 45 minutes to get our food.  I will never come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waldorf Salad that should have roasted chicken...it&#39;s more like dried fried chicken.

o5N1-45ghn_l4UEdss-JQw.text: Cute place and great wine selection. Love being outside by the water. Been here for lunch and dinner. Dinner was fantastic. I will always try foie gras if its listed on the menu. It was my favorite. Octopus was tasty as well.   Lunch time is beautiful. Seeing the ducks play in the water and the turtles being turtles. The lobster croissant is delicious and I got to try the most expensive hotdog with truffles. lol. It was actually really good.   The only thing is service is really slow. They come to your table far and few in between. My glass of Rose during lunch was closer to room temp not cold and refreshing as expected. But the server didn't come around until after the food arrived. By then I am not going to say anything about the wine because at that point I've had it for so long.   I still give them 4 stars because the food is excellent.

WJ8LMo482X5BH43Soa2Qiw.text: Well this is our first time here! My GF and I were so exited to try a new place, so I reserve a table for V.D. The atmosphere was nice and relaxing. The menu was so limited for the price they want to charge and our server was so bad. He only came to our table to bring the four-course dinner.  He was a hard person to get a hold of all night. Finally we asked for the check and handed over my CC and I didn't see the server for the next 15 min.  We have to get a hold of another server to go find him that way we can leave that restaurant for good.    I don't know if I will be coming back here again.

WDNnbFBhVwGgyLIfDIvgxg.text: Stopped in for lunch on a gorgeous day so we sat outside in the patio area overlooking the lake. You'll see swans, turtles, and ducks in the lake if you come during the day. Makes you feel like you've just escaped Vegas for a second.   The restaurant  has an impressive selection of wines that you can choose from. The food was fantastic. We had the beef carpaccio which was tender and very flavorful. The Escargot... only because we felt like it was the "french" entree to order..no regrets! The steak tartar was also very good but nothing special.   For dessert, we had the bread pudding and beignets. Both delicious but the bread pudding definitely out-shined the beignets.   The ambiance is surreal...very romantic.  Overall I could not have asked for a more enjoyable lunch. Great food, lakeside seating, and classical french music playing. I can't wait to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3iqh0dad6JYq_Ct7e_RMeg.text: I'm a fan of good escargot and good French wine so I really do appreciate Marche Bacchus for that. Some of the dishes are better than others. On my last visit I had the escargot, muscles, octopus, cheese plate, creme brulee and French wine. The escargot was excellent, the muscles were dry and the octopus was semi-burnt. The cheese and meat plate was good, the Creme brulee was really good. It's generally difficult to find a good creme brulee in this town so I was delighted to have found that. I'll continue going back to Marche Bacchus for the escargot, wine and creme brulee but I don't know if would opt for any entrees. I've been underwhelmed by the entrees a number of times. As always, the service is really good and so is the atmosphere.

Z63kjn0HONnMZ9O2MWs_uw.text: I loved this place. The wait staff was very attentive, the patio was gorgeous and the food was delicious. Can for brunch and had the croque madame and bottomless mimosas. My boyfriend had the chicken and waffles. Loved it all! We will definitely be back again.

cOkuvb49rWpNGSYt74NjhA.text: Came here for brunch with my hubby. Had chargrilled octopus, by far the best I had! Had the lobster croissant as my main dish and their French fries are to die for! Always enjoy coming here but we'll make it a point to come here at least once a month.

161BclASap9Cc_ju2w-gDA.text: I love this place. U can grab ur wine in the market prior. I always get the snails, they r a must. Everything is so good there

Ry6zaXHqLphAVL3jc2Zz5w.text: Took my girlfriend for late birthday lunch yesterday. Such a beautiful setting with a table at the edge of the water. We were lucky enough to have one of the black swans join us. I love the wine shop where you can pick a bottle and bring it back to the table. Got a nice white blend, Mannequin by Orin Swift.  Apps started with moist crab cake and steak tar tar. Both were outstanding and enjoyed the poppy seed dressing on the arugula salad that accompanied the steak tar tar. Then entrees, I had the lobster croissant with the chestnut soup du jour which I would have again and again. Staff was friendly and attentive while also letting us talk and catch up. Dessert was the tiramisu which we almost licked the cup. Love this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black swan by our table
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster croissant with chestnut soup

BSHwEZmci-jZVFOZ6xR4Tw.text: If I could give it a lower rating I would. I have tried this place several times since they opened many years ago. We went for a special occasion, the owner was totally rude, service was poor, and food was awful. Don't waste your money or time,

86a2BwS_-KtZyA--b48zsA.text: I wouldn't even give this one star. This was the worst dining experience I've had in years. It took 35 minutes to get a drink order. When I expressed my concern, our server was rude and defensive. Our food was cold. When the manager finally came out, he made excuses exclaiming the server was down. I told him, as a server, all it would take would be a "sorry I'll be right with you, we are having technical difficulties". When the check came, they took absolutely no items off the check. I've been comIng here for over 10 years and will never return.   Edit: after all this, the manager returned to the table claiming he had read the Yelp review and verbally confronted me about it saying it was "inaccurate". I asked him to respect my space and that I had the right to post a review of my experience. I feel the worst I have emotionally felt in a very long time because of this mans confrontational disrespectful approach. No words.

kDRIZMhDn1l1FNBJeezl3Q.text: Went here for Sunday brunch with the boyfriend, and a friend... We had the bottom less mimosas the ciabatta table bread was pretty yummy... Escargot, and I ordered the lobster croissant and Caesar salad.. Everything was delicious will definitely check out dinner next time around.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZfaqIapDqqJpRMIjXa2WtQ.text: Went with a party of 4 for Saturday lunch and it was excellent.  We had multiple apps and entrees; escargot (excellent), french onion soup (excellent), pumpkin soup (excellent), Caesars salad (good), charcuterie plate (skip this, a bit bleak for the price), lobster salad croissant (good), blackened salmon BLT (excellent), mussels (excellent) and pork belly ravioli (excellent).  The waitress was very nice and professional, although there were a few lengthy waits between visits.  This may have been since we were the only group inside.  Overall: great.

7HZJ6oUiILMimn3gmeY88g.text: I love this place! This is where I have celebrated Mothers Day for the past 5 years. This occasion was my birthday and we were a party of five couples. The food was excellent, the company extraordinary, and venue was perfection. We requested the patio with its gorgeous water views, and were seated in front of a fireplace and backed up by a heater-it was perfect. The manager stopped by often to assure we were well-served. My duck breast was 2nd to none, and our waitress was nonpareil. She was so capable and intuitive.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y-iwrnfatEb4ngSXRNbvcA.text: If you have access to a car when visiting Las Vegas, Marche Bacchus is a must to do on your list. I read some reviews and decided to try it out. It turned out to be one of the best decisions in Vegas lol. It is approximately 14 miles from the Strip but well-worth the visit seriously. It has both outdoor and indoor seating. It is set on a "lake" in the section of town called Desert Shores. You don't feel like you were in Las Vegas and is a refreshing change from Casino and the hustle and madness in downtown Vegas. As you enter the restaurant you pass a large selection of wine that you can purchase to drink with your dinner. The bottle prices are very reasonable in comparison to other Vegas restaurants from my experiences. If the weather cooperates, dine outside as it is lovely and soothing. The menu is varied - mostly with a French twist - and everything we ordered here was INCREDIBLE. As a Las Vegas visitor, Marche Bacchus is a restaurant I will try to make one of my go to spots when in the area. The staff friendly and very knowledgeable of the menu. You can't go wrong here from staff to the food just a PERFECT EXPERIENCE.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baby VIP section lol pretty cool
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior

NxaVDzZfnd84r-l0h0zAFw.text: Went back for the second time today and shared the pappardelle with lamb and pecorino and the steak and blue cheese sandwich. Both very good but the pappardelle was really tasty!

16rtNjzFj9W4RRBOOa9Jug.text: True to the Yelp reviews, Marche Bacchus is a mix of emotions. The restaurant is in an unassuming location, which is refreshing for Las Vegas and perfect for an evening date or a Sunday Funday brunch. Extensive (but pricey) wine menu. You can get away with dressing up or down at Marche, which is nice.  The service here is terrible. I'd set aside at least two hours to eat. If you're into slow service aren't bothered by slow servers, then Marche is definitely worth checking out.  French onion soup is some of the best in Las Vegas! Definitely worth trying - although heavy, probably better to split!   I probably won't be back...but I wouldn't be decline a dinner party invitation if it was hosted here.

lKjEiLbIoAgBT90XxBAu4Q.text: I went here tonight with a few collegues and LOVED the view! We sat right on the water and it was breath-taking. This place is totally a hidden gem in a residential area!  I ordered a delicious Reisling and linguine pescatora. Spicy but really good! Had plenty to take home for leftovers too wooo! Got a cheese and meat platter for an appetizer to share - the candied onions and bell peppers on it were phenomenal! The presentation of that dish was kind of ugly but flavors were good! Also got the cucomber and tomato salad as a starter and the dressing on it was perfect.    I definitely plan to come back! It is also the perfect spot for a romantic date!  UPDATE: Bought the Groupon for that date idea and came for a weekday lunch. Waiter barely seemed to care about us once he found out we had a Groupon. He gave us regular menus and saiid we could pick anything for the Groupon. Then he came back after we were ready to order (and excited!!!!) and told us we actually had to use the special Groupon menu. The Groupon menu only had about 6 entree courses and three appetizers - compared to a HUGE regular menu. Most of the Groupon items were sandwichs...little french influence. We were pretty bummed. I ended up with the black rice risotto which was quite decadent but delicious. Id advise you to skip the Groupon for this place! Just order off the regular menu and pay full price.

CaBROp4UA75aWOgkQ8YaAA.text: Location...wow...simply breath-taking. For a moment there, I forgot I was in Sin City.  Over 300+ reviews so we all know how great this place is. Nothing else to add except....  They added a handful of pasta dishes. DELICIOUS DELICIOUS! Something that they're doing different than other restaurants is the option of making your pasta as an "appetizer" or "entree" portions. This is such a great idea....especially for small eaters. The appetizer portion was perfect for my date and myself. I had the Shrimp and Lobster pasta with a spicy garlic tomato sauce. My date had the Papperdelle meat pasta.  We also ordered Parmesan garlic fries and a Cobb salad.  I feel like this is a perfect place to go during the spring/summer time....when it starts to get dark later. The sunset glistening and you see the reflection on the lakes....oh mai gawd! LOL. Gorgeous...just gorgeous. Don't know how well it'll be during the colder months though. I'm sure if you're not a fan of the cold...it would be a struggle.  Definitely a great hidden gem here in our city!

7KW98jQK21F_jPwayEsVRQ.text: Went there for the second time had to downgrade it a bit. Went for Mother's Day has the mozzarella caprese salad which was ok at best the vinegar was too sour. The chicken and waffles were not as good as last time I was there,the steak and eggs were not something to brag about and the lava cake was just not good. The creme brulee was really good though as was the tiramisu.   I don't know if I will be coming back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme Brûlée
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lava Cake

WK9IbtU9kynL4WgroTKARA.text: I originally made a reservation for lunch for 10-11 for today but unforseen events happened so, my  eye started twitching from stress and I had to change it to dinner for 9 people yesterday. They were very accommodating.  I got there early before everyone else in my group got there just so I can make sure everything was on point.  I was looking at their great selection of wines then Rhonda took me to our table.  The view of the lake was just too gorgeous and that was the start of a great dinner.  Our server last night was Jim and he did a fantastic job.  He made good food and wine recommendations.  He told us that they were celebrating their 5th anniversary under their current management and they gave us complimentary champagne.  I had a strong craving for beef the whole day yesterday and so I got the steak frites eventhough I really wanted to try the parsley and lobster roe tagliatelle - there's always a next time.  The steak frites was good.  The rest of the group had the charcuterie plate, crab cake and risotto...yum!  For dessert we had the coffee and doughnuts (beignets lightly dusted with powdered sugar with chicory dipping sauce) - they're nice and warm bite-size pieces that taste similar to Cafe du Monde's beignets minus the thick coating of powdered sugar.  We also had creme brulee, chocolate mousse trio and bread pudding with rum sauce.  Delightful!  We were there for 3 hours.  The timing of when each course was served was just right.  It allowed us to talk and laugh (a lot), rest and digest.  I believe that a nice dinner is meant to be enjoyed and not rushed.  If you're in a hurry, you could always go somewhere else.  But if you're surrounded by people you like and want a nice meal then, Marche Bacchus is the place for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak frites
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallop risotto
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake

kaG355tOl7hGoERJgQmPMg.text: Great location, great wine list, terrible food. This place is good for an afternoon cheese and charcuterie board with a couple bottles of wine and if you're lucky, some good company. Dinner is very hit and miss, and, if I'm honest, mostly miss. I've been going here for years and it's gone consistently down hill over the past 3 years. I've been reduced to just drinking and snacking there.

TxW4-2nwTFA2nrRSKvnkSg.text: Stick to the basics and you might be okay, maybe.  Service is hit or miss.  If this is how it is with the what looks like a manager or owner on the floor then .....

ioqTelLwRjgawXUc4P_CjQ.text: best view I ever seen!lake with the dugs and tortillas.boats around.delicious wild rice with chicken.wonderful atmosphereand compliment from the restaurant to our birthday girl as a yummy desert!

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

liRhzoZZVP8zHzCSChCrxA.text: Oh my goodness. This little gem is worth any drive to find it. The food is so delicious!  The combined favors of the entrees we both enjoyed were delectable.  I had the beef tenderloin ravioli house made pasta and the beef was so tender it melted in my mouth!! My husband enjoyed the halibut fresh veggies and a citrus sauce for his entree as recommended by the server. Both of our choices were so so good!! For our appetizer I had the heirloom tomato salad and my husband devoured the smoked salmon macaroons. Oh the flavor combinations were so delicious!! We loved the ambience on the lake side with black swans to watch. A perfect evening with my love and enjoying the delicious food as well. For those who enjoy wine, you can pick your bottle from the wine cafe and have it with your dinner.  Parfait!!

g45RUXV69wXarmlILLqWjQ.text: Without question the worst service I've experienced in years. I found this place in a Yelp search, and drove here because it looked like my kind of place: a wide selection of wine with good food. I arrived at 545p and stood at the hostess counter for nearly 10 minutes, while the hostess spoke on the phone and only glanced up at me once. She then said "sorry about that" and I thought cool, just a minor glitch.  Informed her it was my first visit and asked how seating worked, as I saw a bar in the front, a dining room, and an outdoor area. She said it was my choice, and when I asked about the patio, she welcomed me to seat myself. When I walked outside there was a large group of people having a private party. I came back inside and said the patio appears to be closed, and she said "oh yeah, there's a private event" --- OK, why didn't you tell me?  She then asked "did you just want to look around or are you interested in getting something?" Huh, what an odd question. I said that I'd like a glass of wine and something to eat, then asked (again) where to sit. She offered me the bar or dining room, so I chose the bar.   The hostess gave me a wine and food list and asked if I wanted water, I said yes. When she returned with the water a few minutes later she asked if I knew what I wanted, and I inquired about a reserve wine I didn't recognize. She then asked me to point to it on the menu, but couldn't answer any of my questions -- she didn't know anything about the wines! She then sat the bottle in front of me and said "here's the bottle," and walked away.  I Vivino'd the bottle and decided I wanted a glass, but she never returned to take my order. She walked past once and said "I'll be with you in a moment," but after over 20 minutes I finally left. What a frustrating experience, especially because I also needed to pick up a bottle of wine for a dinner event.

g60AUhPoOwJUudmOL7dcSg.text: I just returned from lunch at Marche Bacchus.  The ambiance and food are just excellent.  We had escargot, the forbidden rice and chicken and mac and cheese sandwich.  Sitting on the patio is indeed a treat and the weather was wonderful today. Our service was so-so.  Slow and not friendly at all. (the server specifically) The worst part is that I was surprised that it was never mentioned to us that there is a $10 corkage fee for getting a bottle from the store.  I discovered this on my bill and it says "restaurant 750ml", so I had to ask to make sure that was what it was.  Which I would not have minded, had I been informed.  I don't think its a stretch that this should be stated up front, to customers when they ask about it before ordering wine.

RchU4oiPHD_iR3ZNVcVdkQ.text: Our original lunch plans went out the window when we figured out Americana was closed so we popped over to Marche since it's in the same complex. You walk into a wine shop which is stocked with a killer wine selection. Fun fact: you can buy a bottle to enjoy with your lunch. Not so fun fact: you are charged a corkage fee at lunch. Okay, no biggie.  There is a gorgeous patio overlooking the lake in the back. The space is somewhat small and there are a few servers taking care of tables in the space. Vito was ready to take our order so we ordered escargot. My table mate explained to him that she was allergic to shellfish which he assured her would not be an issue. We googled it after he walked away to discover that it would be an issue and asked to swap our order. Even after explaining that her reaction would be severe if she ate it he replied, "Well, I already ordered it" and walked away.  When ordering our food it wasn't much better. When we asked if he had ranch we were met with, "I don't think so" and then just stared at her. The attitude of our server was simply a bit off putting and made our entire table uncomfortable. Once we painfully submitted our order we were never checked on during our meal. Even the table next to us was having a tough time as I overheard that there was another dietary restriction that was overlooked and she was having issues as well. At the end of our meal or server awkwardly dropped off our check.  The food was mediocre, the wine and views excellent, but the service was rough. I'm not sure I'll be back soon unless I'm in need of a nice bottle of Pinot Noir.
