YRQ9shBXQhMcO5vFfScl2w.text: Excellent French restaurant located on the desert shores lakes, which make for a wonderful dining experience. The roasted chicken and fries taste amazing and similar to what you would find on the streets of Paris.

O-kovkTHFUAgJ4ryXF2Xww.text: This restaurant, what can I say? They have a location no one in the entire Las Vegas and Henderson have, amazing on the Lake for lunch, Sunset, evening, romantic, or family. Their food is absolutely good. I cannot say it is a high-end gourmet, but I loved every bite I took and we enjoyed our meal to the max. You go to a place like this to see Vegas from a different angle and not necessarily from the strip or viewing a parking lot.  So why only three stars? The idea of seating on the Lake is to get fresh air. As we walked out to the patio where is the only and best place to sit in order to get the best experiences of the restaurant, it smelled horrible. The entire patio smelled like standing water or like a huge fish tank that has never been cleaned. When we looked up at the covered patio it looked as though it is full of mold and smelled like it. When we looked straight towards the glass windows that were shut closed --- hundreds of mosquitoes covered the glass from the inside of the restaurant!! We asked the server to open the window and as she pushed against it, all the mosquitoes flu around the restaurant (needless to say we felt the tropical atmosphere LOL) then a rustic sound from the window but finally it was open. Only then, we saw the trash outside the window floating on the water against the rocks. It was a Friday afternoon and we were planning to stay for the sunset, we left when we were done and saw the sunset from home. I wish they would have fixed this throughout the winter so it would have been perfect now for the nice evenings...

QSRXyy2hXKHQHDE-0Rd0YA.text: The atmosphere far exceeds the food quality. It's an awesome wine bar and the service is almost equal to that of a fine restaurant. The menu options are great but the food itself is marginal.

fhGS-n2snkuOtukA0fdyEA.text: The easiest way to get here is to go to Lake Mead and Mariner. Make the turn onto Mariner where Buca di Beppo is, then look for Regatta and make a left. You'll be surprised to find such a beautiful wine store and restaurant overlooking their own lake, across from other beautiful houses and condominiums.   They have a heated patio and outdoor seating. The hostess, Tina, really wants you to sit outside. I have an inkling it's because there's a different server for outdoor seating and she needs to help the server out, but we opted for indoor seating and ended up with Laurel as our server.  She was very professional, nice, prompt, and sweet. She knew her menu well and was even able to provide vegetarian options to someone from another table.   The wine store is beautifully lit, has some of the awards they have received, and is a great deal for people who like to dine with wine, because normally wines are marked up 300% at a fine-dining establishment, but if you dine with Marche Bacchus and buy a bottle of wine and get it served there, the mark-up is generally only around 30%.   I've been to Marche Bacchus twice, once last year and once yesterday. Both times, the food was solid, and the service was friendly and professional.   This time around, I ordered the   Escargot: sea snails with melted herb butter. "Monte au beurre," right chef? You can never have too much butter. It was great for dipping the fresh bread they brought us as well.  Moules Frites: There aren't too many first bites where I wish I could have another first bite of that same exact bite. This was one of those rare moments. My palate was so lucky as to taste this mussel washed over with this great sauce. The taste of alcohol and butter and the freshness of the mussels really created a mezcla of bliss for a moment in time. Then I quickly went back for more. The fries are really crispy, not made in-house, probably come from a large brown bag, but the starch they battered the fries in really made the fries very crispy. Delectable! No ketchup for me!  Half-Pound Burger: Uberly soft bread, perfect medium-temperature patty, melted cheese, fresh and slightly pickled rings of onions crowned the patty, and again the same delicious and crispy fries. How could I ever be a vegetarian?  Rum Bread Pudding: Order this 30 minutes in advance. Last year, my server forgot to order it as he was supposed to time the ordering. This year, Laurel made sure to remember and even let us know when she ordered it, right around before the entrees were going to come out. When the bread pudding came out, there was a side of cinnamon apple sauce that went quite well with the bread pudding. I must add that the bread pudding was not as moist as bread puddings should normally be. Bread pudding was traditionally made with left-over bread and needed to be moist because it was supposed to be drenched in custard as that would help the bread soften. Of course, it was still very yummy.   Last year, I also had their charcuterie. From what I recall, the charcuterie had a very nice mix of pear, apple, candied walnuts, and different cheeses and thinly sliced meats. My eyes couldn't help but glance over to the 11-top next to me when the platters of fromage came to their table. There were apricots, pickles, cheeses, and slices of apples on their plates. Everything looked really delicious, even as I was ready to leave.   I am excited about my next visit to Marche Bacchus and hope it won't be another year before I come back.

tU624V_vdr9JARpAy8uvRw.text: The food was delicious and the ambiance was amazing the live entertainment was so nice especially because I was celebrating my birthday, however the service was a little slow we were there for 3 hrs and waited almost an 1 1/2 to get our food. I think if our waiter would have come to our table just once to update us on our meal or apologize for the wait it would have made a difference especially when we saw others that were seated after us get their meals first.

CYOrsU9c20DJzPK_UrtCJA.text: My husband and I come here almost every Fri after work. The 4-6PM Happy Hour is lovely, although not well-attended. The small-plate menu is perfect after a long day on the job... together with top-shelf wines at 50% discount. The bar is surrounded by boxes of amazing well-selected wines, adding to the 'wine bar' appeal. My husband is a former winemaker (San Diego) & loves the selections. JUSTINE makes it a great experience-- another reason we love coming to Marche' Bacchus! Prompt, friendly service from this lovely lady*You cant go wrong with this great menu and HH prices every weekday, 4-6PM. Hope to see you there:-)

bLCAdtnU5yyd0nQncw75Vw.text: It's good. I dig it. The ambiance can't be beat BUT...... I hate it that they put their eggs benedict on Texas Toast. It's a french joint.

El8xfOgpXcZufdRUBffY9w.text: Our first time eating here. Maybe our expectations were too high, but we expected much better service and setting. Everyone's patio table wobbled, and our server was not very attentive. It took 3 tries to get him over. I made the mistake of using the women's restroom on our way out. If one judges a restaurant by its bathroom, this place must have a very dirty kitchen. Pictures attached. Wished we would have just gone to Vintners Grill instead of trying something new.

G1wfNkfwM9YhMNIvD1utXA.text: Great hidden treasure.. The service is 5 star weather it's lunch or dinner. The location is great and I need to remember to go back more often.

Os3aIm4IRP9ulfCc2MFoSg.text: Good brunch except the main course, very dry croque Madame, they made up for it with a free dessert

1-W4C2NPKqmE0fs0HdzKCw.text: I agree. This place lost the luster. The dining experience is not a good one. The place does not seem to be kept clean and the patio is dated and dingy. At one time it was my favorite place to frequent.   It's gone  downhill over past 3yrs

HV6n6U9F-yXFZX25yqR7XQ.text: Marche Bacchus is located in a "neighborhood mall" kind of setting. When my party arrived at this place we were hesitated if we should go in or to go somewhere else. We stayed at the original plan to give this place a try and I am very happy we did.   I guess it is not duck season. They made some minor changes to the menu in oppose to the one on their website. Duck Confit Fettuccine was no longer on the menu. We ordered the chicken fettuccine, the lobster avocado croissant with ceasar salad, turkey panini and french onion soup. We also ordered some ice tea and some black-current wine. The wine menu has a huge selection with the scores for the wines. You can ordered as little as 3oz for the wine available.   The restaurant just opened when we arrived at 11ish. A gentleman was cleaning the patio and feeding the duck in the pond. My cousin got excited and went to take pictures of it. The gentleman was very kind and offered my cousin to feed the duck. Our food already arrived at that time... But seeing this attracted me and my sister to go feed the ducks too! Since we are no longer legally allowed to do this in the parks in San Francisco, we were so excited and had so much fun. The gentleman brought in more french baguette for us to feed the ducks. Many birds came by aside of the water duck, pigeons and swans started to appear once we continue feeding.   We enjoyed the food. I think that the french onion soup was a bit too salty. Other than that, the black-current wine was one of the best wine I had and the view was spectacular. Ice tea was very good since it was freshly brewed. Everyone in the restaurant were really nice people and our party all had a great experience.

CTA5zn84Gkj3jVp5PiUCUw.text: My goodness, this is a charming little restaurant that I never knew about until brought here by a friend. I can't believe I forgot to review it.  I loved the outdoor seating- nicely designed with a casual but sophisticated look that invites diners to relax and stay awhile. Someone described it as "intimate" and "romantic" and I would have to agree- a great spot for a date, or even to come by yourself!  The roof helps keep the direct heat of the sun from frying you but the space opens up to a pretty view of a small body of water populated by ducks and geese (and fish?) and lined with cute homes.    They must have updated the menu since my visit, as I now don't see the upscale version of the grilled cheese sandwich that I'd enjoyed immensely.  While the food is creative, tasty and somewhat pricey, I really would patronize this spot for the atmosphere. The waitstaff are friendly and the place is simply gorgeous.  I highly recommend this place.

1BVmpcmBUjSgNQXbfcpwNQ.text: If you want to experience a one of a kind restaurant in Las Vegas, this is the place!!!!  I have lived here for over 7 years now and it is one of my very favorite places!  The food, atmosphere and service is amazing and always are great time.  I Highly recommend Marche Bacchus!  The owners are always there to greet you and make sure you are enjoying the experience.  They care about their guests and it shows!  Worth the drive from the strip!!!

pmIdURhZSeOvXwkKyxo7Dw.text: Food is excellent, atmosphere is great, Chase (like the bank) our server was awesome, all around a great time, will definitely be back.

caA0XeUoUDoxRTCs94Vhcw.text: On a Monday night I chastised my father for making reservations and even calling to confirm; but sure enough when we arrived it was a bit busier than I thought it would be, maybe it had something to do with the live music.  Our server for the evening was French through and through and quite witty, and not a hint of snobbery- not to mention exceedingly skilled at his job.   The Escargot, though recommended with bread by our server, was delicious alone, rich and soft with just the right amount of garlic to enhance its taste.  Now I have been here 4 or 5 times, 3 since the current owners have taken over, and they always recognize/ accomodate their regulars. Marche Bacchus is a unique experience in that you can browse a really incredible array of wines before dinner and enjoy them with your meal for a $10 corkage fee- which is waived on Mondays.   Excellent at any time of day, sitting outside is really a treat- And when it gets darker opt for the upper level patio as the lighting is optimal.  They have wonderful meat and cheese platters and some of the best Bread Pudding I have ever tasted- I literally order it in advance because it does take some time to make and I always want it.   This would be the perfect for Romantic Date Ambiance, complete with impeccable service and all for such a great price.

Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining Inside
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_h99PPWK5vonIIfqdWgdPQ.text: I was so excited to bring my friend here as had a really great lunch in Oct with great food and wonderful service. So when I saw the Groupon for brunch I bought it right away! This visit was such a disappointment and I get increasingly frustrated when you go to a restaurant with a promo and they treat you like inferior customers in light of the coupon...I'm sure they expect a lower bill and lower tip but when they start with 'attitude' and the service is below par...well, the lower tip just follows! We were seated outside by request and it was very busy and somewhat hot!  Love their bread so when they brought the ONE little loaf it was gone immediately...the waiter came and we asked for more bread to go with the Charcuterie platter (which was part of the Groupon) and asked for the platter with meat and cheese to which he replied " that's what you're getting!" We actually DID want more to drink than the one mimosa that came with the cert but he took all the menus right away, never offered the mimosa special or anything else to drink although we did order a glass of wine each to enjoy with our meals. We both had the Benedict's, they were pretty good but the best was the charcuterie platter that we would've enjoyed more with bread, even though we asked two more times it never came. The discount with the Groupon was really NOT that much and the fact it seemed to create such an attitude was annoying. Might try it again but hoping it was the day, the waiter...some other reason why we felt unwelcome and uncomfortable.

T65g9D9mFAuz-aLpZhejYQ.text: Took a large group here recently and at night you don't see the charming neighborhood, or the swans and ducks, so all that remains is the food and the service.  One server for 15 people - just not enough.  One of our diners didn't get his dinner (just steak) until most of the others were finished with their dinners.  Of course, that may not have been the servers fault.  Who knows. Now the food.  Not bad, just not good enough to justify the prices.  Seared scallops - $31 for 3, yes that's three, scallops and some broccolini.  They were good - but let's get real!!! I won't go into the rest.  While no-one complained about their food, no-one thought it was great, which was a real shame.  I remember Marche Bacchus years ago when it was THE place to go in the area.  Beautiful ambiance, wonderful food - everything you wanted in a restaurant.  Still pricey, but worth it!  I also won't go into the service.  Our waiter worked hard, but there were just too many people for one person to service competently.

kAL2DTLWf41X0SZRrfiMpw.text: Last nights dinner was a culmination of years of work. I have been waiting and wanting a restaurant that is close to home that can provide an extraordinary dining experience off strip and. I hope it can be sustained and look forward to going back!

sXmSSczbQa_l8BYppodbbQ.text: Great food, Great, friendly staff, Great covered lakeside outdoor dining terrace with fireplace. A magical experience!

gV0jwr5yBycjud7fn7urBw.text: Ambiance on the patio by the water 5-star  Choice of vegetarian/vegan options 1-star  Value of the $11 Caesar salad  1-star Time to be served:10 minutes, had to ask for extra dressing, quite dry.   Time for food (sandwich) being served with 5 tables occupied: 25 minutes  Alert: don't order an appetizer salad as the entree or you will be eating 1st while your friends watch you eat, then when you are done, wait & watch them eat. Happened at next table too. Not cool.   So basically a good place to sit & have a glass of wine & salad OR sandwich if you are not in a rush.

kDESu26tYnjvzRScbMSClA.text: The outdoor patio is so relaxing & the view of the lake is beautiful! The food & was amazing, & their bread pudding is MY FAVORITE in the city. Our anniversary dinner couldn't have been more perfect. This is our new favorite restaurant in the city!

80MqnSb34t7jCnkALDb4jA.text: This was perfect for us. My daughter took me here for my birthday. The food was delicious and service excellent. View of the lake is a welcome sight in the desert. We picked out a bottle of wine in the shop and had that with dinner. Overall, I guess the price is good, but I did not see the bill. One of best birthday diners I've experienced.

bqlJGmOu2UARxSgh6MG5LA.text: Our dinner was excellent, the dining room was lovely. We enjoyed our evening at Marche Bacchus.  The only issue was the waiter.  He seemed very disinterested all evening.  He forgot to tell us about the specials. Otherwise a great evening with reasonable prices.

4JC7mbfctVYE1WxG-LH5ug.text: Marche Bacchus is a hidden gem in the desert of Las Vegas.  Situated right next to a lake, this restaurant and wine shop is a fabulous place to enjoy a leisurely lunch (or dinner) with excellent company.  For our dining enjoyment, my companion and I shared the Bacchus Grazing Platter ($18, Selection of Imported Cheese, Meats, Lobster Salad, Smoked Salmon, Olives, Fruit, Onion Marmalade served with French Baguette); Salad Bacchus ($8, Goat cheese Croutons, Mesclun salad, Pine Nuts, Beurre Rouge); and the Lobster Avacado Croissant ($9, Celery, sliced Tomatoes and Lemon Vinaigrette).   The Bacchus Grazing Platter was a fabulous choice!  They offered three cheeses - brie, blue, and morbier.  The morbier was absolutely delicious, but the blue was a bit too crumbly for my choice.  This is an excellent choice if you're ordering wine too.  (We had to pass, it was our first meal of the day.)    The Lobster Avocado Croissant was stuffed with lots of lobster salad.  Very yummy, but I would have wanted a bit more avocado in my sandwich.  (It is called a Lobster Avocado Croissant after all.)  A side of Caesar salad accompanied this sandwich.    Last to arrive was the Bacchus Salad.  After already dining on the wine platter and the sandwich, we could have done without the salad.  My companion did enjoy the goat cheese croutons, but the salad was average.    The great thing about this place is that you can go through their wine selection (they are a wine shop after all), pick a bottle of wine and enjoy that bottle with your meal.  (There's a $10 corkage fee.)    Service was okay.  Our waiter was average.  He never bothered telling us the daily special or anything.  The waitress who took over his shift was much better and a lot more pleasant.  I could hear her interactions with the other diners was much more impressed with her customer service skills than our waiter.  And of course, please sit outside when dining here, especially for lunch.  With a shaded area and a mist, it's not hot out and the view of the lake makes it a fabulous place to just sit, relax, eat, drink, and just immerse yourself in the company of your dining companion(s).  It can easily be a romantic spot if you let it be, or go with friends and enjoy a couple of glasses of wine.  They are soon to be offering wine tasting events in the near future which I would definitely be interested if I were in the area more often.  Eat, drink, and be merry!  They are open for Sunday brunch (10 am to 3 pm); Lunch (10:30 am to 4 pm) and Dinner (4:30pm-10pm).  (Check out the photos of our meal above!)

JjtvKho9-wgi73vbvoQCuA.text: Went for dinner Saturday night, back for brunch the next morning. The service was great; polite, enthusiastic waiters, very helpful hostess (found us outdoor seating in 10 minutes!). The food was good; the charred octopus appetizer was a bit bland, the duck was excellent, the portions were good size for dinner. Dessert was excellent; the creme brulee was perfectly done, with a nice crust, not too thin or watery. Brunch was very good as well; the chicken & fries had perfectly cooked chicken, and the coffee was not too dark, not too light. Also, the wine selection was excellent, since the restaurant includes a wine store, you can pick a bottle from the store and take it straight to your table. I'll definitely be going back.

Nax7ci9I0mmSlly0MADWfg.text: I wish I could comment about the food but my friends and I never got to our table. On our way in, Tracy, the host, made us wait while she finished her phone call. When she was done with her phone call, we thought we were finally going to get our table. Instead, she started stuffing menus in a menu holder and then took another phone call. While she was doing that, my friends and I browsed through their wine selection to pass the time.  At some point, one of my friends asked her if they're open. After a 15-minute wait and almost as an afterthought, Tracy picked up 4 sets of menu and led us to our table. At this point, we already decided not to eat there. We declined and told her why. She was so indignant about being told that she was being discriminating. Worst customer service ever!

uCayi7XzjznwH58vOYKs_g.text: Everything is amazing here, great atmosphere, perfect service and delusions food. Love it! I truly recommend this place. The vine selection is huge, for every taste. Bering by the lake and having such a great experience is really something different for Vegas! Once again - make a reservation and enjoy the best relaxing European restourant!

TXkvLkclSYUtFIlwE4llAA.text: The atmosphere is so romantic, the wine is fabulous. The food is super good. I loved the flavor and am beyond satisfied! The service was amazing. I felt like an old friend. I'm looking forward to going back for brunch

7WXoRDqRnV4SdrEZbm0e6A.text: The service here is the absolute worst I have ever had! If it was possible to leave 0 stars I would. First off the wait time was very long even though they were not very busy at all. Second when I asked for two children's menus and was only given one. When I asked for the other the so called manager Angelo  rudely responded "do you want me to read it for you?" One of the people in our party asked for salmon and when the food was being served we were told they no longer had salmon and had made crab instead without even giving us the option to choose something else!!! My husband ordered the bottomless mimosas and was only served two we had to get up from the table and serve ourselves!! After all of this we spoke with the manager and he could obviously care less and did not even try to make matters right!!  With so many great restaurants in the area I highly suggest going somewhere else and stay far away from here.

7aGwgd-jeBHbnuD0hhWWOQ.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas - the ambiance can't be matched. Sitting outside (all of the tables are outside) overlooking a lake in Desert Shores at twilight can't be beat! And then there is the food - the food is always excellent! I have yet to have a meal that hasn't been well enjoyed. The service is always great - the servers help to make the night feel effortless! I will continue to come to this restaurant as often as possible!

lA_HuNakXKoSGdHb_djvkA.text: It is SO hard to find restaurants with beautiful views for locals (not on the strip/downtown) and not only is this spot a winner for its view but BONUS!!!--It's on the water too! Now you REALLY can't find that anywhere else in Vegas! I came here for bottomless mimosas and brunch on a Sunday and we were able to get a beautiful spot right outside with a view of the water. I can't wait to come back here again!

Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful restaurant with a beautiful view

1saKRjRxTI35_QkjFlTACw.text: The service was great and the atmosphere is really nice. We sat on the patio and I loved it it was a perfect day out and the lake was really nice to look at.  As far as the food goes I got the egg plant on the lunch menu and it was good aside from the fact that it was slightly cold. The cheese was hard on it. But aside from that it was delicious.

wf4J84I1N-5UdGBSEdb6lw.text: The service is great and the food is good, but the outdoor dining area was just filthy. The windows were grimy and streaked with dirt and bird droppings, spoiling the water view. The shelves on the wall were chipped and broken, the floor was dirty, and the canvas patio cover was disgusting. It was filled with dirt and dead leaves, with holes patched with old tape. The more I looked around, the worse it got. As we were leaving, we noticed the remodeled interior was also a mess, with visible plywood and glue where tiles were supposed to be. Hopefully they'll get around to remodeling the patio as well, or at least a power wash on the floors and windows. I used to love this place but I was just grossed out by the condition and probably won't be back.

igfBRChaZriJ0FHnlGj_wg.text: Was originally going to Americana next door, but they were closing early for some reason. So we ambled over to Marche Bacchus.   For a Friday night, we found it easy to get a table with no reservation. We chose inside, though outside seemed fun with live music.   After sitting, we quickly ordered drinks. The jack and coke I got was as expected, my date enjoyed their version of an Olde Fashioned very much.   Easily our favorite dish was the Truffled Goat Cheese Napoleon. Layered Puff Pastry, pistachios, honey, arugula and Frisee were all perfectly balanced. The crunch and creaminess that is a hallmark of any Napoleon was a welcome sound for every bite. The goat cheese, pistachio and honey worked so well together, I'm surprised more places don't use it.   We also ordered French Onion Soup which was ok, nothing special. And a salad, that I forget details of, outside that it had pears in it. It was fresh and had a good crunch, though was also less memorable.   Finally, we shared the Lobster Cavatelli, which, in both of our opinions, was the definition of "meh". Each component was cooked well, but the recipe or the mixture was not great. It felt like it was impressed with Lobster being in the dish too much, which let the rest of the dish falter.   This is our first time here, and I have heard positive reviews in the past, so we may try again, but with a different line up...plus the Napoleon.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Lb6lzgFG7XolhQh4mTzo9A.text: Just discovering this place, I actually came here twice this week. Both times I was impressed by the service, food and the setting. I was reluctant to try it due to some of the low Yelp reviews, but I have to say, I couldn't disagree more with those negative reviews.   I had the lobster croissant and Caesar salad for Sunday brunch and the blackened salmon and goat cheese napoleon for a weekday lunch. Great food, excellent service, reasonably priced, and close to home. It actually felt like we were on vacation somewhere far away from Vegas.

omuY7OykdFspUma8knGCZA.text: This was my first time dining at Marche Bacchus. My boyfriend brought me here for dinner on a quiet Saturday. He's been here previously for a birthday brunch, as well as picking up wine. Anyway, we were pretty much in the mood to wine & dine, and that's exactly what we did with a 3 course meal.   The sun was setting as they were seating us at the patio right next to the fireplace. I was hesitant at first because it was soooo cold out there, but our server Vince kindly asked if I wanted the overhead heater to be turned on. I couldn't get over how beautiful the view was from where we were sitting (mostly because we don't see a lot of water in Vegas lol).  Appetizers: -Roasted Hudson Valley Foi Gras  -Chef's Selection of Artisan Cheeses  I must say, I wasn't sure how to feel about the Foi Gras. The flavors were definitely there, but I just think I wasn't used to the textures. It melts in your mouth & it was definitely interesting. On the other hand, I enjoyed the cheeses and the Chardonnay I ordered to pair it with.  *Vince kindly brought us other wines to taste. Very sweet of him*  Entrees: -Steak "Frites"  -Oven Roasted Grouper  I ordered the steak frites and it was delicious. The wagyu was cooked medium rare and was tender and juicy. I paired my entree with a Pinot Noir. My boyfriend ordered the Grouper and he says the flavors were perfectly balanced. He paired his entree with a Cab. Yummm!!   Dessert: creme brulee   As if we weren't full enough, our wonderful server Vince showed us the dessert menu and he recommended the creme brulee. I was a fan of the custard base, but I found the caramel on top to be too sweet for me. Still very good!   Overall, my first experience here was phenomenal. It was literally the perfect date night, from the atmosphere to the food and service. It was intimate and romantic. You definitely get what you pay for.  10/10 would recommend.

VEZcN4S9bTKmMuRARSVgNQ.text: Sunday Brunch!! What a great way to spend Sunday late morning/early afternoon!!  Everything was lovely!  The bottomless mimosas, the excellent food and the best and most fun waiter, Erik!

555fAVc6nP_0kmTu0E5M4w.text: We came in for bottomless brunch on Sunday. It was a beautiful sunny day, perfect for the lakeside tables. The food was good, but the ambiance and service is the real winner here! I was happy to have such a personable, happy server despite a heavy dose of pretension wafting from some nearby tables. The feel and views from the tables closest to the lake are great and very relaxing. Plus, you can't beat bottomless mimosas that were never left empty!

Xsh1WefjXK8iBBzmwLyjRQ.text: Top notch service from Alexis our server from lunch today, we enjoy our experience here, we are local servers from the cosmopolitan and the Venitian Casino and alexis is very polite and kind, the food is great, prices are not bad for lunch, nice view of the lake, hostess is very kind too, she even buss our table . To the management!!! Always keep a busser and one server, you never know wen a few tables like today walk in, like today Alexis was running by himself. Just an advice. I will recommend this place to all my friends and family is very peaceful atmosphere.

HPd99aQLRLevwgJdUfWP-g.text: If you love wine or are looking for a romantic spot this is your place. Leave Las Vegas, lose yourself in the "wine store" and settle down with your date and carefully selected bottle of wine overlooking a lake on a romantic indoor/outdoor patio. Great prices on wine combined with excellent food and a uniquely Marche Bacchus ambiance combine for a great experience.  Join the club of locals who make themselves regulars here. Highly recommended.  We had the Crane Reserve Syrah by the glass, delicious BIG red followed by a bottle of the Bressler Cab. Yum. Steak Frites, can't go wrong there....  We'll be back. Appreciate the effort the owner/operators have put into this special experience.

5DLgZK0pCRQ2cOEIwkJo6A.text: Great ambiance, great wines, great food and amazing service! A hidden gem in Northwest Las Vegas. Want to try something that is off the beaten path in Las Vegas you must come in here!

DcP-__xm5YDXkTWZ53S5bQ.text: This is one of our favourite restaurants in Las Vegas. Private location...provides an environment for a nice, intimate meal. The pattio is wonderful year round, but particularly in the Spring and early summer. The food is wonderful and the service has always been great.

PvDnyE_rIAU2JjIVYis5eg.text: Food is delicious and reasonably priced. Great brunch options and they are willing to accommodate any food restrictions which is always awesome! I love how you can sit on the covered patio and overlook the lake.   Staff is friendly and very attentive. Will definitely come back soon!

MsFVA08I0yeQGvOlVWXHVA.text: Too bad the chef is leaving. We came for one of her last nights... sadly the service wea terrible. Waitress didnt know the menu... bartender wasnt interested in our order and it took a very long time to get our food after our 20 min delay from being seated and  irdering... challenge to get water...wanted a mich better night... Oh well... didnt get what I paid for.

mx2mu2riwcOu05zZ1GWH6A.text: This place is perfect for any and all occasions.  Beautiful place for date night.  Sit outside with a bottle of wine from the excellent wine selection and enjoy the calming water view.   Equally as great for  Sunday brunch with a group of friends for a lively way to end your weekend.  I have even had my office Christmas party here which was a great, fun time for all.   All the appetizers are delicious.  The duck entree pictured is one of my favorites.  The beet salad is excellent with all beets.  (Not like some places that serve all greens with one little beet. ) LOL.  Really I encourage all locals and visitors to give Marche a try.  You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck is always perfectly cooked.  So good you will actually start craving it.
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Napoleon.  Very light as a starter but still has so much flavor you feel satisfied.

_9ceRuwM0U0c1vHzUWxOnA.text: We came for a Sunday brunch on a beautiful Spring morning.  The setting next to the lake is really quite lovely. The service was very attentive. Unfortunately, the food did not live up to the setting. It was just mediocre. If the setting is the most important factor in choosing a Sunday brunch restaurant, then this is an excellent choice. If outstanding food is the most important factor, you may consider looking elsewhere.

o460rCR9KKgOl3nxie3uUA.text: We came in for restaurant week and the menu was delightful. My partner and I shared the salmon BLT and the forbidden rice which was seasoned very well. We are glad to know this restaurant is in town, we only wish the misters could have been on outside, it's was a tad hot.

XKkVuit-l3Pb55zIEe4PJA.text: I have recently had lunch at Marche Bacchus and although the food was good, there is something about this restaurant that makes me not want to go back. Before this last experience, my last visit to Marche Bacchus was probably about 15 years ago. This time I was participating in the Restaurant Week (prix fixe menu), so it is not like my food choice was exotic, and the place wasn't particularly busy. Still, I waited about 20 minutes for the wine and about 1 hour 15 minutes for the main course. The wine glass arrived dirty (looked like BBQ sauce fingerprints), the knife was dirty as well;  both were replaced but by then the experience was ruined. I don't think I will be giving Marche Bacchus another try.

wBNmM8mFm1eAACFq_vx50g.text: Setting and presentation at this restaurant is wonderful, but prices are a little steep towards what you receive. Highly recommend being seated inside for dinner, and stopping by the wine store before/after your meals. The location is extremely convenient for individuals in the community.

6jyrauPGhYcLspunK5TUxQ.text: Marche Bacchus is a really great restaurant. This was my second time and I was impressed both times. This time we got a cheese platter for an appetizer and it was quite good. Our server was very friendly. The downside to this trip was that it took quite a long time to get our drinks and appetizers. Honestly, it was worth the wait. I ordered the fish and chips for my meal. It was extremely fresh but the fish was sooooooo small. The size was disappointing but the taste was delicious. Given the price, I thought the portion size would be larger. Like I shared above, the server was super friendly but he talked like he was in this upper class establishment that was almost humorous. Please talk normally. They provide complementary bread and butter which is very good. It was my husband's birthday and they prepared a great dessert to celebrate his day. It was a good experience; just a few adjustments to make this a True 5 star restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2sjQH8VdKxOzZqQZtNSygg.text: Morty took amazing care of us! Great wine recommendation (daou from paso robles). Literally was the best prime rib eye I've ever tasted in vegas. The flavoring and sauce superb! Whipped potatoes and asparagus were to die for... don't even get me started on the chocolate lava cake. Wonderful experience! Beautiful ambiance. It was 100 out during dinner and we are outside and with the lake breeze we didn't even notice. They had  misters on outside on the patio when we first got there and our table was soaked ... they didn't need to be on but then before our bread and cheese plate came thankfully they went off the rest the time we were there. Otherwise I feel like our meal would of been soggy. All in all one of the best dining experiences I've ever had in Vegas. We will definitely be back!

zhHlBQxvzEZ1OFa77lyg4Q.text: I love the ambience at this place. The deck on the lake feels like you're not even in Vegas anymore. And the food is amazing. My favorite is the grilled octopus!! They also have a beautiful wine selection. Perfect place to hang out with friends or to take a date.

KHf_SL57l7DTJtQm5gRMdQ.text: Prices here are a bit steep, and I don't think the view is particularly great - we're talking man-made lake with a bunch of houses. Still, there aren't many places like this in Vegas. Our table was a bit infested with lake bugs, though they were easy to wipe away or shoo. Our food was tasty, though the salmon salad has a rather bland dressing. The lobster sandwich had a decent amount of meat in it and tasted quite good.  Not sure if I'll return any time soon, but in a concrete city it's a nice little retreat.

-7S3P1NK8MGOBN9Tj4ijhA.text: Four of us went in for Sunday brunch. And let me start by saying I have no issue paying a corkage fee.   So...We told the server we would like to purchase a bottle of wine and asked for suggestions from their list. The server said you can go into the store and select a bottle of wine of your choice for purchase and then we will serve it to you.  But when we received our bill we had a corkage fee added to our bill. Seriously?  This was a bottle from your store that you basically sell at full retail AND then you charge a corkage fee.  It is only fair to make a profit once... Not twice.  And you should tell your customers in advance that a corkage fee will be applied to an "ON SITE" purchase. I would have brought a MUCH better bottle of wine for us to enjoy and paid your corkage fee.  SHAME ON YOU! We will not be back.

zW0GUlgwFzRqoRSxSP4w6Q.text: I don't think I've ever written a rating in the middle of a meal. All I can say is that I am thoroughly impressed. It's been a few years since I've been here and I will be back. From the moment we walked through the door, we were treated so well. We are enjoying a wonderful cheese plate, looking at this gorgeous view and sipping on some Vin Perdu at well below the retail price. Don't miss this hidden gem of Las Vegas.

_hrRP7JcB7C_2wMulS8Yow.text: Such a beautiful place to have a delicious meal. Romantic, beautiful and peaceful is how I would describe the setting. Sitting outside even on the hottest of hot days is nice because of the fans and misters! The food is out of this world delicious! The mussels are a 10+, best French onion soup I have ever had, salads are fresh and delicious, braised need sandwich was so tender it melted in my mouth. Deserts are mouthwatering - all of them!   I'm not much of a wine person but they are very helpful if you are not. They do have a huge selection for those that do love wine.   Overall this place is a perfect place for a beautiful meal and setting.

AJ862ZeHM9YGWD5VSkJgYQ.text: A hidden gem. Awesome service from Jordan. Food was excellent! Next time in Vegas I will return just for brunch and bottomless mimosas

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch menu

paEv5FE8qqg--_pU-fmqJg.text: Absolutely love their goat cheese truffle Napoleon and the peaceful view! Love their selections of wine.  The only reason why I won't give it 5 stars is the staff (some at least) seem very unhappy with their jobs. People nowadays should be grateful they ha e a job and feel excited to go to work.

ag-iPZPZO880VBtq_uuYMg.text: Each of the dishes here are rich, filling and delicious. We had the charcuterie sampler, lobster risotto, chocolate ice cream and Rose. Despite this strange combination of dishes, it was a great meal. The charcuterie plate was a little bit too exotic for me but it offers a good variety of things to try.   Hands down, if anything about this restaurant were to bring me back, it would be the atmosphere. The dining area is right next to the edge of a lake with swans, ducks, and baby swans/ducks. This restaurant is charming and perfectly hidden. It's the perfect place for a date

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rosé please

19piofIB_g6RvCe49ou52Q.text: What happened?? I used to live in the area and frequently ate here 2 years ago. Went back while in town and I'm not sure which was worse between the food and rude non existent service! Details not necessary but disappointing the ownership would let this happen so hopefully they'll clue into all the bad reviews and think about what they've done differently over the last few years and fix it!

3RXXaxcnftB36OIOHhIwxw.text: This restaurant is the best in the world. The food is amazing and the atmosphere is like no other The  view of the lake is fantastic and I would 10/10 recommend to go there. It is a little pricey but I think when it comes to the service and food quality, the money is 100% worth it.

Lms5gvc__9d2mdwNk3xgRg.text: I love that Marche Bacchus has this wonderful wine shop. We always find a tasty and affordable bottle to complement our dinner.   HOWEVER  Last night we ended up having a 2.5 hour dinner because service was incredibly slow. It took 30 minutes to place our dinner order and each dish was paced out in 30 minute breaks.   Our server was very nice, but I couldn't figure out how it was taking so long for everything.   We have decided that we won't be returning to Marche Bacchus for dinner, but we will be back for more great wine.

zFNrD-BQ_3kOHkqxvHEd_Q.text: This place is very close to our home, but it also holds fond memories for us. I have done their Sunday brunch on a number of occasions here and generally opted for their Crab and Asparagus Benedict which consisted of a toasted English Muffin, Poached Eggs, Blue Crab, Asparagus in Bearnaise Sauce. I have also had and enjoyed their Lobster Salad Croissant with fresh tomatoes and avocado. The price point is fairly reasonable for the quality of the food and the wonderful views of the lake. During my pregnancy this was one of my favorite places to stop by for dessert in the evenings after my husband got off work and just unwind taking in the serenity of the lake and live music on certain nights while catching up on our day.   The service has always been very friendly and professional. We have always been treated with respect and given the same amount of courtesy whether we were having a full blown meal or just coming through for a dessert or a cheese plate.

Jw884m57fzrPVKRPi7g91g.text: Service  Food  Atmosphere   Came out for an event, the food is so good.  I forgive everything else because the food was so good

LW3_rAu3hiqgxXR9o4mCuw.text: Wonderful as always the escargots was wonderfully seasoned the wine was a perfect compliment and the service was outstanding this is a must for a wonderful lunch dinner or Sunday brunch
