tgBHQsozWldV_ez8L9K9gA.text: Came in with friends who raved about this place. Sat down and was horrified by the service. Took over 20 min for waiter to come and take our drink order. Had to ask for bread, and an appetizer. Our drinks and cheese plate arrived 15 min later. The waiter seemed not interested or engaged, he was doing us a favor.  The food came out over salty, cold, and out right inedible. We asked to speak to the manager. He arrived cheerful and quickly became aggressive raising his voice. He informed us he would take care of problem but never returned.  We asked for the check(which should have been comped) nope. Paid and will NEVER return. As we were leaving our waiter was laughing at us.  Management, chefs and waitstaff all need a kick in the ass. The place has so much potential, service and food was F quality. This place deserves zero stars.

_o9UTQ43wFQg7b10a6H_Og.text: One of the best restaurants in Vegas. The service was impeccable. The food was extraordinary. The ambiance was romantic. Love!!

L3pJ3J7JmKeSFcy2ploefQ.text: Positively the best Westside restaurant and one of the best French restaurants in town!    Their bread pudding is well worth the wait.  Be sure to get a table outside, overlooking Lake Jacqueline.

fgKyapktEEfQDseoItywbw.text: I'll keep it short. The service was spot on and the amazing. We will be back. It was romantic, but it was July so we didn't sit on the patio, to humid. The live music was very pleasant

rJNCcQ0T06QQtbxcQlOO_Q.text: I was so exited to try this place out but I got so disappointed!! I guess I was unlucky... Came here around 1:00pm. We were seated right away.  It took over 15 minutes for our waitress, Mandy to come over and take our order because she decided to take other table's order first that came after us. Took another 10 minutes for her to bring water and iced tea. At this point, the other table's (that came after us) food was already on their table. We waited another 10 minutes and asked the waitress where our food is. She said "in a couple of minutes." but  I think she forgot to put our order in. We waited another 10 minutes and saw the other table had their desserts on the table. So we left. 45 minutes wasted.  I understand sometimes kitchen could get backed up and the service would become slow, but at least they could have put a bread on our table. No apologies either!! We were starving and upset!! So disappointing!!

YwykIlWk7HaH-TDrXMHtiQ.text: The Las Vegas restaurant options are plentiful and sometimes overwhelming.  You can always go to the strip and get something that is pretty good, but incredibly overpriced and you have to deal with some interesting people on your way to the restaurant.  If you are like me and live in Las Vegas and don't want to deal with the strip every time you would like a nice meal this is a restaurant you should try.  Their wine selection is great and their food even better.  My husband and I ordered their beef tenderloin, duck, and a side of their mash potatoes.  All were delicious, and the been tenderloin truly melted in your mouth.  (All restaurants always claim their tenderloin will melt in your mouth, but few actually succeed.)  The outside patio, on the lake, was charming and the staff was excellent.  There was live music and I loved how the restaurant's noise level was very low compared to some of the other fine dinning establishments we have visited.  Check this place out, you won't be disappointed.

KlIafG8bQQRxG3fz2dCdxQ.text: Visit: Sunday Brunch, Oct. 25, 2015.  It was a beautiful day, the restaurant was busy, my friend and I were seated outside at a wonderful table for two overlooking the lake.  The waiter was prompt, attentive, and friendly.  We ordered two Lobster Croissants, one with a Caesar Salad, the other with French Fries.  After our meal, for dessert we ordered two Cappuccinos, a Tiramisu, and a Fruit Tart.  I can't find my receipt, but I paid with cash and recall leaving around $75, which included a 20% tip.  Lobster Croissant:  As someone that first eats with my eyes, I must admit that the presentation leaves much to be desired. The sandwiches looked haphazardly thrown together -- and even lacked consistency between how the two sandwiches were prepared...one sandwich having a balance of ingredients, the other having very little avocado and a croissant that could have been better toasted.   So, there sat a plate of beautiful ingredients...Lobster with fresh avocado, inside of a buttery croissant!  And yet, sadly, the star of the show (the Lobster) had to compete with the red onions that gave it a bite that I could have just done without. And, the lobster salad itself was "very" sweet -- I couldn't quite put my finger on it...I couldn't tell if the dressing had sugar added or if the lobster was imitation. *you be the judge*  Tiramisu:  It was uneventful. *not good, not bad* I liked that I could taste the tartness of the cheese, but I would have enjoyed it more if I could taste a stronger espresso flavor -- it just didn't come through.  Fruit Tart:  My first impression was..."Jeez, that's tiny - I should've ordered two."  Despite the small portion, the deconstructed components of this dessert are lovely in of themselves!  The crust of the tart is flaky, the custard creamy and perfectly sweet, the berries are fresh, and the sorbet was flavorful.   However, as a cohesive dish?!  Ehhh! :-/ The thing is, there was too much crust and fruit to custard ratio.     Feedback:  If the tart is made to order, it would be nice to have the crust/shell filled completely with custard.   And the sorbet would be best served on the side or better yet replaced all together with something like whipped cream, vanilla ice cream or sorbet, or vanilla cream fraiche.  ----------   Side Note:  I've been a customer of Marche' Bacchus for many-many years. There was a time when I would eat here several times a week because my office was just around the corner, the food was Fabulous!!! I adored this place in every way! However, although the staff is wonderful and the atmosphere has pretty much remained the same throughout the years, the food has gone from Fabulous to simply good/okay. -- I don't know who or what changed in the kitchen, but it is blatantly obvious that things are very different...and it saddens me to say, not for the better.    For now, I will continue to patron Marche' Bacchus on occasion for all the reasons that I still adore it -- and hold the hope that things will get better.

-exOfja__SZSQnksDswovw.text: Happy Father's Day 2013!!! The gurlpren took me here for Father's Day and I admit, I would have never found this place because it's located smack in the middle of a residential area. We arrived right before noon and it was still a little quiet, especially for great day like Father's Day. Dining for us was outside and even though we were in the middle of 100+ degree Vegas weather, we were kept cool with the shade and cool mist. The service was great, staff was attentive, and the ambiance was relaxing. My GF had a view of the lake, which was the relaxing part. My opinion, I had the best view. As for their food, lets start with their menu. Their menu for brunch was simple and prices are what to expect from a French Restaurant. Actually, their prices for what you get are pretty good. I got their Steak & Eggs, which is also served with some home fries. The steak was the highlight. I would guess about 6 oz of well seasoned, well prepared, and thinly sliced steak. Normally steak & eggs come a little dry. Not here, their steak was juicy and delicious. For my pre-steak meal, I got a cup of their French Onion Soup. This was delicious as well. It wasn't overly salty and had enough of an onion kick to it. This was my first time here and I was impressed with their service and quality of food. I'm still curious what dinner is like here so I'm going to have to come back. I'm also appreciative to my GF for surprising me with memorable Father's Day brunch. 1OAK! Steak & Eggs: yelp.com/user_local_phot... French Onion Soup: yelp.com/user_local_phot...

NavlRpJiMK6GOLcR0kUpgg.text: Quite possibly the worst food with the best service I have ever had. Based on the reviews and the recommendations of friends I clearly caught them on a bad day.   Great outdoor seating, excellent service but the most banal, mediocre food I have ever encountered.   Salmon salad - blah Lobster croissant - blah Warm Turkey sandwich - ok Brie Bacon Burger - ick Escargot - Tasty Calamari - Not bad. Pretty good The best of all the items   Our server was delightful, helpful and very pleasant.    A+ service  A - ambiance  D- food

BPgxmsIApg2kSKKEPu2v6w.text: Food was good  Service not bad  We were sitting outside and I wasn't sure if I can manage to finish my meal because of flies and roaches

vacKT_HbcS7-rBpHdOlKBw.text: Incredible food and beautiful restaurant.  Loved sitting next to the open window by the lake, our food was AMAZING - best crab cakes, salmon, and steak dinners I've ever had! Great wine selection, live music, awesome ambiance.  Also - the bread is great, the service is awesome and they're attentive, and you leave feeling like you got your money's worth. We will definitely be coming back here!

OAX7mrmWO8mj9caVi46k3A.text: After hearing so much about this restaurant, I decided to take my parents and wife here for their Mother's Day brunch. I am aware that French cuisine is known for its small portions, but honestly, this was a joke. Two miniscule, tasteless courses (a magnifying glass would have been helpful) and a dessert that tasted as if it came straight from the freezer - all for $50 a head. Oh, and they had the nerve to charge extra for coffee. In summary, I spent over $200 for a terrible, mini meal and a bad case of indigestion.

RCJahmyWCrOcce1rkCNhcA.text: I was so disappointed by the experience we had at Marche Bacchus. I had read great reviews and expected a nice Sunday brunch.   After being seated on the patio with a great view of the lake, our waiter came and took our drink order. This was 12:47. At 1:21 our waiter returned with drinks however they were incorrect. We ordered our meal. The food then took another 20 min to arrive.   During this time we were not offered bread, while the other tables around us were provided bread. I ordered the Grits with Beef. I was severely disappointed that this $18 entree has 3 silver dollar sized slices of beef and the poached egg was over cooked so the yolk was hard. The overall flavor was good. The whole experience was disappointing because the potential for a nice brunch was there.

F5JrQRKVgZ1EV33FnUvfTg.text: This is a somewhat hidden gem. It's oddly placed in a tiny stripmall smack dab in the middle of a residential area. I was referred here by a previous coworker. I've been here three times now and have had pretty decent experiences each time. Truffled goat cheese Napolean, um yes please!! The philo puffed pastry is so flaky and buttery, it melts in your mouth.. the goat cheese, mmmmmm! Highly recommended! Service here is hit or miss.. The lobster salad croissant is ok...there are way better things to eat here, take it from me..,I learned the hard way.!  The turkey sandwich on the lunch menu, yum!  The burger is one of the best I've ever had in my life! No lie! The Brie is the icing on the cake, so to speak.. I love my red meat, and they cook it to perfection! I can't even explain how melty in my mouth their tenderloin and mashed potatoes is..  I swear, you can't go wrong with whatever you order!  No cocktails here, it's pretty much a wine specialty place.. however, when I mentioned I'm from Michigan where there are a ton of vineyards up north, the waiter suggested they may be able to order me a special wine! Much to my dismay, the request was declined.  The stocked Riesling is on the sweet side, which is how I like it. If you order a bottle with dinner, they charge a $10 service fee. I don't exactly care for this, but it is what it is. I just would like to be told ahead of time. I've got $10, just let me know!  The view is so pretty. The facility sits on a tiny lake..it's the desert, not the Pacific coast..we take what we can get! Once here for lunch, a friendly duck even came inside to greet patrons! I do enjoy watching the black swans on the lake...but you can't see them at all at night. It can be kind of cold in the winter (even with the provided heaters).. perhaps another glass of wine will warm you up :-) One of my favorite local places, I'll be back!

vt-lpGjPEsRBYd471inDrA.text: Where should I start? The food had hair in it, my wife almost puked. She took the hair out of her mouth that was in the steak.  The service was too slow, they kept forgetting about us. It is overpriced, you are basically paying for the view that was other people's backyard.  Horrible experience.

40mWuX-IQAGExatdSSqyTw.text: Delish lunch today.  The steak and bearnaise was melt in your mouth.   Their yellowtail appetizer was delicate and delightful.   Kudos to the chef!!!

vRNq-OQb5AUgXEUhgVXkUg.text: Love the view. Love the wine selection.   The Lake backdrop is extraordinary for Las Vegas.   So you get to shop thru the wine store & drink the bottle you buy.  Great concept & lots to choose from.  The owner manager can be quite helpful.   Probably best to arrange a driver who is not drinking. This restaurant is a bit out of the way for us so until Uber gets to town, we have a hard time going there as my sweet guy won't drink a drop and drive.    Service always seems pretty nice here.

eWyO-DG2lSRzfx15A8Jcew.text: Ate here the other day for a dinner meeting... The appetizers, main entre, dessert and cocktails  were superb...our server Nicole is phenomenal...haven't been in years and after such a great experience I will frequent more often...

wvjpkcw3Fci-nZMGGy5WLg.text: This is a good restaurant in my rotation. The best item on the menu is the short ribs with grits. I'd try something else but I can't bring myself to do it! The French onion soup is heavenly. Found the oysters Rockefeller to be too salty, but it's fixable. Great wine and drink selection.

YZRnzljBuvWuoIhANwlg6w.text: OMG! This place is great it like a little hidden gem. The view was amazing, it looks over the little lake. The food was great. I had the chicken and waffles with a side of breakfast potatoes. The chicken was so moist and the waffles were luscious and fluffy. My only complaint about the food was that they used way to much rosemary, I'm still picking out little pixies if rosemary in my teeth. But what made this experience wonderful was our server Ian. Ian was awesome there was about 7 of us, our waters coffee's and mimosas were always kept full. Ian was very polite and had a great attitude and was very knowledgeable about the menu. His service was absolutely outstanding!!

CfMrt8TwUvrSJ4xDAOLRpA.text: This restaurant... Is by far one of the greatest restaurants I've been in Las Vegas. The ambience is fantastic it's right by Desert Shores on the lakes. The food is fantastic make sure you get the octopus and the duck tacos... Also the Foie gras!! The service is great as well Vinnie always takes care of us. If you're looking for something off the strip that's great this is your place:)

ULKHA54U5UIbHQGpArIZSw.text: I want to love this place, I really do. I LOVE local, small businesses, but after giving this place a second try...it's honestly just OK at best. The location on the lake is beautiful, but they NEED to clean the patio area, especially the roof that is full of dirt and leaves that the wind blows into your food and drinks. The thin, blonde hostess had an attitude and sat us at a terrible table on the patio with no view, directly in front of a fireplace that was off despite it being in the 60s and raining. The food was unremarkable. It's not bad, but it definitely wasn't worth the $60 we spent on lunch for two of us. Uninspired and tepid would be the most accurate description I could give it.   The young blonde server (who's makeup was ON POINT) was the highlight of our experience. The service was slow, but I highly doubt this was her fault. This place clearly has something special going for it given its tenure in the city.... but given the fact we were the only patrons in there under 65, I'd suggest a refresh to keep up with the times and attract new customers.

6AHZkOmd_bzSznt4g4Y4tw.text: Such a wonderful place to enjoy brunch  Vince was fabulous, very attentive and knowledgeable.

62g5cOPETZvl866sw5sPKg.text: Had a great dinner with friends last night.   Table on the water side with open window wall.  Great experience.  Good food and wine.  Definitely come back for a special night.   Buy wine in the shop and pay $10 corkage fee.

C6-OtYPy2p1OKkMJ8TqKjw.text: Sadly we have not been here in a long time. The last couple times we went it was not a pleasant experience and the menu has changed quite a bit. It's almost like they got lazy about the little things that mattered. For the chicken and waffles for example, it used to come with butter that had been marinated in orange peels that really added to the taste of the waffles. They no longer do that. Today I called to order a take out order and I was going to order one of their sandwiches only to be told that was no longer on the menu. They replaced their roasted chicken breast sandwich for fried chicken. You'd think they'd take the time to update their online menu if they were going to go and change it. It's a shame this place has gone down hill because at some point we used to look forward to our Sunday brunch here every Sunday.

BxSB5yOl6v4WH9SGhKAs4A.text: I've been a regular customer here since 10/2004, but I will NEVER return.  And guess what, I think the owners ... do not care.   Made an open table reservation for a 50th birthday, "please give us a special table, it's a 50th birthday celebration."  Waiter (Marty - also the "manager" - huh?) acknowledged the occasion while dropping bread and water, but became freakishly argumentative over a simple request/question about the wine before the food order was even taken. We had been there literally 10 minutes.  Really?  The guy then grabbed the menus off the table after saying that I "clearly wasn't listening" to his explanation, which I've heard before here, that all their wines are 'fresh'  - no matter how long the bottles have been open - due to their cutting-edge corking system, and stalked away.  We got up and asked for the manager, only to learn that Marty IS the manager!   - - What?!!    Left a detailed message and number for the owner - no response.  However, Marty later called and apologized.  "I'm not sure why I was so rude."  Yeah, Marty, I'm not sure either, but thanks for the memory. If this guy is a manager he needs to be terminated.  The only reason I ever came here was for the lake view, ducks, and great windows -  never the food or service, which has always been "ehhh."   But talking like this to customers over a polite request over wine? Totally outrageous.

2ir4uHvFbPjP6c73B1sZaA.text: Acclaimed French chefs like Joel Robuchon, Pierre Gagnaire, and Guy Savoy have restaurants in Las Vegas. Definitely one of the reason this city is known as a culinary destination. Most come with a very hefty price tag, but Marche Bacchus is the exception. You can make it hefty, but why?  The menu offers very recognizable French dishes, and delicious interpretations. Service is phenomenal.  We were seated lakeside next to a very cozy fireplace. Cheese plate (often varies based on availability),  French onion soup mixed with caramelized onions, Gruyere and croutons, and the Scottish Salmon. Everything was executed to perfection, along with the wine parings.   Try and leave room for desert. I didn't.  Bon appetit!

AWjqF58EyASooxFt32z-cA.text: This place has gotten considerably worse in recent years. I keep giving this place chance after chance. The Mother's Day dinner was the last.   Don't bother making a reservation. They will tell you "no problem" when you call and ask for a table outside by the lake. When you show up 15 minutes before your reservation, they will tell you sorry, the outside is full... you'll have to wait at least 30 minutes. I was appalled. I am not sure how many people come here for the food. Most people who come here look for that experience having a relaxed meal by the lake. This was unacceptable. I was speechless when I overheard other groups complaining about the same problem. If you don't have a spot, then just be honest. This Truely felt like a bait-and-switch. Not a fan.   The food was good. The bread you get at the start is great. Fluffy on the inside, crunchy on the outside. Yellowtail Crudo was a great way to go after the bread. I got lamb chop. It was good but nothing special. I got medium rare. The meat itself is a bit mushy. Nothing really was sepcial about the food, but maybe I just wasn't in the mood.   The service was good for a busy mother's day. We waited for 50 minutes for our main courses but I expected it.   The truth is, no matter how great everything was, I have no tolerance for dishonesty. This will be the last time for me.

Wy36bE54n9R5uCTl_EvGWg.text: I wish I had something newly discovered to share with you with this local gem...but Marche Bacchus has been a local's favorite for French and Mediterranean cuisine for many many years.  When you walk in, you will see cases and cases of wine presented orderly on shelves that beg you to wander...beautifully organized, and generally rated to help guide your decision. If you find something pleasing to have with your dinner, they will open it for you without a corkage fee...or bag it for you on the way out if you wish. I cannot claim to be a wine expert, but I do regularly enjoy wine with my meal, and the selection at Marche Bacchus is quite exquisite. There are a few seats inside but, most patrons opt to watch the swans and ducks go by on Lake Jacqueline as they sit on the patio. Outside, there are multiple tiers, with ample fire places or heaters if the weather is cold. Not all the tables have a fireplace though, so make a reservations or ask nicely. When the weather is beautiful, some of the seats open directly to the lake for added ambiance.  I've been dining here for over 3 years now. Marche Bacchus participates in Restaurant Week, so be sure to check it out. Our most recent visit took place as a celebration for our family. The evening was ideal...but if you have teenagers, especially girls, you know how long it can take them to get out of the house...so we were late to our reservation. Fortunately, they called to confirm as we were on our way...I love that they checked before making any assumption. They were kind and patient with our orders and service...by the end of our main course, it was getting close to their closing time, but the service was great, and we didn't feel rushed at all.  We ordered -Heirloom Tomato Panzanella Salad -Seared Scallops  -Halibut special of the day -Bistro Chicken -Roasted Scottish Salmon  They will bring a basket of warm bread with some amazing butter...whipped French butter that is! All of our orders came out together and were cooked perfectly. They were delicious! They have a vegan menu if you prefer...as well as Live Music some evenings.      The competition got hotter when Americana opened a couple doors down, but they are both great choices for a night out IMHO.  -2018 review #7-

IziPwxVOUg1MmUych0aQfg.text: A nice place for dinner.   The team at Marche Bacchus was gracious and courteous.   The meal I ordered for dinner  was the halibut which was perfect! I also recommend the limoncello for dessert.    The atmosphere- a violinist played popular songs that are trending now which was a huge plus to me.   The view- was of the lake and added a touch of serenity and calmness.   Recommendation- that perhaps some misters are installed for outside seating during the hot summer  months.   Overall good time there -would definitely go back when the weather is much cooler.

UEESIPCyeyWfMCT6vFjKbg.text: Last visited before moving to Las Vegas, a lunch from David Middleton alongside Lake Jacqueline limited but performing well enough that five years between Meals was undoubtedly too long, it was as a party of two that dinner was enjoyed at Marche' Bacchus last Friday, Chef Amanda Hamilton now top toque and showing good skills across five courses.  Still tucked away north of Summerlin Parkway, the seclusion and scenery "un-Vegas" in all the right ways, those returning to Marche' Bacchus will likely notice a difference in the Restaurant's facade thanks to an incident involving a runaway truck last February, owners Rhonda and Jeff Wyatt using the "opportunity" to expand the Restaurant's Bar program which now adds top-shelf Liquor and Cocktails to the well-regarded Wine shop.  Popular amongst oenophiles and well-heeled locals, the serenity of Ducks paddling by on the water enhanced by live music from a lone man and his guitar, it was after brief perusal of the menu that a shared tasting was requested, service from a professional young man outperforming many Strip Restaurants even as an aged quartet loudly proclaiming their love for "Foy Grasss" occupied much of his time throughout the evening.  Seated in an elevated corner with some privacy, October's cooler temperatures perfect for dinner outdoors, it was with greetings from General Manager Angelo Reyes that Champagne started the evening, a warm basket of Bread buying time until the arrival of lightly charred Octopus that was a bit over-tenderized but otherwise enjoyable amongst Chickpeas, Tomatoes, Peppers and Olives.  Next offered a glass of Sauternes, the label not disclosed but sweetness and viscosity indicating it to be fairly young, it was in a classic pairing that Chef Hamilton presented seared Foie Gras atop Toast, a price comparable to the major Casinos justified by both portion and its presentation with Huckleberries and cracked Nuts.  Transitioning to White, a crisp Burgundy nicely matched to housemade Pasta that unfortunately sees Lobster get a little lost amidst fragrant Mushrooms and Citrus, it was by request that Duck was served next, the pan-seared skin and rosy flesh thankfully allowed to express their natural flavors which went well bite-for-bite with a complex Farro Salad and sips from Cotes du Rhone.  Opting for Cocktails over Port to finish, a mixologist behind the illuminated Abalone Shell Bar producing one fresh Martini and a truly indulgent Brandy Alexander, suffice it to say that saving room for Dessert at Marche' Bacchus is highly recommended as both the new Limoncello Souffle and Cheesecake are light and delicious, though not quite as noteworthy as Toffee-soaked Bread Pudding studded with Raisins.  FOUR STARS:  Matching scenery and service with a menu offering something for everyone Marche' Bacchus remains a worthy off-Strip destination nearly two decades since opening, and although not quite as refined as Bardot or classic as Andres the Wyatt's have something no other Restaurant in town can match in terms of their Wine prices while the new Bar and Happy Hour menu offer even more reasons to visit.

H2iKDbKTKtARKqAxSx2DHw.text: Wow this is a place everyone in Vegas should try! The food is amazing the staff is friendly and outside patio is beautiful. Don't forget to Make a reservation.

ajPWwZWZl9hu253hVuBt6w.text: I only gave this place 4 instead of 5 because, in my opinion the food took extra long to come out, but that's pretty much my only complaint. Now onto the good stuff, the food!! Amazing. That's all I can say. I got the rack of lamb and it was cooked to perfection. It was tender and cut like butter. And for dessert, I got the tiramisu which wasn't overly sweet like a lot of places. It was really good. Overall the ambiance and the location I would highly recommend this place for a date. It's right by the lake and the prices were pretty reasonable too. Over all I'd come back again and probably again.

9If-47im7F5zkCmj2oGTNA.text: Top bread pudding dessert in town!! Been here in two New Years Eve occasions. Wonderful location for a sit down romantic dinner. Vegan options are a super plus and get an extra star for that!!

rw9In58jGcQb3hxrxTmoDw.text: My favorite desert oasis. I LOVE eating on a patio, throw in a view of water and I'm a sucker for this place. Two visits for two special occasions. My birthday and then we got engaged here. The food and service is always perfect.

c67PAEYqRu8xRp21eufxqQ.text: This was the first time here. You walk in the front doors to find yourself in a very cool wine shop. We were there for a private wine tasting and had some excellent wines and food of a diverse, however pricey menu. It was getting late, so we decided to order a couple of appetizers, eggplant, and the escargot, both very well prepared. The True highlight of this establishment is that's on the water in Desert Shores. You couldn't have a better backdrop. I understand brunch is wonderful. We will certainly come back for the experience

VELwDl5806svj2eDHBiG7A.text: The only thing good about this place was our waitress and the view. The food was bland. I like my pasta al dente..but c'mon! It was beyond hard. I had a brushing of sauce on the bottom, nothing to carry through the dish. The lobster was over cooked. As a culinary student I was shocked that a french restaurant didnt have an amazing pastry chef and that their dessert lists were so simplistic (sorbet). We wont be back. Yuck. Wanted our anniversary here.

51C5HGxWVWE30zbBj5IwAg.text: Always love coming here for dinner with the family.  The salmon was pretty good but the pork chop I had during a previous visit is probably my favorite. The wife had steak frites and loved them. What really keeps us coming back, though, is the charcuterie plate, the excellent service (ask for Marty), and the great wine selection. We always bring a few bottles home with us for in between visits. Be sure to check this place out!

c1LEVvXsUjZEBeeHh-1B9A.text: Great food, great location. The only reason I did not give this place 5 stars: I made my reservation a week and a half in advance, so when we were placed at a table that was not water side - I was a little disappointed. If you are booking a table for the patio, be sure to mention you would like water side seating. They also charge you a $10 corkage fee for their own wine which seems a little ridiculous. Also, the outdoor misters are a little much and I ended up getting semi-damp from them.   Apart from these tiny complaints, everything else was great and I will be back for sure. Very romantic setting.

L98OdzPIeBw_E8b1y3pS0w.text: So I came here with my now husband for our anniversary about a year ago. This is where he proposed to me! (Well by the lake lol) He called ahead and asked them to seat us away from people, which they did not! We talked to the host about the seating issue and they were kind enough to seat us at the top bar like seats! It was dark so they brought candles which made it really romantic! We started off with a caesars salad, then they accidentally made an extra one so they gave us one on the house. I ordered the king salmon which was full of flavor and really good! My hubby got the lobster pasta which was also really delicious !   Overall the service was good, food was great! I don't like wine, but their wine selection is huge!!!!

ibMxocoON7uiwYnkjeUrhg.text: Arrived at 2:30 on Friday February 12 for a late lunch.  Must have been a crew changed time, we at started with a female waiter and after 30 minutes waiting to order our new make waiter arrived "Marty " took our order and we still waited another 35 minutes to get served.  Food was "ok" but not worth the hassle.  Absence of any atmosphere and they need clean the place up. Not impressed!

6AiA2JMphAjHie6ivjISwg.text: If/When I make it back to the magical Summerlin suburb, we will definitely be back to this little gem!  First of all, if you can find it through the maze of neighborhoods and suburb distractions, the Marche Bacchus is nestled in some corporate retail plaza and boasts the most amazing patio....EVER!  This patio is completely all weather....and on this particular night, it was a little chilly, but you never would have known it.  We were seated by the fire, and almost roasting in our seats. But they were happy to turn it down for us when we asked.  Which brings me to the service:                                                            AWESOME!  Joe was super nice and to the Beau's surprise, a beer connoisseur.  I swear, I saw his face light up when the Beau asked him what beers they had available.  Joe recommended an amazing beer that he just loved, and now we have to find here in MPLS.  But otherwise, he was excellent, attentive and talkative.  The only downside, I would say, would be that when I ordered a couple of reserve wines, he didn't ask me what size.  I thought one was the glass, and the other was the bottle, so I was thinking that what I ordered was the glass size.  What I got was the most expensive glass of wine....ever.  That kind of stunk, but they were super good wines.  The Beau ordered Steak Frites and I had the Warm Spinach Salad appetizer with the Sea Scallop appetizer for dinner.  I have no idea how to make Chorizo vinaigrette, but I was blown away by this salad.  And the scallops were amazing.  The beau loved his dinner too and  I was lucky he was willing to share.  Their fries were delicious and the steak was perfectly done.    Their wine store is awesome, although we didn't really look at much.  I hear you can purchase your wine and drink it with dinner - which is completely awesome.  And according to Joe, you can catch the owner on an episode of Pawn Stars!  He was the expert brought in to identify an original bottle of Dom Champagne.    This is definitely a place I would recommend to anyone who wants something completely off the strip, quiet, casual, but also sophisticated and intimate.  The Beau and I had an amazing time and agreed, this was the highlight of our trip.  Great atmosphere combined with great food and EXCELLENT service, this was definitely our favorite.  Thanks to all the local Las Vegas Yelpers that clued us in.  Oh....and it is True about the bread pudding. It is a MUST when you go.

UZIYSsyLApPTjQ1Sg_v3_w.text: This was our first visit and will definitely not be our last! We chose Marche Bacchus because we love French cuisine, read the reviews and snagged a 1000 point Table on OpenTable! We arrived and started exploring the wine shop. To our utter delight, we found one of our favorite Sparkling Whites (Saint-Hilaire) and ordered a bottle to have with our dessert course. Our table was perfect - outside right on the edge of the lake! Our server, Nicole, was wonderfully attentive and helpful. We started with the Escargot - delicious and garlicky! The bread was warm, crusty and served with real whipped butter. We decided to split the Summer Salad with rhubarb dressing - I loved it. Hubby thought the dressing was too sweet. I ordered the Veal Braciole and Hubby got the Red Wine Braised Beef - both delicious! I ordered a glass of Chateauneuf-du-Pape and Hubby got a Barolo - NICE!! We had a hard time deciding on entrees because there were so many things we wanted to try. For dessert, I had the Fromage (5 different selections with caramelized onions and peppers, grapes and candied walnuts - YUM!) and Hubby got the Warm Chocolate Lava Cake with Chocolate Gelato instead of Vanilla Ice Cream. The cake was not as warm as he expected but was delicious none-the-less. We loved the entire experience and will be back very soon!!

NH6xwFVas5TAEhbk2on5pA.text: I really want to give them 5 stars, but our food didn't come out for an hour!!  Plenty of beautiful patio seating on the lake, with cool misters and swanky lounge music.   Very comfortable, even in the desert heat.  Twinkly lights and a garden trellises woven throughout the patio make for a romantic, lush setting.    Menu is fairly common French fare, scallops and risotto in lobster sauce was creamy and delicious.  Bonus: real French waiter!   Beware the wine-by-the-glass conversion to bottle price which somehow didn't add up right.  You're better off buying out of the wine shop.  Our waiter comped us dessert for our long wait for dinner....Some chocolate decadence and their signature bread pudding... both delicious.    $200 for a bottle of wine and dinner for 2.  2.5 hours of blissful ambiance that felt like we were 1000 miles from Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ybgKpIBLL-u9LwZmdXUZNA.text: Just moved into the neighborhood. Fantastic food. Looking forward to exploring the extensive wine shop. The Beet, Heirloom tomato salad is nice. The Muscles are delicious and the flat Iron Steak is tasty.

2aZ3dauu0w8rFCFoDz-QwA.text: This review is for 02/11/2012.  I don't see what all the fuss is about. The lake side view is charming but that's about all. Maybe this place is better for sipping wine and eating salads? Meh, I've experienced better is exactly how I rate this establishment.   I've recently spent a lot of time in France and have some problems identifying any similarities with the restaurant and quality French cuisine. It's almost criminal how much this place costs for subpar food.   I felt the mussels I ordered were dry and slightly over cooked. The sauce was bland and only in the bottom of the tiniest bowl ever to fit the portion. You want good mussels stateside? Try the ones in a champs vegetable cream sauce @ Rue de Jean, in Charleston, S.C.  I thought the escargot which I was dying to eat again, was the worst offender here! Completely under seasoned. It was so unlike what I ate in France. Consumed in too much parsley and a bland clumpy butter sauce that got cold and re solidified. Yuck. These two dishes are simple, yet elegant in flavor. What happened?   The main courses were average at best but not fabulous. Especially for the price.  The service was a little slow but friendly.   On a brighter note!  I did think the best part of the evening was rummaging through the wine selections in the store front of the restaurant. I recommend arriving early to your reservation to have time to pick out a fantastic wine to accompany your meal. A nice le vin rouge can really make it fabulous. If you can't finish it just get it corked to take home.

eZj4o55tqAGr4REFUq_sYQ.text: I really wanted to like this place. I had been there before to check out the wine list. The location is awesome. Love the cute lake and all the geese and rabbits running around. The service was not good at all and not even close to what you would expect from such a place. The server was bland, seemed flustered, no personality...forgot our wine (it is a wine shop/restaurant) and did not bring for 5-7 mins after first course was dropped. Food quality was so so. Extremely overpriced for what you receive. Very disappointed...sadly would not return.

Xoa99J9Dg4GhGrJic51DRg.text: Worst $100 lunch i ever spent. I was excited to try this place, my husband is french and a chef, so we had high hopes. First off the wine they served us was off, seems like it had been opened for a month. Next our server was horrible. He made us feel like he didn't want to serve us, and he was not that smart. He forgot to give us things we asked for. We ordered 3 course, when the food came, it was very mediocre.  Country pate that was old, tart that was falling apart, and my scallops did not have a starch, and done in 2 bites.  Now i am willing to pay money for good food, but this was ridiculous. We will never go back. Save your money, no view of a man made lake is that worth it.

yHVqt5SmrUWCyY6DnOLrvQ.text: Love love love the ambiance.  The hostesses are less than friendly and they act like they are doing you a favor to seat you.  Even when you arrive with a reservation.  The food is always high quality and very good.  We went twice this week.  Once for Sunday Brunch and once for dinner with my family in town from Austria.  Both times we ordered the charcuterie plate which is incredible.  Great selection of meat and awesome cheese.  The dinner prices are a bit high but quality good tasting food.  Only major complaint is that they do not have a "house wine".  Be careful if you ask for it or ask for the to bring you something like a house wine.  Your gonna pay for it!!!  The restaurant sits on a man made lake.  We saw swans floating by both times.  There are small turtles that sit on the rocks right outside of where you sit.  I would like it if they could clean the spiderwebs that are all over the glass window enclosure.  We noticed it on both visits.  Oh, they have a mist system so when you sit outside on a warm Las Vegas evening it is quite comfortable.  Overall I would recommend this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffles gritz with beef medallions
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles!!

IhAyHn7HxfWh5Ii7vRnT-Q.text: I've been coming here since 2005 and have had a great experience every single time. I love the fact that they have a great wine store and you can buy the wine and drink it for a small fee. That certainly beats paying double or triple which is what most restaurants do.the View is awesome especially close to sunset. I certainly have my favorites on the menu as i have dined here dozens of times but always seem to order the escargot and mussels. the cheese plate is awesome as well. I usually always try something different for the main course and sometimes just keeping ordering more mussels as the main as they are that good. We also used them for catering our holiday party which everyone enjoyed! Keep up the great work

2Ds-5AiU5vFoAZdKmM8ZwA.text: this place is great , the ambience , the food , the service is usually pretty good . I love this place , one of the best fish and chips I ever have had but it was just a chef special one day and I have never seen it back on the menu (sad face) . I love the burger , the soups , the wine , I have had some great dinners here as well , the steak was fabulous . Its a great date place day or night !!!!

jLnX3k6TKSD-gT_TWr0M7g.text: Amazing beautiful scenery! You don't feel like you're in Vegas! I know it's a French wine restaurant, I just feel like portions are small and not enough variety.... Turkey sandwich is really good!! Staff is nice.... Wish I could afford to try the wines!!!! Maybe next date night.... But, will have to wait for it to cool down... Sitting outside is a must!

YDrNn4HKnI1rrDhSVSSOOw.text: Marche Bacchus   Non-Descriptly tucked away in a Desert Shores Shopping Center, this place is another great hangout that provides an upscale dining experience in a locals backyard. They only have a wine license so don't expect a Goose and Tonic with your excellent pasta, luckily they have a fully selections of wines nearby for you to enjoy.  The service is excellent, the food is VERY GOOD, and its always  been a positive experience. I have been here 3 times. It's a little expensive but not nearly as bad as you would experience on the strip for the same food. I would recommend to a friend.

9iNci7I3k5acSypuZdS5yA.text: I love your menu at this restaurant. I have eaten there several times. As a matter of fact, I met my love/boyfriend at your restaurant. The location is romantic and tranquil. The view is scenic and you almost think your out of the country.  On Father's Day I tried your escargot and I was in WOW ! I grew up eating escargot from my Sicilian immigrant parents that made their own from gathering the snails from our garden after a good raining day and feeding them cream of wheat and water for 30 days to clean them out from the inside out and plump them up before cooking them many different ways. But, I must say their recipe is divine!  Save the bread for dipping in the sauce of the escargot.

kmltJU4rOm0srwleYH2DUA.text: Atmosphere is very relaxing and serene. Good food and good service... A nice little oasis in the desert.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table... So amazing.
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Onion Soup &amp; Half Sandwich

JfKXVe4rYWgfykiMUBVYnA.text: Excellent place. Nice ambiance once you enter the restaurant. Nice outdoor setting by the lake. Food was terrific. Great selection. Best part from my perspective was the wine selection. Very comprehensive and priced closer to market price rather than outrageous restaurant prices. Allowed us to enjoy our fabulous food with a better than usual wine! I recommend this restaurant highly.

jGROFNXZ7sPQ49GV21fKwg.text: This is truly a shining star in Las Vegas.  Off the beaten path, this restaurant will offer its diners a superb culinary experience.  The wine choices are extensive and ridiculously reasonable, even the high end wines.  The menu offers traditional, as well as, modern conceptions with French-flair; all of which are brilliantly executed.   There is limited seating, both inside and out, so be sure to make a reservation through yelp.  We will definitely be back to dine again.

CgeoazjpOzFGn0gDMIqqKA.text: A beautiful Lake view place to visit. I came beer in a Sunday morning. I did not expect to sit outside but the moist and fan make it surprisely not hot at all.  We ordered the French toast and chicken waffle. The chicken was really tender and tasty. The waffle and French toast did not give us too much surprise. The service was attentive and nice. I believe it will be very nice to come back visit during the spring or fall.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken waffle and French toast.

TQnYL6cjCtN4YO4q1KlEDw.text: Extremely overpriced for average  French cuisine.  Food is OK. Service is typically French, especially from our New Jersey waiter. View is amazing,  right on the lake. French onion soup was delicious.

F5j9oMFdwX4-1mqbR8T2_Q.text: Looking for a quiet lunch 15 minutes away from the strip? I highly recommend Marche Bacchus. Delicious food, decent portions, great service, soothing lake views.

fDt4LC7KVuMDqrDlO_-Qhw.text: As a person in the younger community, coming across good service is rare. It's noticeable that adults tend to treat adults better, which makes sense. Although the service in this place was incredible. They were very professional, especially to my boyfriend and I, who celebrated our one year anniversary here. Everything about this restaurant was beautiful. We came around dinner time and my boyfriend loved his meal. I believe this restaurant does have a different menu, depending on the time of day. I ordered the scallops and they were absolutely wonderful. The scenery in this area was beautiful as well. I recommend going when the sun is almost setting or a little bit before so you have time to enjoy the outdoors. I also posted this place on my social media, which encouraged my friends to try it and they all loved it! I would definitely recommend this place because it's something different than the strip and the food is great!

ntfe4T4Uz4_7sEJ20Oi1pw.text: This place is tucked away in a small community surrounded by a man made lake and a few nice ducks and swans.   They have a wine tasting on Saturdays around noon, and before you enter there is a store. You can be seated inside slightly behind the 'store' or outside to enjoy the view. It's quite larger than I expected. Ideal for family/friends/celebration events.   They have a wonderful menu and good deserts. They have fresh baked bread with butter that I really enjoyed while I waited for my food. I did feel they were slow. Soup and salad should not take too long to be brought out. I ordered the honey glazed duck, which was so good with Riesling.   The tiramisu was so yummy too I should have ordered tea but with this heat it wasn't on my mind.  Overall experience for the first time I would come again, maybe after it cools down to enjoy outside again. I didn't really care much for the decor on the outside patio, it ain't no vitnergrill that's for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The tiramisu delicious
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The honey glazed duck, also very good
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Chilean sea bass, very good.

FyakKSAJqDg2OPu49bRFig.text: Set at the bar hoping to get a drink while waiting for my husband. After waiting for about 10 minutes I gave up and left. In the past we've enjoyed this place but I hate being ignored.

_EDqySGSUdjZ646liskx4w.text: This review is mainly for the Happy Hour which was recently introduced. To improve the winter dining comfort on the patio, several fireplaces have been added to augment the vertical floor heaters. Our server Matt was friendly and provided excellent service.  The Happy Hour menu consists of a small number of appetizer size plates all at the same price. The wine selection was varied and all are half price by the glass.  On this evening we chose two items from the Happy Hour menu, the Escargot and Beef Ravioli. Also ordered was the Braised Beef entree from the dinner menu.  The Escargot were plump and served piping hot in an excellent butter, garlic, herb sauce. Don't forget to use the crusty bread to soak up the extra sauce.  The Beef Ravioli contained extremely tender meat. The ravioli's were perfectly cooked and swimming in a tasty sauce along with caramelized onions.  The Red Wine Braised Beef is served with White Truffle Grits and Roasted Cipollini Onions. Mashed potatoes were requested in place of the grits. The beef was cooked for four hours and was fork tender. The rich wine sauce was perfect with the creamy mashed potatoes.  The desert menu was irresistible. Both the Creme Brulee and Tiramisu were superb.  We have now added Marche Bacchus to our year round dining list.

uQETDs5v_zLaEzNyZCcQHw.text: We drove here from the Four Seasons for Thanksgiving dinner.  Room service would have been a better idea.  Marche Bacchus cavernous space includes a retail wine store, a couple of interior rooms, and an enclosed patio overlooking a small lake, The set turkey dinner was $45.00 for salad, turkey, sides, and dessert.  This wouldn't be a bad deal if anything tasted good.  Nothing did.  According to my companions, the salads were tasteless, the turkey dry, and the desserts in eatable.  I ordered off the a la carte menu with a bit more fortune.  While my goat cheese tarte was cloyingly sweet with a honey dripping, my braised beef tenderloin bits were rather tasty.  The pecan pie was a tasteless tarte, rather than any piece of pie.  Marche Bacchus serves only wine and beer, and must be the only restaurant in Las Vegas that doesn't serve liquor.  There wine list is decent, but I so wanted a cocktail.   Service was quite good, and I felt bad knowing he realized we weren't enjoying our meal.  The 30 minute drive from the Four Seasons was such a wasted trip.  Marche Bacchus did not provide a memorable Thanksgiving.   .

VGsG94VkZ8vDkscKkJ6I-g.text: Through the entrance doors, you will find yourself walking into a collection of wine in boxed crates arranged in perfectly lined aisles.  At first I thought I walked into the wrong establishment, but was quickly greeted by the hostess who got me up to speed with my reservation.  I was meeting some friends for brunch and this was a nice setting for our first book club meeting.  I love the ambiance.  It felt like I wasn't even in Vegas.  The restaurant is situated right on a lake(man made I'm sure) but it is an exquisite view!    To my disappointment, the food I selected today wasn't that great.  I ordered the Crab Benedict.  Honestly, I've had better.  It was just simply bland, no flavors to spruce up the dish.  Mediocre to say the least.  My friend also ordered the escargot...sadly that didn't hit the spot either.    Overall, this place is fantastic if you're looking for ambiance and bottomless mimosas.  Other than that, thought the food was ok.  That's too bad.  This place had potential to be something really special.  Oh well...on to the next brunch spot.

XdIbRG6VrK2B4kEyy1fPlg.text: Wonderful place, service, food and a huge variety of wines! What more could anyone ask for!

wOnBN7Y17LrbbZnct3Wz4A.text: One of our family members  had been to this restaurant, so she picked this place again to meet up, we were very glad to be there because this restaurant delivered the best tasting food....lamb chops, pork chop, steak, salad and desserts... It is by a man-made lake in the Summerlin neighborhood, quite a drive from the strip but all worth it to enjoy the food with family.  They have great wine selections in the front  of the restaurant.  There were only 2 servers that evening, we did not mind that we have to wait longer than expected because we were catching up with family who we have not seen for a while.

Z3hS-_M0PRDNV_pQrSIdyA.text: Amazing food,  The ravioli was really good  The fillet was the right temperature,  size, overall amazing place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fAHiFn8QpQK4CMdmbmYzlA.text: I went today for the very first time. Loved it!  You walk in and see a wine store that has some stools on a bar. I thought that was it, but no. Outside, lakeside -- yes, lakeside in the desert -- they have amazing outdoor seating. The ambience is excellent.   The food --the menu-- innovative and fabulous.   Since it was a lunch meeting, I had a Scottish Salmon Salad. Perfect!  Taste wonderful. Great ingredients.  Service was friendly and very good!  I will go back with my family. Excellent experience.   It's 32 miles from my home, but this IS worth the drive. Highly recommended.

h-ctSTNfJaljvL8c1x-8Dw.text: Total fail. I've been here in the past and loved the food and atmosphere. My kids booked it for my birthday party. The restaurant called and offered us a $99 per person menu. We opted for regular dining. When we arrived workers were sawing in a big dusty mess outside the front entrance. The hostess was totally confused about our reservation and where to seat us. There was black plastic hanging all over and boxes of construction junk piled to the ceiling in the entrance. They tried to seat us outside and it's still 103. They had misters and fans. No way. I was feeling very uncomfortable about having my family to this disaster. We told the waitress we were uncomfortable and they should have closed for remodeling. She agreed. We ordered a drink which took forever. The portable bar was in a little hole behind black plastic. The windows are filthy and the plastic view for the lake is all broken out. The floor is old nasty carpet in the dining area, nasty dirty tile in the wine store area. The whole place is disgusting. There was drilling, hammering and sawing going on. Dust everywhere. I think the waitress told the manager we weren't happy, he tried to move us outside. He was very nice. But, there is no excuse to try to pull this mess on guests. At this point we decided we were not staying and putting up with this for the prices they charge, especially. I had ordered one cocktail, my husband a Diet Coke that tasted like some kind of stored rainwater. After all this they actually charged us for the 2 drinks and no apology for the birthday dinner fiasco. I've never been so embarrassed. I wish they had mentioned all this on the phone. I have no idea how this  place is still in business. I hope the food is good. I'll never find out.

6FHnz9HT2begURW21hWtKA.text: BEAUTIFUL venue for brunch or lunch! Food is DELICIOUS so you can come anytime and be happy! If you come during the day, ask to be seated outside facing the lake. Really cool view and food is fantastic. They also have a wine shop so great for wine drinkers :)  For Appetizers: French Onion Soup, Charcuterie Platter w/ Wine. For Entrees: Steak Frites or Ribeye entrees. For Dessert: I like their pistachio gelato. Light and great.

xTGCt36u_6JhEUxcq6AlFA.text: I took my granddaughter there for her 19th birthday. I have been there a few times and the service is getting worse and worse. We walked in and were seated, it was approximately noon. There were maybe 5 tables filled. We waiting 15 minutes for anyone to come to our table. Then 15 more to get water. I ordered wine, took at least 10 minutes to get it- then..... bread 10 more minutes. Our food was delicious. There are many great restaurants in Las Vegas where you are taken care of. The waitress acted like she was doing us a favor. No tip for her, a tip for you... go somewhere else.

XWZlMH-ugAg_qPwnhmftOg.text: Lovely wine with a great menu. Excellent service. Beautiful views of the man-made lake. What a great place to enjoy wonderful glass of wine

h-GUrucUN5ESsMKDFCJKEg.text: The setting was ideal, the bread was delicious, and though the drinks are over-priced, you know that going in. What was unacceptable was the entree, $20 cacciatore was the worst dish I've had in decades, like reheated scraps from a school's cafeteria.

pUW0EdRGdAjKbp7vzo4-7g.text: I wish I could have rated this place 4-5 stars. However, after eating lunch there with my family, we experienced stomachaches, nausea and diarrhea from the lobster bisque we all had during lunch. It was very unfortunate. The view of the man made lake is beautiful. I hope the kitchen staff are keeping up to date with hand hygiene and food safety.

MeR0wap-MO_hkGK6qnoDIA.text: went for lunch, escargot is AMAZING!  nice wine selection, great service, even better view!

T-O6A6IyQUZTyzTdZMIyAA.text: Very romantic atmosphere, both dinner and lunch!  I've gone here for dinner and it was so beautiful at night. Equally as beautiful during the day. We actually got the same cozy table, months apart, for lunch and dinner.   Lunch special: $23.95 for an appetizer or dessert, entree, and a glass of wine or beer or champagne. We chose the escargot for app, lobster salad croissant and eggplant terrine for entrees, and bread pudding for dessert.   The escargot is so delicious and has so much yummy melted garlic herb butter that we kept the plate and dipped our bread. Lobster salad was really good and not too mayonnaise-y (I hate that) and the eggplant terrine was tasty but a little mushy.   Bread pudding was ok, not great so next time we will try the tiramisu.   Can't beat that lunch special!  I want to go back soon.

cnGMNOUa3fH9Afgr64_LJQ.text: We had a party 5 last night with the great seating that makes this a very pleasant spot to dine.  I love being able to carry on a conversation and not have to us a phone light to see the menu.   The server was very good.  She was polite and made sure to keep our glasses ready with each bottle. I had the steak and frites.  I ordered MR but it was just a bit passed.  The dish overall was very good.  Everyone else enjoyed their food as well.

qQhKckgNFTOcHHeitF_wxQ.text: Place has gone downhill. The old chef left and the new chef is terrible. The service is absolutely horrible. We ordered the bucchus platter and the waitress said you want the buck-kus platter? You work here and you can't even pronounce the name of the place? It's "bu-koo"... inexperienced staff and the food was just awful. The pork belly was just drenched in some red wine reduction, it looked like a mass suicide with blood all over it. Not an appealing dish, deft not French cuisine. The cheese plate we asked for prosciutto and she said they stopped carrying it. You want to charge $26 for a meat and cheese plate then you should probably provide some prosciutto. Everything on the plate looked like dog food. We have had enough with this place. I can see why the reviews are horrible.  Updated review: Came here last night with my GF. First off why are they remolding while the restaurant is open? That is super unprofessional. People come here for a romantic evening and the first thing they see when they come in is 10 construction workers and 15 screw guns on the floor, do it while the restaurant is closed or just close for renovations for 2 weeks. The horrible part was the food was absolutely amazing, I had the new Pork Chop dish. Unfortunately I got food poisoning and I was in the bathroom an hr after we left and still am for the next 10 hrs. Thank you very much, I will probably not be coming back but  I absolutely love this place. Me and my GF go here and we love to drink wine. It's so cool when you walk in you walk around and pick your bottle and they bring it to your table. We had a cheese plate that was wonderful and then we had some beef this that fell apart in my mouth that's how tender is was. Deft a really good place to go on a date.

flG4lQldOZqltQxs6FfDng.text: I ended up coming to Marche Bacchus on Father's day for dinner with my boyfriend's parents.  Marche Bacchus is located at the lakes in Summerlin. The restaurant is located in a plaza with spacious parking. We ended up going inside and was greeted by the hostess, whom was really friendly!  Our seating was table seating outside of the restaurant. The ambiance of this restaurant is really relaxing, sitting outside. It was nice to overlook the lake and ducks.  We had received a bottle of red wine and placed appetizers. We ended up ordering [1] French Onion Soup, [1] Pork Belly, and [1] Caesar Salad. All of the appetizers came out rapidly.   The French Onion Soup was okay. The cheese was a little overpowering in the soup. The Pork Belly which was crusted with a red wine. It was quite good. The Pork Belly was hard on the outside and soft in the inside. I would order the appetizer again.  For our entree we had ordered the following  [1] Filet Mignon [medium]  [1] Steak Frites [medium -- well-done] [1] Salmon [1] Mac n Cheese [1] Frisee Salad  I was extremely disappointed in the entrees. It took about 45 minutes for the entrees to arrive at the table. The food quality was relatively poor.  My Steak Frites that I had asked for medium/well-done was very under-cooked. It was red through-out the entire steak. I couldn't eat it. I never ask for cook to be re-heated, so I ended up just boxing it up to bring back home. My boyfriend's father's salmon was too fishy to eat.  My boyfriend thought the Mac n cheese was dry, but the Frisee salad was good. The Filet Mignon was cooked well and was flavorful. My daughter enjoyed the Filet Mignon.  I wouldn't recommend coming to this restaurant though. There are plenty of other restaurants that offer better quality food at a much cheaper price. The only recommendation that I would make is if you do come here, if you can get table seating outside, you can really enjoy the lake view. It is quite beautiful!

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pIHPwe0o_gSl5a4HWeWgmw.text: This place is great! The views outside on the lake are stunning and it's so peaceful. They have a fireplace outside which wasn't lit when we were there but I'm sure it's nice on cold evenings. Beware of the mosquitoes though, wear your big spray! They came out after sunset and we were killing them left and right.   We arrived early and decided to get a drink at the bar. They obviously have an awesome wine list as they sell bottles of wine also.   The food was delicious. I would really like to try other items on the list. The service was also immaculate. We were with a large group and were able to get some small bites prior to dinner. I loved them all, so tasty. For desert I got the s'mores mousse and my husband got the bread pudding. As much as I thought mine was delicious, I about died and went to heaven when I tried the bread pudding. I ate all mine plus almost half of that!   Excellent dining experience, highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moscato
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread Pudding

BWi1kk1lT1iXmBBnsdXHCw.text: Day after Mother's Day we came here for brunch on a Monday 1 pm . Walked in the place is full of wine choices ! The waitress was nice place had some music in the background and that view of the man made lake was gorgeous!::.ordered the lobster salad roll special came with glass Chardonnay(3 choices were his was mine ) and a dessert for a very good price very filling.  My reason for 4 stars I'm a mom now and restroom did not have a changing table and the employees were not very good at opening the door to the dining area for a mother with her hands full carrying a baby in one and diaper bag in other .  Lost point for that specific service and lack of . Good for lunch with friends etc

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

B5Bv6vrvMtZDmBMaSrMN0Q.text: We've eaten here several times and it is a leisurely paced restaurant with great views.  Last nights dinner was  not a good reflection of previous experiences.  I dislike empty cocktail glasses left on the table, having to ask for cutlery when next course arrives,  long Long absences from server, spotted utensils. Sounds petty? Maybe but this is the style/price point of restaurant when you can expect better service I believe.  Now food........ ? 7/10 this time.

5-zc9fiR-1_rlXtofVHBlQ.text: Celebrated my birthday here with my parents.  I can see why there seems to be quite a mixed bag of reviews.  Here's my breakdown:  The service - Although it was slow, the server was great.  He was personable and knowledgeable and funny.  It just took too long between his check-ins with us.  The food - EXCELLENT!  Everything we got was delicious.  The only items I wasn't happy with were the desserts (one of which was a birthday gift from them).  Sometimes I think I tend to over-scrutinize desserts, given that I'm a pastry chef, but after my dad took a bite of his creme brulee he thought it was grainy (the custard part).  And my mom thought the smores mousse was too sweet (as did I).  It also had old marshmallows.    The wine - Great selection here with reasonable pricing.  The only thing I didn't like was the corkage fee.  But I'd rather pay a $10 fee than the extreme mark-up you'd be charged buying a bottle of champagne at other restaurants.  So it's still a win guys!!!  The atmosphere - Gorgeous.  So it's not a "real" lake and your view is of homes.  Doesn't matter.  Still beautiful.  And the restaurant is lit well and decorated nicely.  Plenty of heat on the patio as well.

dJpwhzcVQZkkVqI6mqC6cg.text: My boyfriend reserved a table for tonight. They have a variety of wine selections. Even a "wine enthusiast" favorite. So we chose a Pinot Noir bottle while waiting to be seated. Our hostess was very friendly even though she mentioned it was her third day. She did a wonderful job of controlling the parties waiting to be seated.   It was a rainy day, we had no complaints but the hostess gave us a choice of patio or inside. We chose patio and she sat us by a cozy fireplace. At first it was lovely, just for our anniversary but then as it rained harder we started to get a little wet. We asked to move and they moved us with no problem.   Our server was also really nice. I believe his name was Anthony. It was our first time here and he was very patient. He explained the specials and opened our wine as we got settled.  We got the a green salad and cheese platter to start. Both were delicious! The cheese platter especially! It paired perfectly with our wine.  As we drank our server always poured for us which I thought was great attention to detail. As we finished our starter, they brought out our entree at the perfect time.  For our entree we ordered, the Scottish salmon and the lobster pasta. Both were also delicious and we very much enjoyed every bite!  As it came close to dessert we had a hard time choosing between tiramisu and the cheesecake. Since they were out of tiramisu, I just went ahead and ordered another wonderful cheese plate while my boyfriend got the cheesecake.   Overall, an awesome romantic experience.  Great wine and cheese, for you wine and cheese people.  And great service!

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bL1iRVuUNcXWDGh77ZW5cw.text: I have been eating here for 20 years and always loved their food and the service.  I had one of the worst meals I have ever had out a week ago with friends.  The bearnaise sauce for the steak frites was packaged. The salmon overcooked, dry and full of grease and they are now serving a fried egg on the Lyonnais salad instead of a poached egg.  Super disappointed and doubt that I will go back until they replace the chef that was horrible.

egQxZLHMLRoiPaDGrr5u6g.text: I came here for brunch today with my boyfriend on a whim. We went to a different place but they were having Kids brunch so we decided to come here. This is my 2nd visit and weren't disappointed.   First off, I love the beautiful lake view and the elegant ambiance. The staff is friendly as well.  We ordered their Fruit Crepe, Grits & Grillades and Lobster Croissant. The food came out in time. Not only the platter were beautiful, they were tasty and savory.  Imo, the tables were too close, we could hear everyone's conversations. Sure enough, the table next to us heard our conversations and started talking to us. Also, we were cold, and everyone else still had their jackets on.  This place is perfect for any occasions and esp beautiful place for a date night. I prefer sitting outside and enjoying the view.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CL1ACciN2amCI9DNdYOZQg.text: I have been here for dinner, happy hour, Saturday morning wine tasting, and Sunday brunch. The food has been delicious and consistent with every visit. Most recently brunch at the gorgeous, somewhat new bar -- Bottomless mimosas with various fruit flavors to choose from (my favorite being Cassis) for $20 is a great deal. The Bloody Mary is spicy, thick, and huge! It also comes with a niece piece of bacon.   The escargot was salty, garlicky, and overall perfect. To make it even more perfect I dunked their delicious homemade bread into the unctuous, oily sauce after gobbling up all of my snails.   Chef's soup du jour is always outstanding. On this day it was a rich carrot ginger for which they accidentally brought us a second bowl and left it with the kitchen's compliments. Thank you!  Steak & Eggs - steak med rare and cooked PERFECTLY. This was a small, bistro style steak I am not even sure what the cut was. I do wish for the price the piece of meat had been larger. Eggs fluffy and scrambled, salty and crispy breakfast potatoes were also a hit.  Truffled Grits & Beef Medallions - served with an egg on top that once the yolk was broken oozed delightfully over the grits and beef. A very rich and satisfying dish although, again, I wish the portion were larger.  Fruit Crepe - for dessert, this was a combination of various types of seasonal fruits topped with a creme anglaise. Perfectly tarte and sweet, I ate the entire thing.  I have seen some reviews with complaints regarding the owner. He greeted me today as he does every time I dine in and has always been friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot ginger Seasonal Soup Du Jour
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh fruit crepe with creme anglaise
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled Grits &amp; Beef Medallions

4IEQUp8zVV8Kb5OnipZWhw.text: I love this place! This is where I have celebrated Mothers Day for the past 5 years. This occasion was my birthday and we were a party of five couples. The food was excellent, the company extraordinary, and venue was perfection. We requested the patio with its gorgeous water views, and were seated in front of a fireplace and backed up by a heater-it was perfect. The manager stopped by often to assure we were well-served. My duck breast was 2nd to none, and our waitress was nonpareil. She was so capable and intuitive.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Best Seared Scallops ever!!

HfViL3EUSLNFxTy5g7CMMA.text: Extremely disappointed with the food! We went there 4/6/19.  1- Escargot was so greasy. 2- Pork belly tasteless (please learn how to make a caramelized wine reduction). 3- Lobster Cavatelli absolutely horrible! No sauce. Very upset the server advised us it was one of their best plates. Mediocre food and overpriced for what you get! Will not recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasteless Lobster Cavatelli one of their &#34;Favorites&#34; according to the server.

EaFAytQhtQHrRx4cEmZecQ.text: Truly truly truly one of our favorites in the city. The location is amazing when seated outside right on the lake in Desert Shores. The servers are very hip to the menu and can help you choose what's best to eat depending on your feelings for flavor that evening. The restaurant is in the back of a wine shop where you can grab a bottle of wine and bring it to dinner with you... What could possibly be better  I highly recommend the cheese tray as a starter as it is the perfect complement to the wine. The candy peppers or something on like I've ever tasted. But we have been there several times as Desert Shores residence ourselves we recently took my parents there for a birthday celebration. My mother and father we're there for the first time and raved about the taste of the food and the quality of the service. There are restaurants to come and go in the desert Shores strip but this one is been there a while and for good reason... It's simply awesome.  Go support this restaurant so that it's here for many years to come. You will love it

zpmyq-ibc-vWiNa6g3oTyQ.text: What a great restaurant! My wife and I came here for our anniversary and they didn't disappoint. The food was delicious, service great and the setting was really nice. We especially appreciated the anniversary dessert. We'll be back for sure.

5oUitZy-HFj7Rh47GdYVHA.text: I've eaten at Marche Bacchus on numerous occasions.  It is one of only a handful of restaurants in town, where you can sit on a lakeside patio.  The front of the restaurant is a wine bar and store.  One thing I love is, you can pick your bottle of wine from their store and enjoy it with your meal.    During my most recent trip, we went for lunch and shared the: (1) lump crab salad; and the (2) charred octopus.  Both of the dishes are great.  The crab salad was light and refreshing, but still had plenty of crab.  The octopus was perfectly cooked.  It was tender, but firm enough to maintain its form and lightly smokey from the char.  For main courses, we ordered the (1) roasted chicken & spinach salad; and (2) the forbidden rice with chicken.   The salad was a perfect blend with spinach, quinoa, walnuts, and cranberries.  It was a great mix of flavors and textures.  The risotto was creamy, but not overly gooey.  I was very impressed with the tastes.    The staff, as always, was very friendly and attentive.  This is the best place in town to enjoy a glass of wine and great meal on a lake.

YzOcgXSvlmAmmHp2hbWR7w.text: Came here for Sunday Brunch, and wasn't disappointed. The restaurant is very cozy, and elegant. The patio area is small, but charming. Luckily, we were seated with a great view of the lake. The staff was very helpful, and answered all of our questions. My friend has dietary issues, so she needs to ask a lot of questions, because of food allergies.   I ordered the Steak & Eggs, which were good. It was cooked exactly the way I wanted, though I wish the steak had a little more flavor. I can't say it was the best steak & eggs I've ever had, but ti was still very good. I feel that the best things about the restaurant are the atmosphere and the service. I have no problem coming back and trying other things on the menu. I've never been much of a brunch person, anyway. Perhaps I'll return for dinner, and try some wine!

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Eggs for brunch

rGlIFxNSeA0VUUs7C3q58w.text: Still our favorite restaurant, can't beat the ambience, and our server, Kara, was delightful. Food was a little slow - very French. If you want fast food, go to McDonald's. This is not a place you want to rush your dining experience. The view is incredible and the wine selection is extensive.  Everything we ordered was properly prepared and delicious. Topped off by some genuine gelato for dessert.  Final joy...bill was half of what we would except on the strip and hey, close, free parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Doesn&#39;t get any better in Las Vegas.
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Incredible view.
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One order of tasty gelato.

SmvMAcPj7fDAEHsnic5VDw.text: First time in for brunch and it won't be our last. We had an 11 am reservation and were sat after a brief wait. I ordered a bacchus Bloody Mary and it was very delicious. Quite spicy with a cocktail sauce taste, mostly from the horseradish. I couldn't decide between the bacon and eggs risotto or the truffle grits and beef. I asked the waiter if I they were small and if I could eat both and he said they were pretty big, so my wife, who had ordered the brioche French toast said she'd help me eat some so I ordered both   The risotto was the star of the show. It was so delicious with bacon bits sprinkled into the risotto and 2 poached eggs on top. I broke the eggs into the risotto and mixed it all up. It was so good I could have eaten another one  The beef and grits was also good but a little bland. Could have used some salt. Was good and we are it all but I would just get the bacon and risotto.   The French toast was good, was crusted with honey oats and served with maple syrup and whipped cream. My wife loved it. She had the wild ginger drink with tequila and said it was one of the best cocktails she's ever had  Service was excellent and we will definitely be back

P0uoiOLHACwCZroZ_DjfxQ.text: Don't be fooled by the front of this restaurant/wine store... The real prize is the back patio overlooking the lake.  The selection was great and assisted by the very friendly and informative sommelier.  Our party enjoy a nice beef tartar for an appetizer and a few of us each enjoyed the spiced honey glazed duck paired with poached pares, sweet potato, and grapes... Some off the best duck I've ever had.  If you're in the area, do yourself a favor and check this hidden gem out!

hYGFRHgWQBL4k3PGOF17MQ.text: Had a lovely brunch outside by the water. French Toast and salmon benedict were delicious! Tons of salmon on the benedict. Very generous. Wait staff were also very friendly. We will be repeat customers for sure.

S_teGcQBYa7NfdXScuTBog.text: Great views and ambiance. Wonderful service. So so food. The eggs benedict was overcooked and the quiche was bland.

KBtmIqwXiYaqGD2DX98JQw.text: We got married here last week and our party of 29 had a wonderful time.  Rhonda had set us up to the side but there were occupied tables next to us.  Seemed odd at first but in a way fun to have others share in our celebration, with several of them congratulating us afterward.
