n4GQVoOHfPoST7XVds-a8A.text: This place is truly amazing! From the fresh bread to the delicious wine ... everything is perfect! I can't wait to come back at the end of April for my birthday

SdK8a4xcq5To1ReG5IFdmg.text: Food is delicious, reasonable prices, ambiance is incredible, but the best part of all is the wine cellar full of great priced wines to choose from for your dinner.

oW1bQ4x0fYa-hh1xZ34hzg.text: The owner wife-so she claim to be. We were disgusted by her snobby personality. Maybe she just wanted freebie. Telling a restaurant how to run 4.5 stars like her 3 in another country....I wonder how it even got more than 1. You should be embarrassed of yourself because everyone heard your nonsense and we were embarrass for you. Quit a Monkey though so here's your 1 Star.-I was entertained. Name dropping is for high school and we customers observing the scene to be quite embarrassing for an American to behave that way in another country. If your restaurant is 5 stars then it's another story, but its 3 stars. Though those at that caliber would not scoop that low. And you don't walk- you taxi only....and your hotel is around the corner-tasteless. I hope your food will be more tasty than the words coming out of your mouth with attitude..then again doesn't seems that way from your rating. I can tell it's pretentious .....LOTS of it...you must not traveled to Paris much or travelled at all to feels the generous of refine dinning here.

qJ-FAn1UnanwGhuvuzsM-g.text: Pretentious and run-down. Wine was over-priced and food was average at best.  I recommend spending your money elsewhere.

6tteGxG0_z_3YUJyZrLrng.text: Was really disappointed with the service here. Had a party of 10 here on Saturday afternoon outside.  Our waitress was inattentive and seemingly irritated that she had to serve us, despite the large tip she would automatically get for such a large party. Water was only filled once or twice even in the 110 degree heat and bread took way too long to come out. Food was not as mind blowing as I was expecting. The only good thing about this place is the view and the atmosphere honestly.

y9pYgskR2N3pW3efktfjKQ.text: We usually love this place. Unfortunately on our last visit , we were seated next to a fire place at a very wet table. There were many other seats available but we're told that only a few tables were open. We sat and get uncomfortable as we were in between 2 other tables and a fire place. We sat there for a while deciding if we wanted to stay. We decided to leave because no one greeted us and we were uncomfortable, as we were leaving the hostess that sat us watched us leave and didn't say a word.   A different experience then we had on our first time visiting. Not sure if we will make the drive again

90OPTNfnHSi6HJRGpHy4pw.text: I have been wanting to try this place for quite awhile and recently got the chance.  The lakeside seating is absolutely fabulous - there's really not many places like this in Vegas, especially for locals, to feel like they're away from the noise and crowds of the Strip, so if you're looking for a great date nite or romantic setting, this restaurant absolutely will not disappoint! The lakeside view with swans and ducks gliding past is marvelous.    The service was very good and attentive.  I and my lunch guest had the smoked chicken sandwich which was on a nice roll, with crispy lettuce and avocado.  The chicken could have had  a BIT more flavor, but overall was  an enjoyable sandwich.  It came with the most DIVINE french fries I've ever had, and I've had a lot of  fries in my life. These were crispy, lovely and totally addictive.  I could NOT stop eating those french fries!  Finished the meal with creme brulee for dessert ($9) which could have been a little larger for the price, but it was excellent, made with tahitian vanilla with a wonderful cracked sugar topping.   The only "glitch" is that the server said that the wait for our meal would be delayed by about 20 minutes because some sort of problem had developed with their ovens.  Luckly, I and my guest were in no hurry, but a delay could have caused a problem if we had another appointment somewhere.  So, I couldn't give this place four stars due to that.  Also, our table was a little "wobbly" which was irritating during the meal.  Would luv to give a lovely restaurant like this five stars, but couldn't do it  this time around.  Looking forward to trying more things on their menu and maybe next time will be the charm that brings it up to five star?

Aoh8q5O1whTEwS5kPMc1kw.text: I went here with a Prom group this last Saturday at which we made reservations a month in advance, we too our prom pictures and noticed we'd be late I called at 5:20 (the reservation was a 5:30)to ask if they would hold our reservations informing them we'd be about 20 minutes late, they then told me it wouldn't be a problem and when she showed up they told us they had given up our table because nobody called. They tried to move us inside but our whole purpose of going to this restaurant was to be outside right next to the water they then made us wait an additiaonal 30 minutes to "build" a table outside where we originally made our reservations, Although all these problems arose our waiter was outstanding make sure everything was perfect and we had everything we wanted, but with the problems between the hostess and the manager I don't believe we will be eating here again.

aZbeyQ1e9LKsP_JLhkCIZA.text: Went her for a Valentines date and Marches Bacchus did not disappoint! The ambiance is perfect for a couples romantic dinner. I ordered the charcuterie platter and the sea bass special. Both were very satisfying. I can't wait to go back and try their brunch menu and enjoy the community lake view.

Mca-KmzdHwMmBFsI9hU2bg.text: Sad to report that this place has gone downhill. Last time, some food was tepid at best. This time, the lyonnaise salad was pretty sad looking. Diced up bacon and not lardons. Raw egg.   The eggplant dish was served cold... not even tepid. It was cold and congealed and not even heated up. So gross.   I left and went elsewhere after picking at the salad.

KcvRJKpDRo1N3fDeJeQ2xQ.text: We usually love Marche Bacchus. Today there were so many problems that it will be a loooong time before we return to their beautiful waters edge location. Sadly, it was Father's Day with guests that they screwed up the reservation, confused the wine, didnt know the special, took the order but forgot to ask about the sides, and the food itself was less than expected. Whatever you do, do not order the mussels because they smell so strongly no one else can enjoy their meal.

KgB37NcO8PRLvlABBWtepQ.text: Everything about this place is awesome... the ambiance, the wine selection, the food, and service... if u r looking for a perfect date....or trying to impress... brunch, lunch, or dinner... this is the spot

W5V-luBw8pesvAWOeOU2fQ.text: Took a date there and she loved it. I've been here many times but never posted an actual review.  If you are a foodie this is a great little gem. If you like to drink wine this has the best selection as you can shop in their wine store and have it corked at the table for a minimal fee. And if you are both then it's a win win.   The ambiance is great and it feels like you aren't even in Las Vegas anymore. When we have events at my work place we tend to purchase alcohol from here as I can only serve Italian wines and spirits and they have a great selection. Mille notte donnafugata is amazing if you are looking for something different.

ih-q08A27MjJ8DY3OyT6hQ.text: Sunday brunch. Weather was perfect. Ask for a patio table overlooking the lake. Food was really good and service was friendly. Highly recommended.

-l6JNEp9yCUYtbPwvC8V5g.text: Awesome wine, view and food! I came here for some me time and it did the trick. Wine on the water with an amazing lunch view, what more can u ask for. The server (Anthony) was very attentive and made sure the kitchen could accommodate my recently found food allergies and the meal was spot on!   This spot is great for any imaginable dining options. Whether a date, girl time, man time, alone time or large parties, you can't go wrong with here. They offer a wine store when u walk in and u can purchase any bottle for the tables  ($10 corkage fee) but they have an awesome selection to choose from.   Also they have vegetarian options, I've asked in the past and they've always provided a separate menu for those options. I've been here too much and everytime I leave satisfied wanting to come back.   FYI on busy holidays make resos as they always book!

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine on water....a mini vacay feel

3xneuSf49JVAY-xfQ2Ffsg.text: Absolutely phenomenal! From the location, to the service, down to our dinner; everything was Incredible. We went for our anniversary, and I had no idea what we were walking into. It looked like a wine market at first, but then we stepped down to a warm, and cozy lower level overlooking the pond. Please believe me when I say the New Old Fashioned is a must have. We also drank something that had gin and Absinthe; whatever that was, you HAVE to try it! Onion soup, lobster Caesar, steak frites, and creme brulee.. this place has dining down to an art. We will be back :)

bnYESQVMmXMlnxql2eLIag.text: Let me say that I was really excited to try this place because I knew the atmosphere was going to be great, and it definitely was. I came here with my bf for my bday brunch.  He made a reservation for us for 12pm. We came right on time but ended up having to wait for about 10 minutes, which wasn't a big deal. It's a rare, beautiful day in Vegas so everyone wants to sit in the patio area.   We ordered the escargot to start which was good. My boo got the smoked salmon Benedict (which I wanted also but didn't want to get the same thing) and I ended up trying the crab and asparagus Benedict. The flavors were pretty bland to me and they all mashed together (and not in a good way). I love eggs Benedict but I was very underwhelmed. I tried some of my bf's which was slightly better but definitely not worth the money in my opinion. You're more so paying for the ambiance rather than food/service.   On top of that, the service was slow. My bf and I look really young and it seemed at though they kind of kept forgetting about us. It was decent for Sunday brunch time and they didn't seem understaffed to me. I was really annoyed when we had to wait 20 minutes for our check so we could leave. All in all, totally unimpressed and underwhelmed.

_mLqLJ6dVAMLlZdS5O4lrA.text: Fantastic food here. The halibut and steak frites are both absolutely amazing. For appetizers, the beet salad and pumpkin soup were very delicious. The chocolate lava cake was also good. Excellent food!

pXc2STpzVViflZ5v2mZjLA.text: What a wonderful relaxing night.   The venue on the little lake is spot on, the service second to none, thank you Vince and there food fabulous. We had a table for two just outside the restaurant door, perfect evening and the weather could not have been better,  Loved my snails and bread.  Thank you for a special evening.

U2VIRcV1K5oARslCi2uASw.text: The atmosphere this place is really fun and funky. You walk through a wine shop and the restaurant is mostly outdoors over looking very relaxing atmosphere of flakes with ducks and geese.   While this is all great, the food here in the past has been absolutely superb.   My wife and I recently went for lunch and we're very disappointed. We both had the lobster roll croissants and found that there was zero lobster meat in the role. It was all Sherimi. Well the flavor was fine, it was not what we were expecting or what we ordered. I am not sure if we will be back.

zJPMYXPrlGRbXjLbyZwFaw.text: I have been coming to Marche' Bacchus for many years and have never been disappointed. From the moment you enter the quaint wine store/cafe you are in for a great experience.  They have a great location in Desert Shores right on the water. I enjoy stopping by for a good glass of wine and their cheese plate while sitting outside near the water in early June.  On this past Saturday evening, we did sit outside and the heat lamps were on so it was very comfortable. There was a guitar playing some good music which added to the ambiance. We were welcomed with a glass of champagne which was something new but we all really liked it and toasted happily. We were quickly greeted by our waiter who told us about the specials and then gave us ample time to make our decisions. I appreciate when a restaurant allows you to take your time and doesn't rush you to order. This allows one to enjoy the evening. We decided on the Swordfish, New York Steak with a large prawn, and the Pork Loin.  We also enjoyed the goat cheese/compote on a flaky croissant for appetizer.  I went in and picked the wine. We enjoyed a nice Tobin James Zinfandel. If you are a wine lover like me, this part is fun since you have a whole store of 900+ bottles to choose which kind of wine you want to drink!  The Swordfish was so buttery and tender. It simply melted in your mouth. The Pork Loin was also very tasty my friend told me as she has had it before and it is one of their best dishes. Out of all three dishes, the NY steak and prawn were just disappointing. Although the steak was tender and served in a Bernaise sauce it was just lacking and I probably made a mistake in ordering it. I will not discount the restaurant for this one dish as I have had several amazing dishes dining here so it would not be fair to grade them poorly for my mistake.  We ended our meal with some tasty desserts. The service was excellent and the temperature was comfortable on the patio. If you find yourself in the neighborhood be sure to stop in for brunch, lunch or dinner. This place is a main stay in this part of town!

xCkQz_JCUcCaxyTvxtPf5A.text: The restaurant was amazing, beautiful view. For the food I really like the appetizer who was the truffled goat cheese napolean it was amazing and then I ordered the croque madame who is 1 of my favorite dishes and this is why I removed 1 star I didn't like the quality of the ham, the waiter said it was a French ham but I don't believe 1 second that it was french. Anyway the price was good I took the lunch menu with a glass of wine who was very good. I will go back for sure but I will try something else that the croque madame for sure the lobster salad in the croissant who look yummy.

5h3UMJT2d-PbS2pp_CQSLg.text: Just had lunch at the patio. It's gorgeous. The escargot and the artisanal cheeses were exquisite. I have dined here many times and havnt written a review though the restaurant is worthy of a five star review. The reason I am writing one now is Alexis, our server. Polite, attention to detail, kind and just really amazing in every way. We will be back

DYL_U9YAroOCm0d9BNFNjg.text: Researched fresh restaurants in LAS area.  Found this Gem in Summerlin.  It's very unassuming in a residential area strip mall.  After reading some of the reviews we were prepared for the snooty reception previously mentioned. We weren't surprised when we were greeted with no " hello.... how are you today". Instead...... we got ..."4?". ( I presumed she meant table for 4. ) Yes.... we proceed to follow her through the wine shop to an outdoor patio that is quite lovely.  Even though it was extremely hot out.... it remained comfortable with musters and fans.  Our server Jan was wonderful. So we all forgot about our snooty hostess.  Food was delicious. We were there for lunch and all had something different.  French onion soup amazing. Tomato Bisque ...creamy  goodness.  Buckwheat crepes filled with mushrooms and chicken delightful. Lobster salad on a buttery croissant.. and a 4 hour braised beef sandwich with truffle fries.  Desserts ..... creme brulee .... vanilla pannacotta ... and bread pudding. Needless to say... out of this world.  If you need a break from the loud strip action.... head out here. Nice treat.  Just don't expect warm fuzzy feeling at the door. It won't happen.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts

NmPJT-udJZJJOVRbRjAdrQ.text: Went to have drinks and appetizers with friends to celebrate a birthday. They could not accommodate us at the bar so they moved us to the restaurant. They would not honor happy hour prices because we were no longer in the bar. For the appetizers, We were then talked into ordering their specialty french onion soup for $10@. It was average at best. So was the escargot.  They had no glasses of wine for under $16 and trust me they had plenty of cheap wines in their wine store. After appetizers, wine and dessert, the waiter asked us if we could settle our checks and leave as there was a group waiting for a table. Are you kidding me? Never again for this clip joint!!

niZynirEk7h1bDm-xjQcjQ.text: If you are a French cuisine fan, this is definitely one of those hidden gems that locals love to frequent. It's sort of like a strip mall setting but more quaint and special since it's located by the lake in a prestigious, quiet and well-maintained neighborhood. There are actually other restaurants in this location that's on my list. Seated by a huge bay window with the view of the lake watching ducks glide on the water and a solo guitar player singing popular classic and pop songs in the background. There are several dining area set ups in various levels with mist sprays keeping everyone cool while dining and there was a wide variety of interesting people to watch as well Oh about the food- for appetizers, the Escargot "Persillade" was amazing - just be careful, it's served hot. It was crowded that night, there was a slight wait on the entrees. I had the Pan Roasted Duck Breast (no it wasn't the one gliding on the lake - joking) - medium well and seasoned lightly with a side of Farro salad along with a signature cocktail. Oh did I mention it's also a wine shop??? For those wine lovers they have an international wine collection to choose from. Anyway, check out their menu and pricing online. Definitely make reservations and parking can be tricky since it's a popular venue for private parties, wedding etc. If it's a beautiful cool evening, definitely go for a short romantic walk on the small bridge overlooking the lake and a private garden for some French kissing under the moonlight - you get the idea. I could go on and on but you check it out for yourself!

DKbNtsxvVQmPassFPRALXg.text: Great restaurant! Went in a couple days ago with my girlfriend. The owner was amazing he made sure we were all set up properly. We had brought in our own bottle off bubbles we still ended up buying 2 more bottles of Faust napa cab. My favorite part of our meal was their dry aged rib eye the taste was great and just the right amount of seasoning for a piece of beef.   We left with the curiosity of coming back for brunch I'm sure we'll be back within the week!!  Thank you team!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked salmon, caviar, macaroon.
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bubbles for dinner!

NGuvvj4dwtdU3EQQobYlyA.text: I romantic fairly-priced gem of a restaurant and wine bar overlooking the lake. The food, service, and ambiance are perfect... This is a "go-to" date spot to impress without breaking the bank to do so!

wwpzmUIR-h5F2RwCSrkCtg.text: A+ for the setting and service. Gorgeous location for a date night.  As for the food, I was extremely underwhelmed. The lunch menu is very limited. And the choices weren't even that appealing. The best dish seemed to be the chicken and forbidden rice, per server's recommendation. My mom got this, and it was actually pretty good. I ended up ordering tomato soup and pasta. The tomato soup was tasty, but I wish they had toned it down on the salt. I've had better at Panera. The pasta was so boring. Literally just a pink tomato sauce with a dash of basil and cheese on top. Now, I understand there's beauty in simplicity, but this was just flat out tasteless. I chose not to order the quiche or crepe to avoid that - other reviews noted those items were bland too.  For how expensive the dishes are, I would think they could hire better chefs or use some more ingredients.   They do have an amazing wine selection. So I would say if you're looking for somewhere to sit down and share a bottle of wine while overlooking a lake filled with beautiful black swans, come check this place out! But if you're looking to have an authentic French meal, move along...

mAy4SeMnLv428d1_TtUhPA.text: The food and wine are great. I hate to say we were profiled by our server Miguel.  Just because we were interracial couple that doesn't mean we can't afford.  We noticed that he went to all the tables several times and catered to them.  Thanks to Raluca she came by to fill our glass with water.  Mind you it's not like we just ordered water we had a bottle of wine plus a corking fee.  Let's put it this way the corking fee was his tip which I don't think he deserves but we gave Raluca the cash tip.  Thank you Raluca.  Miguel, just because we're not caucasians that doesn't mean we can't afford this place.  I've been to this place before and was never treated this way.

-pfdCdLK6CVTtsZH7EV6Zg.text: You all were just so wonderful. Diana server was first rate. 4 stars only, though. As a former F&B Director at 5 Star resorts in San Diego and Las Vegas you have one  challenge. The food runners approach each table and don't know who has what entree. They announce the food and we're supposed to raise our hand, I suppose?  I watch all service aspects when I'm dining and every table had the same. The food runner also served my entree before my wife's which is inexcusable. It's a very easy fix. I would be more than happy to tell you how to fix that.  I'm sure everything can be done directly through your POS system. And this is the only imperfection of the night. I am friends with Alex Stratta and I noticed his scallops still on the menu. They were some of the best I've ever had, as expected. Left with 2 bottles of Rombauer Chardonnay. Thank you.

8B5QC13q25Qo3cL2rXda4Q.text: Fun story: When I first googled where this restaurant was, I thought I was directed to the wrong city because of the bodies of water and seafaring street names that appeared on my map... Summerlin's a completely foreign territory to me considering Henderson is more my home turf, haha.  We visited during the evening for a friend's birthday dinner. You first walk in through a wine shop in order to get to the restaurant area, which overlooks man-made Lake Jacqueline if you opt to sit outside. Not much of a view at night, but I'm sure it's picturesque during the day (did someone say brunch??) The ambiance is classy -- the patio was covered, fireplace and heat lamps in full effect. It was nice. Made me feel like a fancy pants.   Service pretty solid. The complimentary bread and butter was served hot and fresh. Our party of 6 shared the charcuterie platter as our appetizer which was okay. I had a glass of moscato and it was very sweet. I'm not much of a wine person, so this was perfect. For my entree, I ordered the Exotic and Wild Mushroom Risotto which is $16 for a half-size. The mascarpone cheese was creamy and the mushrooms a good balance to the risotto's consistency. My boyfriend got the Braised Beef Ravioli, also half-sized, but he finished his portion rather fast. I tried a small bite and it tasted rich. For dessert, we shared the lava cake which was okay. We had a couple bites of the creme brulee which we both agreed was way better.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. exotic and wild mushroom risotto, half-size. loved it!
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lava cake! (the creme brulee&#39;s better!)

_BMTbzm4lHE0paLageoqqQ.text: Great Property, Fun Concept, Relaxing Atmosphere. Patio dining on cooler evenings is the way to go. Wine shop on the way in is a great way to plan your dinner, well placed educational points, fair prices and eager customer service.  Food was good, a little to be desired as it pertains to the product treatment but wrapped up in the cordial and efficient service a good deal overall for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu with chocolate gelato was the highlight.
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7IINRPx3zf1dLOv6rUu4JQ.text: I don't usually write reviews for business that have more than a couple hundred reviews because, really, what's the point? But I really feel obligated to reiterate other reviews and praise this fine establishment.   Marche Bacchus is one of my most favorite restaurants in the valley. (These aren't in order of importance.)   1) it's not on the strip.  2) its location right by the lake is almost unfathomable when you think of a French restaurant in Las Vegas!  3) the ambiance of the restaurant is unbelievably romantic. The indoor dining area is beautiful. The outdoor area is absolutely gorgeous, especially at night.  4) the service is always attentive and warm. 5) the food is absolutely delicious. Try the duck (have it cooked medium), mushroom risotto (only if you absolutely love mushrooms and can appreciate specialty mushrooms other than white button mushrooms), escargot, meat and cheese plate, grilled octopus. Yes, I haven't had anything not good here.  6) price wise: you get more bang for your buck.   They even do weddings here and they are so easy to work with. They don't charge you to rent the space, which is rare for such a beautiful venue. (At least they didn't about two years ago, not sure if they do now.)   So, yes. Bring your girlfriends here (not all at once, of course) and you shall be doing at least one thing right.

gbUGs_Y9vDQB_abkjmGwug.text: We had a very lovely evening here last night. The service was excellent and they were very accommodating for our large party. The food is the only thing holding me back from 5 stars. It was good, not great. Very edible, but not very memorable. However the staff deserves a shout out for 5 star service. Would definitely return especially with groups as they made it so easy!

R12JW0KODx2tPYpjQbyP9g.text: Great food, beautiful setting, impeccable service. The entrance doesn't look like much, but the lakeside patio seating makes you feel like you've left Las Vegas completely. Came by for a lunch during restaurant week and brought my guy for dinner.    The goat cheese Napoleon is one of the best appetizers I've ever had, a crazy-great balance of sweet and savory coming from the honey and pistachio harmonizing with the cheese and phyllo dough. The chicken and forbidden rice dish was well-executed, particularly the black rice. Dessert was a beautiful creme brulee I was too full to finish. Server Scott was attentive, genuine, and professional throughout.  The menu had something for everyone,  and the lakeview patio is a big draw for date night.  Looking forward to coming back and browsing their wine shop!

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brulee
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken And forbidden rice
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Patio view

nKBLRDEeeZsB1e9Nfh4woQ.text: I absolutely love this place. Great ambiance fabulous food great service. What more can you ask for. Eating on the patio is fabulous and watching the swans a lot of fun.  Try it you'll love it.  It's our go to place for special occasions.

NvgQc7T31uAOcfG8Ps5N4Q.text: Nice ambient, the patio is beautiful, you can buy the wine inside the market and paid a cork fee. Food is good as well as the service.

8UQ1TiNUix_5ZJgdEECb5g.text: I can only give 3 stars unfortunately because even though the food here is amazing, the service is kind of hit and miss, the owners only talk to people they obviously know which I will expand on and the kitchen lacks attention to detail and properly preparing dishes.  This is our second visit and the food is truly amazing when prepared as stated on the menu.  I ordered a Chopped Cobb salad and I had to inform the server once she de used to come by again that there were ingredients the menu stated came on the salad and they were not there.  Bacon is a component of the salad and there was NONE.  This baffles me, a simple Chopped salad and the kitchen forgets ingredients?  It makes me wonder what is really going on in the kitchen.  Is there not anyone checking the food before it leaves the kitchen?  The table right next to us had two ladies with a baby, one of the owners came by and said hi to them, she obviously knew them and the walked away...never said hi to us or asked if everything was ok, nothing.  As an owner you should take pride in your place and check on the people helping you make a living.    I covered the food issues and the owner issue now the service.  Our server took a long time to come to our table just to say hi for the first time.  She was really nice but would disappear and not come back for long periods.  When she brought my salad, fist off she should have noticed that it missing and most places of this caliber normally ask if you would like pepper with the salad but not here today.  Overall the food was good just a few items if fixed would make this place a 4 to 5 star place.

N2LOv0FJSNz-UvlqQSDN0g.text: Great atmosphere and excellent service. Food was great nice selection of choices for wine and food dishes. Don't be pass on the deserts

EUXSBo5Q-L8AhFCRXhQuaw.text: The outside patio by the lake is very nice but the food was mediocre and the service was an absolute disaster.  My mother informed our server about her dietary restrictions and was told that the lobster salad croissant did not contain onions. When she started eating, she tasted onions and asked the server again. He dismissed her and said there were just radishes and no onions. He didn't bother asking anyone in the kitchen about the ingredients or having it checked out after the initial complaint.   Aside from this, the service was terrible in every other way. We were brought bread but no plates for it. My father asked the barback for some olive oil and he looked at my father like he had no idea what he was saying. My father said he wanted olive oil for the bread. The barback said olive oil would be coming with my mother's salad and walked away (she had already ordered olive oil as her dressing). So we never got olive oil for the bread. We later asked the same barback for more bread. He looked annoyed and said to ask our server. We asked our server and he took 10 minutes to bring it and then set it down with an attitude and walked away. Our server never refilled our water or asked us how our food was. When we got the bill we also realized that the server tacked on 9 dollars for a house salad that was supposed to be included with the lobster roll on the lunch menu.   We complained to the manager about the ignored dietary restrictions and the manager confirmed the lobster roll does in fact have onions in it. The manager was gracious and helpful and took it off our bill. Then we had to tell her again about being charged 9 dollars for a house salad that was supposed to be included with the lunch and she took that off our bill too. So big thank you to the manager and to the owner who came by as they were super gracious and professional unlike the other staff at the restaurant.   Overall this was really disappointing. The food was mediocre at best. The lobster rolls had little lobster or flavor in them but the escargot was good. This was literally the worst service I've ever experienced and now my mother is suffering from heartburn due to the server not caring about her dietary restrictions. I eat out a few days a week and this was the second time in my life I didn't leave a tip. This is a great location with lots of potential but the staff need to learn how to treat customers.

9l4E_lL8JXqP5oz7YrnWLA.text: We recently celebrated my grandson's 1st birthday here.  The food, ambiance, guitar music and service was so exceptional.  My little grandson loved the branzino and my lobster cavatelli was delicious.

7HVdzFwhTIP27nLTKEVNCQ.text: I had an absolutely PHENOMENAL experience at Marche Bacchus. I am not sure if it was the company, the atmosphere, the food or the service, but it was simply wonderful.  I have wanted to try this place for quite awhile, but hadn't been able to make it in. It was my turn to plan date night and I figured this would be the perfect place to take my boyfriend. It ended up being more than I imagined and we both had a fabulous time.  I love how unassuming this place is - it's in a residential neighborhood and then in a business park within that area. When you enter, you are in the wine shop - note that they do not sell bottles of wine at the table, so if you want a bottle, take a few minutes to browse and find what you like, then take it to your table with you. You are able to purchase glasses of wine while at the table.  The service was fantastic - I really liked our server and will definitely go back to see her. The food was really good as well. We started out by sharing the Bacchus platter, which is basically the house charcuterie. It was a great selection and I enjoyed everything. My BF had the beef tenderloin and I had the steak frites. The steak was damn near one of the best I've ever had and was cooked to a perfect medium rare temperature. I also ordered an extra side of the goat cheese mashed potatoes, which were crazy good.  The ambiance is what really sets this place apart. You really don't feel like you are in Las Vegas - it's a serene feeling, on the lake watching swans float by. This is a great place for proposals - in fact, the couple at the table next to us got engaged while we were there.  Overall, this was an unforgettable experience and I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f30lTOASPZymXlSCj_aSxg.text: Looking for a great French food, lakeside dining, amazing wine at half price than regular restaurants, that has vegetarian/vegan menu, kid friendly and live music, in Vegas?? YES!!! Marche Bacchus has it all.  We requested their lakeside table, and we were promptly seated at the table with the best view! They are open for lunch, dinner and Sunday brunch. They have their own wine shop that offers a huge selection of wines from around the world. You can buy any bottle from the shop and have it opened for your dinner at the restaurant for only $10 corkage fee. Can't beat that price! You could open a Dom Perignon champagne and pay store price!!  For starters we had their summer salad and truffled goat cheese napoleon, both excellent. For entree I had their vegetable ravioli (they have a great selection of vegetarian and vegan dishes), my husband had their roasted Scottish salmon. Kids menu is awesome too. My kids loved the pasta in cream sauce and chicken fingers that came with worlds best fries!! Very reasonably priced kids menu, $6 each. Food is excellent and so is the ambience. We always request for Diana who is the BEST. She takes care of the smallest detail and knows the menu so well. She is very nice to my kids. The restaurant was packed on a Saturday evening, however her service was impeccable.  They have a great desert menu. We tired their cream brulee and chocolate lava cake. I highly recommend cream brulee.  Can't wait to return!!

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate lava cake
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled goat cheese napoleon
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7u14dfy2w5m-KhJBRQXaHA.text: Not impressed!  Our server was fine until another couple that apparently frequents the place came in.  Then, we lost his attention.  But at least he spoke to us every once in a while.  As for the GM, not ONCE did he check on us.  Perhaps because we didn't order the Caviar.  But he made sure the "money spending" couple had their wine going.  The owner came in and literally stood 1 foot from us and spoke to the "rich" couple with his back to us the the whole time.  When he was finished, do you think he would look our way and say, "How is everything?" Heck no!  I won't even mention the food.  I lost my appetite when my wife and I,  who were celebrating our Anniversary by the way, were ignored!  DO NOT RECOMMEND unless you drive a Bentley!  STAY AWAY!

Ji584jTlvAJ8VsbTGwzRLg.text: Place is quaint and on the brink of falling apart, deluded myself that it was beside a natural body of water. Food was delicious! Service was great. Loved their steak tartare.

yAp8On-hVjWTyJG7lK0e6g.text: It seems like all the really poor reviews are written by uppity D-bags. This is a neighborhood restaurant. It's a bit casual, with food that's very good although not you know... Michelin star... and a VERY IMPRESSIVE WINE SELECTION. I come to this restaurant to drink wine and have explored and broadened my palette on regions and varietals outside of my usual comfort zone. If I would actually have one critique to management it would be that the younger servers don't really know wine. So I recommend asking to speak to someone who would be confident making a suggestion. Now about the outside dining... We live in Las Vegas people. Sometimes it's going to be hot. Sometimes cold. I recommend ordering something cold, maybe sparkling, when it's hot outside and vice versa. This is a lovely place and I hope the people giving the staff a hard time don't come back and ruin my dining experience.  Oh! About the service. I've never had a bad experience. In fact I appreciate that the staff leaves me and my guests alone enough to talk and drink our wine and not that constant "everything going alright over here? Anything for dessert?" routine you get from the big corporate restaurants trying to turn tables and maximize revenue.

gmtDqk9uDeSJXM_oPb-gnQ.text: You have access to some of the best boutique Napa/CA wine producers here. Haven't eaten here but have stopped by several times to purchase wine.

wODQkdraMhHLNfbiUlsoBQ.text: I've dined here multiple times and it's really just gone downhill over the years. I had about a dozen people in my party for my birthday. It was incredibly embarrassing at how horrible the service was and I was mortified to have brought my friends to dine there. The whole experience was over 3.5 hours long because the service was painstakingly slow. 2 friends ordered the same drink, yet they looked and tasted different. When they questioned the waiter they received attitude. One friend ordered a drink and was told the bartender didn't know how to make it. I'm sorry, why do you have something on the menu that the staff is not trained to make? I do have to say the food was very good, it just took forever for it to be delivered. When my friend asked one of the waiters if she could take a picture of us, she replied "I need to go check on another table, so if I have time I will". Wow ok. For the amount of money they charge I expect the service to match. I'm sad to say I think my days at this restaurant are through.

hr_QOK-eLUzpgN9MQQyj8A.text: My wife and I had a great experience at Bacchus a few weeks ago for a dinner out.  We loved the atmosphere and the wine selection was pretty incredible...the misters were a little strong but very welcome in the intense desert heat.   I'd like to think I know my way around a wine store and am familiar with most of the drinkable labels at our price point but I'll say that Bacchus had a ton of really interesting finds and labels that surprised us...we picked out a great white to accompany the meal, it was certainly value priced for being in a restaurant.  The wine market feel was definitely unique, definitely got us both engaged in the dining experience.    Our server was amazing, his stories and witicisms were thoughtful and interesting, it was evident that he loved the job and took great pride in his service.  The food was great and they knocked it out of the park, my only disappointment was the octopus which was underdone, a little chewy and fishy...I'm sure this was a one off as I've read other reviews that celebrate the octopus so we were just unlucky that night. I had the pork chop, a great recommendation and my wife had the halibut which was perfectly prepared.  Very unexpectedly our server brought us a complimentary dessert wine with our dessert as we were celebrating an anniversary.  All in all, a great night out, a great meal, as Vegas locals now this will be one of our go to spots.  We will definitely be back to Bacchus and next time I'll give the octopus another chance!

dkgnuFCo1rlCYwhM7Bx4mw.text: The service was great! My waiter Alexis was extremely friendly and attentive. Outside of the service, the food was delicious. I would definitely recommend this place to everyone. Again Alexis was an amazing waiter!!

SkVAdzWFS5idhkAKyIGvNQ.text: We had lunch here last week. They have changed their menu; our server was not familiar with the changes so he chose to disagree with us about what we could order. He went into the back and eventually came out with what we told him the menu said we could order. Note to wait staff: read and learn the new menu instead of contradicting your customers who do read the new menu.  I ordered their Brie Burger ($15.00) which now comes with some kind of "chutney" on it. This chutney was more like tasteless marinara sauce and so much was poured on the burger that it could not be picked up; I had to eat it with a knife and fork. At one point I pulled a large piece of gristle out of my mouth and placed it on the side of my plate. Their burger was a messy disappointment.  My GF had their lobster crepe ($21.00) which she said was OK if a bit on the small side.   The restaurant's lakeside location was nice, but what impressed us most about it, unfortunately, was the large number of bugs that constantly landed in our drinks. We had to have our water glasses replaced a couple of times and we eventually had to give up drinking any liquids at our table; the thirsty bugs were relentless.   My overall impression of Marche Bacchus: it is an alternative if you want to drop a lot of money on overpriced, mediocre food at a restaurant but don't want to drive all the way to the Strip. We won't be back.

6nn2IgLAH8sdl6if9K3tHA.text: The food and ambiance was amazing! I got a ton of messages from friends asking where I was eating and definitely recommended them all to come here! Good service and great food

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eL0ayi_z7sUKS0WoU4LmTw.text: The ambience and wine is great, the food is tastee but nothing extravagant or ultra amazing compared to other restaurants in Vegas. We came during lunch but I will be back for a dinner and more wine! The house sparkling wine was decent, if you like fruit forward wine there appears to be several other options in their wine store. I didn't try their house red wine but I suppose it would be keeping with their European theme and have heavy tannic taste to it.

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The aftermath of a tastee creme brûlée !

z7Xh8GbFQKR3O74PApUVQA.text: Let me preface this review by saying that my fiance Paul proposed to me here, so I may be a little bit biased :)   The food is outstanding and there is a great variety. Chef Dave met with my fiance days before the proposal and together, they created a custom menu including all of my favorite dishes. Paul gave Dave the ring (trusting guy, eh??) and he kept it safe and sound until the proposal.   After dinner (which was totally fantastic), the waitstaff brought out dessert-- a plate with a silver cover over it. They set the dish down and removed the cover to reveal a beautiful dessert with an even more beautiful diamond ring! Of course, I said YES!! Everyone clapped and cheered and the waitstaff brought champagne and an additional dessert for us to enjoy.   It was the perfect setting for the perfect dinner for the perfect proposal!

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Romance at its finest!
Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My engagement ring! Thanks, Chef Dave!

_Ly7bBspH2u6Fi8dgrDipw.text: We got here without a reservation,  the host was kind enough to get us a table you the lake, it was lovely, watching the swans, the atmosphere is really relaxing,  one would not want to leave. I ordered the tiramsu, because we wanted just desert, my friend got creme brulee, it was delicious so worth it, I the tiramisu was so moist and nice portion side, the creme brulee was smooth and so delicious. Perfect for a date night

photos.caption: Photo of Marché Bacchus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu

JDVPJaQE5EHklUQ-3u3W5Q.text: Great ambiance and our server Greg was awesome! But the food wasn't that great. The octopus was way too burnt and you only get like 5 pieces. The steak tartare wasn't appealing. The escargot had way too much rosemary on it, which ended up tasting like bleach. The pasta I had from the Groupon lunch menu was bland. The 3 flavor sorbet was decent because the green apple sorbet was the only good flavor. The orange & line flavor was way too sour for the palate.

5rktHaBdGh4nW4VsYaRYnA.text: What a HIDDEN GEM!! I loved the outdoor dining on the water.  Quiet and peaceful since we were there before the dinner rush.    WINE WINE WINE....great selection!  I had the swordfish and would order it again. 5/5 Mac and Cheese was very rich but super flavorful and tasty. 5/5 Wine braised beef with mashed potatoes 5/5 Creme Brulee--warm and phenomenal 6/5  Love this place and can't wait to return

NBaqt47s7ISKhAi_VZButw.text: I came here for thanksgiving.   The good.   The patio was nice and had good ambiance.  Lots of heaters with the fire.     The bad.  For the $175 I dropped on 2 glasses of wine, a cheese plate and two thanksgiving dinners, I expected something transcendent.   I walked away feeling totally gypped as the food was no better than a run of the mill chain restaurant.  I'm a turkey snob and this was average at best.   The $15 glass of Pinot was so sweet I didn't finish it.   I asked for a cup of coffee and it came out cold.   Waiter still charged me for it anyway.  The soup was too sweet and not hot.  Strudel was fine.  Not stellar.  I can brine a much better turkey.    Ambiance 5 Service 3 Food 2 Quality 2 Value 1   I am still stinging over this experience.

6SXCCgVWTqUXye6ccX-ztw.text: Well honestly after been to many French restaurant in different places... this is the worst experience I have ever had.... almost zero service ( not sure if it is becuz we are Asian...) my server checked on the table during we having the main course n she asked if we got the appetizer yet... really... food also not so enjoyable. N I won't recommend the escargot... even someone who could not cook may did better job than that. Anyway I won't deny the view is very nice but really won't give this place a second chance.

KF_sIz79xoPhn0lokLKL1w.text: Be prepared to experience the shittiest customer service of your life! Lovely and elegant atmosphere however looks can be deceiving, it's as artificial and deceptive as the lake it sits by. As many similar reviews written on here were unfortunately very True!  Awful service, very slow, time consuming and definitely lost my appetite due to the extreme case of bad breath that our server had! You are now warned!

4LJRYxSdDEhasAHT72deeQ.text: Mache Bacchus is amazing.  Entering thru a fine wine shop, you can pick up something reasonably price.  Then, proceed to your table.  On the outdoor deck, you'll be treated to live music, and a spectacular view of the lake.  Although man made, you would never know.  Alas, I became fooled many of time.  This is particular a good choice for a romantic evening, or comfortable and nice enough for a group of friends for an afternoon.  Delightful.  I recommend the Steak Frites ($25), Moules Mariniere (mussels, $19), and the Roasted Chicken ($22).  Wonderful, wonderful place.  Also, it is miles from the strip, and provides ample parking.

TjpGY4_CFtdb-_h0NN9clw.text: We went for Easter , I know it's busy and people don't want to work, but, if there are 4 people at a table paying 20$ a piece for unlimited mimosas, please come back to the table of 10 that were also ordering bottles of wine more than twice in an hour. If we have to get up and serve ourselves, that's not acceptable. Before you judge, you weren't there!! After we did that Jordan didn't like us and let it be known, even though he did pay a little more attention to us, and I mean little!!  Lovely restaurant, don't go on a holiday!!  I'm also disappointed with the manager, he conveniently ignored our table after acknowledging all of the others around us. Shame on you...

4cTfBB004cAA3T2iLgniew.text: I've been here a few months ago and had the best spot in the restaurant! Such beautiful scenery and ambience. The service was impeccable and timing was perfect. Great selection of wine to choose from. They have a wine store which I loved. They displayed it beautifully and I was so in love with the set up. The dishes were well put together and flavors were memorable. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for any one who wants to go out on a nice date.

mKqPJQNG5JFMpN5ISs0taA.text: The food is excellent. They have a small wine shop out front and I think it is fun and a great value that you can walk around and choose a bottle to have at your table ($10 more than the retail price). Nice ambiance and the outdoor patio seating overlooking the lake is great. Looking forward to dining here again.

kPYqcdSqEEbcjZ_QF7Nqog.text: Lovely restaurant away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip. Romantic meal venue for special occasions or date night with your sweetie. First time there. Lovely meals and pretty patio overlooking a very pretty lake. Will definitely visit again next time I am in Las Vegas!

6psNpxI5VqoJNRCQ2gNfQg.text: Happily, we didn't experience the problems that we did at my birthday dinner here last year, probably because we went on a Tuesday night. We were seated right at the edge of the lake, with a beautiful view of a full moon and Jupiter (thanks, Android app!). We shared a bottle of the best Riesling ever, and also a warm spinach salad, with pancetta and a bread crisp spread with goat cheese - yum! Alas, the restaurant was out of the hanger steak that we - and every table around us - wanted to order. The waiter said they hadn't gotten their meat delivery today as planned. Instead, I had the Trout, which was served with a topping of crabmeat, haricots verts, and balsamic-soaked shallots. It had way too much salt for my taste, but I was going to keep it anyway. Instead, the waiter whisked it away, the owner, Jeff, came over and said that the kitchen would whip up a fresh one, with no salt at all added. And they did, quickly! Yes, the fish could have used a touch of salt, but not after I spread out that balsamic drizzle. It was absolutely delicious. My husband had the salmon, and it was also terrific. We had ordered - 30 minutes ahead, as required - the house special bread pudding with cinnamon sauce. Two other tables had birthday celebrants, and they had the usual candle and Happy Birthday jingle sung. My bread pudding was served sans candle, and no Happy Birthday song. Instead, the waiter got down on one knee, took my hand, and serenaded me with a very professional rendition of "La Vie en Rose!" Edith Piaf herself couldn't have done it better. The icing on the cake, so to speak, was that the house comped my birthday dessert, even after we presented our restaurant.com certificate. A far cry from last birthday's mess, when all the hassles and waiting produced nothing at all. All in all, it was a terrific dining experience, a wonderful dinner, and we're not going to wait a whole 'nother year to return.

peAc2036RG9IwDI-vuqmOA.text: Waitress was horrible and the food was just as horrible. Pretty bad experience for my friends birthday. Will not be coming back.

h7aMtPO76a40qw45BKLoNA.text: I was there last night with the most beautiful woman in the world. And we had a nice time. The place was great, good service and good food. Now if I can just talk her into getting married I will be a happy man.  Marche Bacchus est le meilleur!

DY_OXLveKYqsiVd01HRfIQ.text: I was extremely disappointed by this place. Went for Valentine's Day and wasn't aware that they had a fixed menu (wasn't on the site & the hostess didn't mention it when placing the reservation). $98 a person for a lackluster menu which included a salad, goat cheese and crackers and under cooked squash with a poorly seasoned filet. I would expect these prices on the strip but the quality paled in comparison for a restaurant across the parking lot from a Village Pub. Definitely not returning.

E-NsX5FFJ1ZoQYD-VOjzRQ.text: Once again, Marche delivers!  A delicious breakfast of eggs Benedict. One with smoked samon and the other with crab and asparagus. Beautiful morning on the patio with my hubby.

xEE2Op2jnoTvSHdRt6CRag.text: Jen was our server and treated us with respect and appreciated us being there. She accommodated to our requests and kept a pleasant attitude. We wanted a calm and  pleasant evening and she provided that. We had the closest seats to the water and loved the view. Wonderful food and we will be returning.

GjnsrXb0qt0SJmgejulE8Q.text: Marche Bacchus is an awesome restaurant from top to bottom. The atmosphere, the wine, the food & the experience all play into making it one of my all time favorites.The location is off-strip, located in Summerlin, positioned lake-side within a neighborhood. This gives a great ambiance, allowing you to disassociate from the city-life/fast pace of Vegas and really hone into having a relaxing evening with great food, wine & company. The wine store turns into a beautiful dining room, making it truly a unique experience to dine here. You have the option to pick out wine prior to seating, get up during your meal to pick-out more, and also purchase wine to go.   We dine here frequently off their a la carte menu, but especially love when they host events or wine dinners. Bastille Day was one of our favorite events, but most recently we dined here for the Freemark Abbey Wine Dinner on Thursday Jan 19th, 2017. The restaurant does wine dinners about once a month, really highlighting a specific winery & setting up a tasting menu to really highlight the wine, and showcase the level of cuisine at Marche Bacchus. This wine dinner was especially interesting because the restaurant is celebrating bringing in a new executive chef Tom Moloney.   The pairing was six unique glasses with four delicious courses:  1.) appetizer: Butter poached Maine lobster w/ heirloom tomatoes, popcorn shoots, sweet onion, red radish in a lobster sauce 2.) second course: Roasted Stuffed Quail w/ Foie Gras + exotic wild mushrooms  3.) third/main course: 28 day dry-aged Ribeye w/ marble potatoes, mushrooms in a cab sauv. reduction 4.) fourth course: Artisan cheese plate  Overall the meal, and pairing was absolutely fantastic. The Butter poached Maine lobster was an excellent portion of fresh lobster, really delicious and representing a umami in flavor.   The second course though, was my absolute favorite. I have never had the pleasure of eating quail before (first experience) and it was absolutely phenomenal. I loved the sizing of the bird & smallness of the bones within the wing. The cook was delicious, roasted to perfection and evenly stuffed with wild mushrooms & foie gras.  I was worried that because I enjoyed the quail so much the steak would lack in luster. I was VERY incorrect. The steak was perfectly cut and cooked, oozing with flavor and really diverse from the previous course/pairing. I absolutely loved the Cabernet Sauvignon reduction, and had only wished the potato portion had been more, or prepared as pommes puree to soak up the reduction & delicious flavoring.  The artisan cheese plate followed, consisting of a selection soft & mild cheeses. I prefer more obtuse bodied and aged cheeses, making this not my favorite of cheese selections. I loved, LOVED the idea of having cheese over a sweet desert, and adored the pickled peppers/onions so much I stole my boyfriends though!  We ended the meal with cappuccinos & an additional tasting of 1984 Freemark Abbey in the wine shop. Everyone seemed to enjoy themselves immensely, and conversation carried late into the evening. The owners Tom & Rhonda really know how to throw an awesome event, and run an outstanding food & beverage establishment. Can't wait till our next meal, and especially till the next wine dinner!

P_BDf6OODRWd9gKJQbw7KA.text: Went there with a party of 9.  I heard they had had some good press and according to the waitress had been overwhelmed with business.  The service was SO SLOW that we were there almost 4 hours and not by choice.  Not once did a manager or owner show up to offer an apology.  The food was better than average, however by the time we got our meals we would have thought a boiled work boot tasty.  I won't ever return but hope that they hire enough staff to give better service.  There are a ton of quality employees looking for jobs.  Hire some if business is so good!!

EUpA9E0_W2ngypI7yLNlmA.text: Finally! The meal I have been waiting for in Las Vegas.  Amazing atmosphere, delicious food, exceptional service, and a reasonable price tag. Do yourself a favor and eat here tonight! I will first reiiterate what others have said...the wine shop in the front is such a great idea.  The store has an excellent selection and something for every price range.  My one regret was that we had to drive home and I  couldnt enjoy this feature even more.   My boyfriend and I started with the beet salad.  It was light, flavorful, and beautifully presented.  I was impressed with how the chef paired the fish with the beets so succesfully.  For the entree my boyfriend had the cod.  It was smooth and buttery and served on a lovely pilaf.  I have to say my entree- a special that evening- was certainly the best.  Salmon with a wasabi creme sauce served over soba noodles with chunks of lobster...my mouth is watery just remembering it! We decided on the bread pudding for dessert and the 20 minute wait time gave us a chance to sober up before the drive home.  The pudding reminded me of my mom's - served piping hot with lovely hints of cimmamon and a delightfully sweet warm rum sauce (i think i could have drank that sauce as a cocktail!) Last but certainly not least...the atmosphere.  It was a breath of  fresh air to sit lakeside and watch the sun set as our spirits rose.  If you want a romantic, memorable, delicious dinner head to Marche Bacchus tonight!

6lIXu1B2_sDZOXayhDnz9g.text: Horrible!!!! Went yesterday with a group of friends for lunch. The waiter did not know the menu. He told me the turkey sandwich comes on a sub roll. When my sandwich came it was on bread with Rye. I do not like Rye. He took it away to remake it. Minutes later another person comes back with the same sandwich telling me it was not Rye, you could see the seeds all over the bread. I was told they were going to remake the entire sandwich. They take it away again to make it on white. When I finally got my sandwich it was not a "new" sandwich, they just put white bread on it. The sandwich is supposed to be hot, it was not. It was cold. Yuck! By the time I got my sandwich everyone had finished eating. I paid for a terrible sandwich that arrived after my friends had eaten. Very slow service!!!!  I have been here many times before with friends. This is my last time.

C_Dhq2EmfQl6JV3mcm5BgA.text: We have been going to MB from its opening as a wine store to lunch with 3tables to full inside/outside restaurant to top 10 in Las Vegas. The wine is good, priced right and the food is wonderful.

O_K_si2AkundTUFrrAo92A.text: Let me first start out with my gripe and get it off my chest so I can move on with my life (just kidding, kinda). So I made reservations about 6 weeks prior to Bastille Day, for brunch, we had a group of 10, so I wanted to make sure I gave plenty of notice (I'm a planner). I arrive the day of, led out to the patio area, and the hostess says, I'm so sorry, I thought we had the table ready. So I'm led to another area of the patio and seated. It's July 11, and when I made the reservation, I wasn't anticipating sitting outside, so I didn't bother requesting inside. I see there are quite a few people outside, and they had fans going, so I decided to toughen up and enjoy it (I love outside dining, just not when it's 108 degrees out). As we are sitting there, the misters would shoot on for 2 seconds and shut off, I asked our waitress if there was any way they could leave them on, she said they "were working on it". As the table is sitting there, all of us are dressed up, we are all dripping with sweat and having a hard time enjoying ourselves. As we are leaving, the hostess apologizes for the heat and asked us "did your waitress tell you what happened" we said no, she said a customer had decided to try and redirect one of the misters directly on him and it broke the entire system, the hostess then followed it up with "your waitress should've offered to move you girls inside". Little late now. Also, I had a restaurant.com voucher that I attempted to use, if anyone is familiar with those, they are very specific on the voucher about day, times, etc about when you can use them. My voucher only stated not valid on alcohol. So, they would not accept my voucher because they said their system is only set up to accept the vouchers for dinner (does not state this anywhere) the mgr claimed he has been meaning to contact them to correct it. That's my rant. The food. Our brunch was amazing. Every single dish. A few stand outs were, French Toast, Lobster Salad Croissant and of course the Croque Madame. The Creme Brulee was delicious, I attempted to get the bread pudding, but they were out of vanilla ice cream, and the waitress tried talking me into subbing mango ice cream instead, which sounded terrible together. I enjoyed my food enough to overlook the service issues we had and to come back and dine again.

--nV9-V3rpdIGUrea4_x9w.text: The ambience and surrounding area are very nice, right next to the small lake/pond. If you enjoy wine, they have lots and lots of it. The food was pretty good for brunch and not too pricey. The service was lacking a little bit in attention to detail (waitress would forget to refill waters and was very slow on checking back in with us for any needs) but overall I might go again.

rsjSFlScCDEu7y55rqru0w.text: Pros: red wine braised beef is amazing!!!, can pick bottle of wine from shop inside and bring to table, amazing wine selection, the two bottles we got were great!!, tomato bisque soho was delicious, serve was so helpful and friendly, we were able to move up reservation, patio seating was beautiful   Cons: none really.

21V8gMOM-bMRCb-251sALw.text: I want to start off by saying, don't waste your money going to this restaurant. I had made reservations several weeks ago for Mother's Day. We have gone to this restaurant a few times, just for the view of the water. The food is overpriced and just mediocre. I was very specific about where we wanted to be seated. When we arrived on time for our 7:00 p.m. reservation, the requested table was not available. The hostess was going to give us another table, which would of seated 6. There were only 3 of us. The owner, Jeff then refused to give us this table. The other tables offered by the other owner, Rhonda were not acceptable to my wife. This is not the first time we have had problems, but will definitely be our last. We ended up leaving and going to Echo & Rig in Tivoli Village, where our business is appreciated. I have been associated with the restaurant business sine 1972 and I must say the restaurant is a big disappointment. Just wanted to add that I wonder if the owners look at all the bad reviews. Apparently not, since they seem to go back for quite a while and nothing has changed.

xhh0mF4QBcfEqDNI4FommQ.text: Nice treat during my visit to Vegas (in Summerlin, 30 mins west of the strip). My friend (who lives here) has been dying to try this place. Our server, Marty, was very nice and made several suggestions. I ordered the scallops (on his recommendation) and they were delicious. Silver dollar-sized, perfectly seared, nestled on a bed of broccolini, sweet grape tomatoes, apricots, and capers. Delicious! I don't remember what the sauce was, but I wanted to lick the plate clean.  My friend had asked for a table by the water, and we were delighted by all the "wildlife" that came to the water's edge just a few feet from our table at the open window:  Five black swans, 2 turtles, and a mama duck with 13 babies! Yes, 13! They were so cute and fun to watch.   Birds flew in and out of the porch area where we sat. Not a problem per se, but there were droppings on the floor. :-/  We enjoyed our dinner and the "show" very much. The creme brulee was ordinary, and had a nice crunch to the top.   The food was a little pricey, but delicious. For two entrees, with no alcoholic drinks, plus bottled water and dessert, the bill was $90 before tip.

Q1jXv6VnnymZXhlTGRZFog.text: Marty is amazing. Initially we were his only table and he was appropriately attentive without hovering. He was knowledgable of the menu and wine store. He recommended a great bottle of on the road Grenache. Which paired well with our lobster pappardelle. While dining our flight was cancelled and Marty was just perfect. I mean perfect.   I couldn't have envisioned better service.   Great food. Great company. Great service. Been talking about this place for ten years and it lived up to all my stories.

5FdluToCWcuZN29aYX4AmA.text: I Hate long reviews, but I wanted to share my most recent experience here:  Went to have lunch last Saturday and BOY what a waste of time and money. I've been coming here for years and I know that it is a hit or miss most of the time. It was packed, which is fine, they were setting up for large parties, but we were severely neglected (even though we were one of like 7 tables seated). Our server looked like she was having the WORST day of her life, and I don't resent her for it, who know what's what.   We ordered Bloody Marys, which were basically shrimp cocktail sauce in a glass. I get using some horseradish in the mix, but the consistency and the flavor intensity was just straight up cocktail sauce. So disappointing because my man and I came a little hungover and were really looking forward to it. My pet peeve in restaurants is when stuff is sent out without anyone checking the food or doing a drink taste test. UGH!!!   I had a french onion soup. It came with a large crouton with cheese on top of it. It was extremely inconvenient to eat, I was struggling with that big chunk of bread, glued to the cheese for a while. Tasty though. I'd really recommend dropping a piece of toasted bread in the soup and baking the cheese over the bowl, it's what French Onion Soup is ALL about, the cheese factor! I mean Google the thing for F sake and you will see many amazing ways of presenting this awesome dish!   The bf had a blue cheese burger. He eats red meat like once in a year and was looking forward to it. Medium rare.... came out well done, extra dry and there was a very conservative drop of blue cheese on there. Meh.   I had a turkey sandwich with cranberry sauce. First bite was like biting into smelly fish. The turkey was completely spoiled. I thought it was just me (because of the night before), the bf did a taste test and we sent it back. There was no significant reaction from the server, like AT ALL. And 20 min later she comes by and says "I'll take that off the bill for ya okaaay?" Like she was doing us a favor. We both looked at her and said "uhh... yeah, you will!"   We noticed other patrons sending food back and the owner did absolutely nothing about coming over and talking to the guests or making apologies. Every time I see him, he just strikes me as a huge huge douche. And knowing this place (and many people who have worked here) he is and so is his wife. No wonder there is no enthusiasm in this place and why their employee turnover is so high. Shame.  Do yourself a favor, skip lunch and have a dinner here. Service will always be total sh*t, but it's great atmosphere for you and your love and if you stick to perhaps the cheese plate, the muscles and other simpler items, you will not be disappointed.

iqUQElJrnQE7z2K1cB9-GA.text: Update 2018:  we have not eaten here in a few years, since we moved our office location to a different part of town.  We decided to come for dinner because we missed coming here.  Very underwhelmed.  My bistro chicken was dry and the salmon was so tiny.  The waitress was super slow and it took a very long time to get our meal to the table.  Once we were done eating, our server was no where to be found.  A different server ended up clearing our table and bringing our check.  For the price, we probably will not come back .  Changed my star rating from a 4 to a 2 :(  2015: Husband and I have been coming here for years. Great wine selection and has a cool patio to sit at overlooking the pond. Sandwiches & salad are really good. The bread is fresh and crisp

PmQqSyN2efaCqVk_M8laTA.text: A definite neighborhood gem, a must visit.  We've been there many times but this time, I was incline to make note to everyone.  I needed a place to entertain some very close friends.  The view of the lake, service, food, and John topped off the wonderful evening.    It was during Restaurant Week but we decided to order off the regular menu.  John approached us and greeted us.  He was very friendly and extremely knowledgeable when it came to the menu.  He made some recommendations and we were happy to heed his suggestions.  We order several appetizers, entrees and shared everything family style.  I preordered a dessert for my guests since I had to leave in the middle of dinner.  I had informed John and he was more than able to accommodate.  I was a little concerned about how I was able to tender the payment, include his gratuity, and be able to depart, but John took matters into his own hands and put my mind at ease.  He even called me after to reassure me of the final bill and thanked us for coming in.  Very professional and very appreciated.   Everything from the moment we walked in to the time I left, was fantastic.  Everyone was engaging and seemed like they enjoyed their job and provide the service they did.  John was very attentive and extremely friendly, something that is somewhat rare these days!  Although I was amongst guest who did not drink, I was would be remised if I didn't mention their wine selection.  That in itself is definitely worth visiting for!  You can go shopping for a bottle of wine and then enjoy it at dinner or take it home, pretty awesome!  After conferring with my guest after dinner, they too really appreciated the service and told me that they most surely will return with friends and family.  The food and ambience at Marche has always been consistent but this time, the service was well above par.  I, we will definitely come back and visit John! Kuddos!

mF4lXvCbJsAeAjAVlt3l2g.text: Went here for lunch with my mom and sisters for my birthday ... It fell flat to me ... We barely were waited on and waited 15 minutes for water! Then finally we ordered white wine and it wasn't even cold! I had the croque madam and it was cold! We spoke to a manager and they didn't take care of anything on the bill but asked us to come back and give them another try ... No thank you

idOlhZKUfIUWZrAE92eCQw.text: Marche Bacchus is a very charming French restaurant (and wine store) right by THE WATER! Its dishes are tasty, service excellent, and the prices are on par with any mid-upscale bistro.  My wife and I had lunch and dinner with friends there a number of times. We like its sampler appetizer plate with several kinds of meats, pate, cheeses, olives, and preserves. Although this appetizer plate looks small, it is actually enough for 4 people to share over a drink. For entree, we love its scallops and duck dishes. For dessert, we like its popular bread pudding, which has a pleasing texture and not too sweet. The serving staff is very friendly and attentive. One evening, the restaurant was completely full, but our busy and efficient waiter (Justin) still managed to take good care of our table of 4!  Marche Bacchus is a must visit, at least for lunch on its gorgeous patio deck by the water in a hot Vegas day! Do ask for patio seating when making a reservation. But actually, its small, comfortable dining room is not bad either, the large windows do let you see a bit of the soothing water. My wife and I enjoy taking our out-of-town guests there. They are invariably amazed by the fact that such beautiful water ways exists in the middle of Vegas desert, and the restaurant is located in such a nice residential area by the water!  By the way, the front section of the restaurant is a medium size wine store. You can select a bottle of wine there for your table. Even after the corking fee, the wine is still a pretty good bargain!  - My only disappointment with Marche Bachus is that it does NOT offer Happy Hour! I'd have given it 5-Star, if only it offered happy hours!  Peterskis, June 2012 -----
